story:
Elson Auquel’s Journey to Breaking Inertia

In the year 2010, an earthquake hit Haiti and all our lives changed forever. My name is Elson Auquel and here’s my story. 

I graduated high school in 2013 but couldn't start college at the time due to unfavorable financial situations. I wanted to study Economic Science, but school was quite expensive in Haiti. I refused to be idle, so I started to volunteer. While volunteering, I dreamed. I dreamed of a life where every child from Haiti could be whoever they want to be.

First, I volunteered with Hands of Light and Action to help people from remote villages who had suffered from the 2010 Earthquakes. This saw me traveling distances of up to 40 minutes to an hour regularly to reach some of the earthquake-affected areas. I also volunteered with a few other organizations including the Caribbean Youth Environment Network in 2014, Florida A&M University Farmer to Farmer USAID Program (2015) and WhyFarm (We Help Youth Farm)  in 2016. 

I volunteer presently in a mission where I am helping teenagers find their purpose and passion in order to create a bright future for themselves and to make the world a better place to live. Volunteering has always been a huge part of my story. I believe that we all have a responsibility to bring compassion to a broken world.

I have had my fair share of failures and this has helped me to develop a more balanced view of work and enterprise growth. I failed at scaling 4 start-ups for which I was passionate but probably less informed and now better positioned to pursue. I have had the time to think deeply about what strengths I got from these experiences.

My failures led to a period of strong introspection and self-discovery. I discovered and started to build more on new skills and strengths that I discovered. I've had a reasonably demonstrated history of success in the marketing and advertising industry. Working in this industry exposed me to learning opportunities that helped me hone my skills in Customer Service, Public Speaking, Social Media Advertising, and Graphic Design. I also became a stronger business development professional through an associate degree in Agricultural Engineering, at the Universite Caraibe.

I am a storyteller, outbox thinker, and a change maker who believes anyone can accomplish whatever they want if they are willing to learn. With all this in mind, I have embarked on this book journey to "Breaking Inertia".

About Breaking Inertia

Breaking Inertia: Helping  Millennial keep their head Over and above the floods

"Breaking Inertia" is an open call to help save a generation that's in a hurry to succeed. How can anyone find success and happiness in a fast-paced digital generation that is stuck on instant gratification? This is a question that Breaking Inertia addresses through experiential, practical and story-driven narrative. My book seeks to enlighten, inspire and guide. You'd love reading the book and at the same time take away a lot of life-lessons that can be instantly applied to your life. My book focuses on the themes of success and happiness for the millennial youth. My book will publish in June 2020. 

I have divided Breaking Inertia into 3 parts: 

The first 8 Chapters - Helps to define the millennial's lifestyle and evolution into unhappiness. It answers the question, what has created this unhappy person? This dissatisfaction and discontent must be understood from the viewpoint of the millennial youth. 

The second 8 Chapters - Focused on industry & work culture. We need to understand the interaction between work and the person. What contribution does the workplace make into the lifestyle of the millennial and what can be fixed about this? Is there something about job expectation and career choices that makes life unbearable?

Third 8 Chapters - Discusses the power of relationships and personality in shaping the millennial's reality. What would it take to build better, happier relationships and persons? 

Introduction: Book Story

Breaking Inertia: Get Smarter Than The Trends 

BREAKING INERTIA answers the question of how we can achieve success and happiness in a fast-paced digital generation that is stuck on instant gratification. 

I grew up in Haiti where life was far from easy. This once beautiful Island was suddenly thrown into chaos and a lot of us had to live through challenges that so many millennials would be horrified to imagine. Growing up without my parents, I realized that life was not going to hand me any opportunities. However, I realized that I could take one step after another towards my dream life. Writing this book titled "Breaking Inertia" would be a great opportunity for me to provide answers to other millennial through my own experiences and those of key figures that have addressed the millennial questions of happiness and success. 

Every young person around now is desperately asking questions that a lot of us find difficult to answer. Why am I not happy? Why is life so hard? Why can't I get what I want? Why am I stuck? 

That young person is stuck on his phone waiting for notifications so they can be happy about their life and relationships that they don't have. They are waiting on the stock market, the e-commerce sales and other volatile industries in order to be successful. The millennial is told that unless he can make a million dollars instantly, then he is not yet successful. 

This has created a work culture that relies a lot on instant results in order to evaluate performance. Instant gratification makes sure that addictions are easily formed. With these addictions come a constant urge to win, or to get results that have not been invested in for a long time. You can see how this leads to more and more depressed and unhappy young people. 

Getting the millennial BREAKING INERTIA is a powerful vision that would transform a whole generation into stronger, healthier, happier people. 

BREAKING INERTIA is about discovering how millennials can be helped to achieve success and happiness in a fast-paced digital generation that is stuck on instant gratification. By buying into this project, you are giving thousands of young people an opportunity to live happier lives that will counteract addictions, depression, mental health struggles, trauma, and anxiety

What you Give and What I Give

Breaking Inertia will be self-published on Amazon. This means that by funding my book, you
automatically receive your copies of the book either by shipping or at the physical launch. The
money raised will cover the following cost items:


1. Editing, and Publishing. This is the editor's cost of reading my manuscript and working to
improve it to its best form before publishing it.
2. Designs: The designs for the book include the cover designs, 3D mock-ups which will be
used for promotions and social media. Some of these have been done on credit and as
such will have to be paid off.
3. Layout design and interior. The interior aesthetics of the book will be done to aid ease of
reading.
4. The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to
publication.
5. Promotion and marketing: I would be having physical and online launches of the book
which you would automatically be invited to attend. 

What You Give Me Through this Preselling?

1. The confidence to publish. My friends have listened to my stories and ideas and think that
BREAKING INERTIA  would be a great read. However, preselling gives me more of a morale boost.
2. I would be able to publish my book without the red-tape of searching for agents and
publishers.

3. This approach gives me the freedom to market and promotes my book the way I want to.

4. I find the fulfillment in knowing that there's a ready audience to read my book before
publishing.

5. It's a perfect opportunity to share my journey as an author with a community that shares
similar values and visions as I do.

I am also giving you some exclusive rewards for pre-ordering my book now:


You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish


           • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book or an email depending
           on how your book is delivered.

• Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with
Special Thanks to”)

• Beta access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the
opportunity to review it and give me early feedback. Your contribution might even be
featured as a special mention in the book.

• You'd also be part of the design and publishing process. Having a front-row seat means
that your contributions will be considered when picking the final design of my book or
suggestions from you could help improve these parts of my book.

• I will do a book seminar or webinar that you can join at a discount or for free. This would
make sure that you get an opportunity to learn about the writing process and understand
even more in-depth where my stories came from.

• Mentions in my press releases, social media handles and book site. During promotions,
I'd be honored to mention you as part of my support system for this project.

About the Author

My name is Elson Auquel. I was born in a small country side in Haiti and grew up in Port Au Prince.  I was born in Haiti but relocated to the U.S.A after much deliberations. I currently live in Orlando FL where I work as a customer service advocate and entrepreneur. I have had enough formal education to leverage on for success in the various spaces I have worked. 

I have seen first-hand that life demands much more than ease and comfort. I'd like to help my readers navigate some of their tough life experiences to the point of success. Thanks for taking time to read about my book project.  It was one of the tough decisions I had to make because it came with a lot of uncertainties. Having grown up without my parents, I had learned to make a lot of tough calls quite early in life. I believed God had and still has a purpose for me which he is achieving through my move to the U.S.A. Breaking Inertia is one out of those plans that I believe he has begun to unfold. 

As soon as I could apply myself to work, I had started to serve in various ways. I worked in the past with Wade Darius Former Democrat Congress Candidate for Orange County District 10. I managed their digital campaign and online presence. I also intern at the WATERING MINDS INC where I have provided the team with strategic consulting and serve in the fundraising. In January 2017, I founded Utula Consulting & Marketing to help people grow and scale profitable businesses. I helped people from several niches such as Roofing contractors, Realtors, Dentists, Chiropractors moving from traditional marketing and sales method to the inbound marketing system using Click funnels and Facebook Ads. I have worked for a while as Digital Marketer and E-commerce consultant, Account Manager, Fundraiser, and as Customer Relationship Manager.

In these past few years I discovered a lot of things about myself and the gifts God had given me. I believe that every human has a purpose and mine is to help millennial find true success and happiness in a world that has grown dangerously impatient. 

 

If you'd like to connect with me, you can reach me in the following ways

EMAIL: auquelelson@gmail.com

FACEBOOK: Elson Auquel 

INSTAGRAM: elson_stuck 

PHONE: 407 308 4623

Risk & Opportunities

The biggest risk for a book publishing project like this is the final delivery to my backers like you. I'll be self-publishing with Amazon which reduces this risk significantly. The Amazon print-on-demand services provides delivery to most countries. However, there might be disparity in the time it takes for delivery to various locations. I also plan to engage the services of popular logistic and delivery company for distributing to locations not covered by Amazon shipping. I have included the average cost of shipping through these various options in the backing values. This guarantees that everyone who backs my book project would get their books delivered within 3-7 days after launch. 

This book publishing and launch comes with a lot of learning opportunities which I would like to share with you. I will be recording every step of the process till completion so that I can share with intending authors who also back my project. The risks or challenges encountered will be documented to help others achieve the same or better results with less stress. 

Other Ways to Help

It's possible that you are unable to make a financial contribution to Breaking Inertia. This doesn't mean that you cannot be a part of the book project. Here are a few ways you can help my campaign:

  1. Share the book image and social designs from my book page on your status, stories, and broadcast messages to your friends and families. 
  2.  Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Use my hashtag #Breaking Inertia so that my marketing team can also reshare and repost. We can achieve more visibility for the book this way. 
  3.  Kindly share this Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  4.  Also, you can ask others to join in on the campaign. I would really appreciate your support. 

 

Thanks Again  

Elson Auquel

story:
Optimiser l'apprentissage de la guitare populaire (Blues, Jazz, Rock, etc.)

Vous souhaitez amener votre jeu de guitare au prochain niveau ? Vous êtes à la recherche de nouvelles manières d'approcher vos séances de travail instrumental ? Vous souhaitez stimuler votre motivation à prendre l'instrument ? 

Ce livre vous plaira à coup sûr !

Le parcours et les apprentissages de chaque musicien imposent une grande détermination, des cibles claires et une rigueur accrue afin de toujours progresser. Pour ce faire, tout musicien doit continuellement se questionner sur la façon dont il investit ses heures de travail instrumental. Sans une telle approche, il risque d’assimiler par inadvertance de mauvaises habitudes qui lui seront difficiles à corriger et qui pourront même le démotiver. Ainsi, pour donner suite à la lecture d’ouvrages scientifiques et non scientifiques au sujet de la performance ainsi qu’à la lumière de nombreux témoignages d’experts et musiciens professionnels au sujet de l’apprentissage, j’ai décidé d’écrire une méthode exposant différents concepts qui permettent d’optimiser les séances de travail instrumental. Je présente en complément plusieurs exercices pour l’apprentissage de la guitare.

À qui s’adresse cette méthode ?

  •  À ceux qui ont l’impression de mettre beaucoup d’heures à répéter, mais qui ne sentent pas que leurs progrès sont équivalents à leurs efforts ;
  • Aux amateurs de guitare qui souhaitent approfondir leur connaissance et qui souhaitent restructurer leur travail instrumental afin de le rendre plus efficace tout en ayant des concepts à travailler ;
  • À ceux qui visent le niveau collégial et universitaire et qui souhaite s’y préparer ;
  • Aux musiciens plus expérimentés qui souhaitent réfléchir à leur manière d’aborder le travail instrumental afin de voir s’il serait possible de l’optimiser davantage ;
  • Aux enseignants qui cherchent de nouvelles manières d’aider leurs élèves à cheminer ;
  • À tous les curieux et passionnés de guitare qui désirent optimiser leur travail instrumental.

Sur le marché, on retrouve une grande quantité de méthodes de guitare présentant une panoplie d’exercices à travailler. Toutefois, rares sont les ouvrages dans lesquels on explique comment aborder et intégrer efficacement ces exercices à une routine de travail instrumental. Cette méthode propose non seulement plusieurs exercices, mais a aussi pour but d’éclairer les musiciens sur leur démarche d’apprentissage. Ainsi, il ne s’agit pas d’une méthode progressive où il faut maitriser un exercice avant de passer au suivant. Je vous propose donc d’en faire une lecture complète en identifiant les éléments qui se prêtent le mieux à votre contexte actuel. Au besoin, vous pourrez y revenir ultérieurement et saisir d’autres éléments tout au long de votre cheminement.

Bonne lecture !

Le grand défi :

Suite à plusieurs heures de réflexion, de recherches, d'écriture et de mise en page, je suis maintenant convaincu que le contenu de ce livre pourra aider plus d'un musicien à optimiser son travail instrumental. L'un des grands défis pour moi est par rapport à la mise en marché. Sans un contrat d'édition, il est très dispendieux de rendre le livre accessible partout sur internet. Avec les fonds de cette campagne, je pourrai non seulement produire le livre en copie physique, mais aussi le rendre accessible à travers le monde sur les points de vente populaires tels qu'Amazon.

Merci à tous de m'encourager dans ce projet et j'espère sincèrement que ce livre vous donnera tous les outils et la motivation pour apprendre de façon optimale.

An Oak of Righteousness: Grafting the Seeds of Destiny into the Root of Covenant is the natural progression of the Scripture from Isaiah 61 that Jesus read with authority in the synagogue after coming out of the wilderness empowered by Holy Spirit (Luke 4). The apostles and disciples of that day changed the course of nations as they were sent out to Judea, Samaria and the ends of the earth after the Holy Spirit also fell upon them. In 1988, at the end of a series of unfruitful evangelism outreaches in the neighborhoods she served, Yvonne cried out to the Lord in heart-wrenching desperation to see this level of transformational power released once again. This book, this “scroll”, is His answer to her prayers. It draws a clear picture of the Lord’s battle strategy for citywide and regional transformation applicable to every nation. His strategy includes the use of our ancient weapons of warfare: worship, prayer, spiritual gifts, especially prophecy, and angelic help. At its foundation is the truth that the Lord cares deeply about us both individually and corporately. And He made a promise to us through Covenant, so He has a plan!

Just as with John the Revelator in Revelation 10, there was a season that the message of this “scroll” was to be hidden; but now it is the message that the Lord gave Yvonne to “prophesy!” This “scroll” contains threads that are reminiscent of the Book of Acts, and the times of Abraham, Joseph, Moses, Esther, Nehemiah and other heroes of the faith. It interweaves a journey through time with profound supernatural encounters with key historical events and people. And it contains the elements - the fire, the wind, the rain - seen in every Great Awakening, as it ends with an open vision she had of angels sounding trumpets to awaken first His “generals and military leaders.”

 

Come, and take a walk with Yvonne through her “scroll” of living testimonies. Whether you have already been serving the Lord, or this is His 11th hour call to you to labor with Him in His harvest fields, the trumpets are sounding! This is His clarion call for you to awaken, arise, repair, rebuild, reform and transform neighborhoods, cities and nations—it’s time!

story:
Resumen del proyecto

Soy Mariana Babarovic, chilena, diseñadora gráfica editorial, actualmente me dedico al arte y la botánica. Este proyecto es producto de al rededor de tres años de trabajo, registro fotográfico, investigación, recolección de información y edición. Esta publicación cuenta con el apoyo de Ladera Sur (plataforma dedicada a la naturaleza con la cual colaboro) y el Museo Nacional de Historia Natural quienes me facilitaron el acceso a su herbario y me permitieron incluir algunas imágenes en este libro. Ellos son mis patrocinadores. La edición del libro estará a cargo de Marcela Kahler y la Editorial Velero.

Toda la información que hay en este libro, tomó forma después de un par de años de una voracidad botánica que me mantuvo alejada de mi trabajo de diseñadora y me capturó con una urgencia vital. Fue un cambio de cabeza que me obligó a tomar conciencia y entonces decidí darle forma a esta publicación para materializar mis propios intentos por "entender" la naturaleza. Para mí tiene mucho sentido que todo este período de reflexión e investigación termine en un libro, porque es lo que siempre he hecho como diseñadora gráfica y considero que son objetos fundamentales en la cultura y la construcción de imaginarios.

 

La importancia de esta publicación

Creo que el contenido de este libro y su estructura narrativa lo hacen especial. Concebirlo como una obra visual ha sido importante, me ha dado soltura de pensamiento y he podido narrar esta historia acudiendo a todos los lenguajes que me han parecido necesarios. Genero contenido, edito y diseño al mismo tiempo; esta coincidencia ha posibilitado una libertad narrativa que sería imposible de otra manera y que estoy segura ayudará a hacer de este libro un objeto distinto.

Los textos que encargué y los autores que contacté reflejan mis búsquedas. Ellos son personas con que me he encontrado a raíz de lecturas, estudios o sensibilidades en común, todos relacionados con la naturaleza de una u otra manera: Alejandra Vega, doctora en Historia, escribió sobre el Códice Badiano; Kester Bull, botánico, está escribiendo sobre el trabajo taxonómico y la evolución de las especies; Catalina Valdés, doctora en Ciencias Sociales, escribe sobre las biogeografías y Jorge Mpodozis, Neurobiólogo de la Universidad de Chile, sobre naturalismo y percepción. 
También habrá un texto mío que sirve de introducción. 

Estoy trabajando para que este objeto sea una bitácora de viajes mentales y físicos, un ayuda memoria que vincula mi propia biogeografía con los imaginarios colectivos de nuestra historia.

Este libro se imprimirá en imprenta Ograma, con ellos he trabajado toda la vida como diseñadora, son personas con las que tengo una larga relación de confianza y se especializan en proyectos de alta calidad. 

 

Te ofrecemos recompensas para agradecer tu ayuda

Los fondos solicitados serán destinados a la impresión del libro, los honorarios de los escritores y la editora y al pago de derecho de uso de imágenes. La suma total es de US$15.000.- (diez millones de pesos).

Mi manera de agradecer a los colaboradores será incorporando todos sus nombre en la página de agradecimientos para que siempre estén presentes junto a mi trabajo! Quienes aporten US$15 serán mencionados al interior del libro. Para quienes aporten 40 dólares, además, les enviaré una postal con un agradecimiento personal. Quienes aporten 100 dólares, recibirán una serigrafía a dos colores, de 21 x 28 cm., numerada y firmada. Finalmente, los que colaboren con US$260 podrán recibir un ejemplar del libro firmado.
Si sucediera que no logre juntar todos los fondos, postularé al financiamiento del Fondo del Libro (financiamiento estatal) para obtener el saldo que me falte. 
Los primeros fondos que reciba se destinarán a pagarle a los escritores, la editora y a los derechos de uso de imágenes. Es básico partir cumpliendo el compromiso con las personas.

 

Riesgos y desafíos

Hay que reconocer que el monto de este proyecto implica un gran desafío, es por eso que  paralelamente estamos buscando auspicios para, por ejemplo, conseguir el papel. Hay muchos medios para juntar fondos y estamos apelando a todos ellos.

 

Otras maneras de ayudar

Si no estás en un buen momento y no puedes hacer una contribución económica, puedes ayudarnos con difusión, compartiendo esta campaña por redes sociales, contándole a la mayor cantidad de gente posible, mandando mails a tus conocidos, etc. Indiegogo tiene varias herramientas para compartir información!

story:
Short Summary

 

Hi, I'm Jason. I'm the author of this series and other projects. Ghost Story is my second full length novel and will be the second title under the Gestalt Media banner.

(https://www.Gestalt-Media.com).

I've been writing seriously for a little over ten years now and since Watcher has received such a warm welcome I'm following that up with this story. It's a spookier, darker, more intimate tale aimed at confronting the things we all try to leave behind and what happens when the dead refuse to stay buried.

 

This is something I've been holding close to the vest since I began writing seriously. Watcher was the first book that was ready to come out and was the first to get published because of that but Ghost Story is the one I've been waiting to put down more than anything else. It means the world to me and the future volumes will explore things I've been excited to bring to the world for a very long time. First we have to get out there and let Ghost story: The Road Home get the journey started.

 

Contribution to this campaign means I can finally bring these characters to life in the way I originally envisioned. It's more than the design and formatting (which is a huge bonus) it covers licensing fees and the cost of procuring rights to other creator's projects that play a key role in the story's development. On my own, this would be a very tall task so you guys really are vital to what I'm doing here.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Breaking in down into more detail:

The funding breaks down pretty easy. As an indie author costs associated with producing a quality novel are high and we count on sales to cover those costs. Sometimes sales fall short, sometimes they take years to recoup. With funding out the door from generous supporters like yourself we can cover things like:

Formatting: The cost of creating a proof with proper indentation, alignment, font design, page collation, etc.

Design: This includes original cover artwork, layout and aesthetic decisions

Set-up fees: Printers require fees to set up new titles

Rights Procurement: Anytime an author uses someone else's work in their creation it requires a licensing fee or a royalty payment.

Proofs: Final test copies to ensure the highest quality final product.

 

All of this gets done and you get exclusive access to the project, special backer only perks and the chance to become part of the project itself.

 

Perks

 

I'm really excited about some of the perks we're offering. For starters, every backer to this project is going to get an ebook copy of Ghost Story. It's a great story and everyone will get to enjoy that. Also every single backer will be included on the acknowledgements page because without you this really wouldn't be possible.

Next, I'm also including my first novel, Watcher in ebook and autographed paperback editions at most levels of funding so you can have the complete set. Watcher is receiving a new cover as we speak for those editions will have a new look and feel as well.

Something else I'm super excited about is a novella that all early backers receive for signing up to our newsletter but you can get in the higher tiers as well. Apt. 5 is another ghost story but with a twist. This was written while I lived in Norfolk in the Ghent district off the Chesapeake Bay and is based entirely on true events. The few that have read it have been justifiably creeped out. I think you'll love it too.

Some other less conventional perks involve bridging the gap between creator and the you, who make these projects possible. With that in mind I'm offering four tiers.

The Postcards from the Road tier includes all the items from the earlier levels and the backer will receive personalized postcards from the novel's main characters at various locations on their journey. These will come over the following months, each with a new destination and a comment from the characters. 

The next tier includes all of the lower tier novels and ebooks plus an opportunity to chat with the author (me) live via Skype. Ask any questions you have about the book, the process, my favorite pizza dough recipe, anything on your mind. I'd love to talk with you!

Ever want to be in print? This is your chance. For two lucky backers, I will capture your likeness and name and include you as a character in an upcoming volume of the series. You might be a ghost, you might be a disgruntled neighbor, you might save the day. Who knows but you'll live on forever, immortalized in the pages of great fiction.

The final tier is one I'm very excited about and hope one of you takes me up on. In this perk, the backer gets to pick one of the six destinations highlighted in Ghost story and meet me there (airfare included) where we'll spend the day visiting locations mentioned in the book, discussing how that destination inspired the story and probably having a few drinks, sightseeing, etc. It's a great opportunity to visit a killer location and add a unique flavor to the story, going behind the scenes if you will.

 

Locations are:

Asheville

New Orleans

Key West

Virginia Beach

Phoenix

Portland

 

Funding

 

So what happens if we don't get funded? Thanks to the creator friendly platform offered by IndieGoGo even if we don't reach the full goal, this project still has the green light. We're going through with it. Whatever perks you've chosen are yours and I will do everything in my power to produce this at the highest possible quality and on time, with a release date of early September. Obviously that will be a lot easier with your support and I thank you so much for doing that.

 

The Impact

 

Backing this project will bring to life a project that has been very important to me personally for a very long time but also it sets off a series that will run for the foreseeable future. The first three books in the Ghost Story series have been plotted and I see great potential to expand even farther beyond that. That means a lot of new places to explore plus a lot of lore and myth to drag into the light and the chance to watch Justin as he progresses through this new life he's chosen, seeking out what haunts him the most.

 

Risks & Challenges

Nothing in life is without risk but to be completely honest with this project they are very low. IndieGoGo is a flexible platform so whatever funds we raise will go directly into the project, bringing it into the world on time and looking great when it arrives. The story itself is nearing completion. I will begin early edits while the campaign is still running and will start conversing with my designer about the cover and interior concepts soon after. By the time the campaign ends the final manuscript should be out to an editor, cleaning up the text and getting ready for proofing. 

Everything is on track to progress right on time. Things do happen but should such a situation occur everyone will receive frequent updates on the updated timeline.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Contributions are what we're all about here but if you can't that doesn't mean you can't help get this project off the ground. I truly appreciate every share and like you can provide. Social media is a powerful tool and your help spreading the word means more than you could ever know.

story:
AN INTRODUCTION

In Leaving (& Finding) Jesus, Jason Clark shares his de/reconstructing Emmaus Road faith journey, where he has discovered lasting joy, peace, a confident assurance for today, and hope for the future.

Jason is a bestselling storyteller who writes to reveal the transforming kindness of the love of God in a world traumatized by the religious abuses done in the name of the love of God. 

With grace and humor, Jason juxtaposes an inclusive, reconciling, self-giving view of God's love against an excluding, hierarchal, punishment-focused view of God's love.

Based on scripture, recent studies, personal and shared stories, church history, and Jason’s experience as a pastor and relational theologian, Leaving (& finding) Jesus encourages readers to stop building their faith upon the broken foundations of a transactional view of God, and instead, embrace the self-giving love of God that truly transforms our lives and our world.

This book focuses on one life-changing, joy-inducing, world-reconstructing thought; that nothing, absolutely nothing, not life or death, powers or authorities, not present or future, not our understandings, beliefs, systems, or actions, nothing separates us from the reconciling love of God.

 

WHY A PRE-SALES CAMPAIGN?

Writing a book is an expensive undertaking. Forget the years it takes to write it, there's editing, cover art, and book design, printing, publishing, and marketing.

Because I've been writing for years, I've developed relationships within the publishing world. With my experience and these connections, I can create this book at a lower cost. That means I can finish writing, and produce the book for  --

  • 10,000 (approximately 500 copies pre-sold) provides for editing, cover design, and printing enough copies to fulfill the pre-orders and set the book up with booksellers for future sales within the US.

This pre-order campaign will be a HUGE jump start for this book and message, and also give you a discounted price and early access to the book. It's a win-win!

By contributing to this book project, you'll not only be personally encouraged and empowered to live and love with abandon, but you'll also help thousands of others be encouraged and experience abundant life as well. 

 

HOW TO PARTNER? 

  • Buy a book or 2 or 5 or 50.
  • Help promote. Share on all your social media platforms.
  • SIGN UP to The Book Launch Team and commit to posting prepared videos, memes, articles, and quotes on your social media, 2 to 3 times a week between July 26th and, Aug 22nd, AND RECIEVE a FREE digital copy of God Is (Not) In Control.

 

WHO IS JASON CLARK?

Jason is a writer, speaker, producer, and lead communicator at A Family Story.

For over twenty-five years Jason has served in pastoral roles as a Worship Leader, Family Pastor, and Associate Pastor.

He has authored several books including, God Is (Not) In Control, and, Prone To Love.

He has ghostwritten bestsellers and co-written several books, most notably with authors, Donald Miller, The Open Table, and Mark Batterson, Surrendered & Untamed; A Discipleship Guide. 

Jason, with his brother, Joel, has written film projects that span, TV, documentaries, and features.

Jason is the co-host of Rethinking God with Tacos PODCAST. Launched in 2020, it is approaching 100,000 downloads.

A natural storyteller, Jason writes with humor, authenticity, and revelation. His writing inspires wonder and trust in the goodness of God, and his insight into scripture is fresh, hopeful, and life-changing. Jason’s passion is to reveal the transforming kindness of the love of God in a world traumatized by the religious abuses done in the name of the love of God. 

He and his wife, Karen, live in North Carolina with their three children, Madeleine, Ethan, and Eva, and their dog, Indigo.

 

THE MESSAGE

The gospel so many of us grew up with? The good news most of us Westerners know by heart? At its very foundation, it has been built upon a Father who abandons His Son in His greatest moment of need, on a cross.

Separation is a core conviction for most Christians today, for many, our faith is built upon a God who leaves.  A Father who looks away is in our songs and our children’s bibles.

But God did not look away (read more).

The idea that God leaves, rejects, or abandons His creation is a myth nearly as old as time. Separation is a lie passed down through the ages and woven into the very fabric of religious thinking. And specifically today, Western Evangelical Christian thinking.

A God who leaves has been propagated by mostly well-intentioned preachers, which has led to dualistic, behavior-focused, hierarchal, thinking. And has ultimately empowered great abuses in the name of God's love.

But there is a fresh de/reconstructing movement taking place within the church. Christians are repenting, they are leaving the abandoning God and all the fruits thereof. They are leaving the angry, retributive Jesus they have been taught about for generations, and realigning with the self-giving reconciling Jesus so powerfully revealed on a cross. 

Sixty-five million adults in the U.S. have dropped out of active church attendance and about 2.7 million more are leaving every year. Christians are re-thinking what they've been taught about Christianity, the Bible, and what it means to be a follower of Jesus.

And though this can feel scary and unsettling, and while many leaders are concerned, I believe this is a good and holy thing! And it is my hope this book encourages and empowers us to de/ and reconstruct well.

The gospel of Jesus has been beautifully expressed in 2 Cor 5:19 "God was in Christ reconciling the world to himself, not counting our sins against us."

On a cross, Jesus said, "Father, forgive them, for they know not what they are doing. Luke 23:34

Then, before His last breath, "It is Finished”

And the veil that represented humanity's enslavement to separation thinking was forever torn. The problem of separation and the fruits thereof were forever settled.

There is no veil between heaven and earth, no veil between God and humanity, God is with us, God is for us, God is within us!

The good news is that there is no shadow of turning, there is no separation in the nature of God. And this book dives headlong into what that means for today.

This book starts at the cross where we exchange a retributive God lens for reconciliation, separation for inclusion. Following the Emmaus Road journey, the book then confronts the church’s participation in dualistic thinking and invites the reader to rethink our approach to scripture, sin, hell, and injustice.

Reconciliation is who God is, oneness and belonging is the finished work of the cross, and all humanity is invited to awaken to this reality.


THE BOOK TRAILER

 

THIS BOOK CONFRONTS

For too long Christians have been taught to build their faith upon the trust compromising belief in a God who leaves. This has led to,

  • a dualistic, for or against thinking, that practices exclusion, and is used to justify violence, control, racism, sexism...
  • a retributive view of God that defines hell as God's ultimate form of justice.  
  • a hierarchal elitist approach to leadership that is complicit with rampant spiritual and emotional abuse.
  • an inability to release reconciliation or speak authentically to issues of inequality.
  • a spirituality that condemns anyone who does not hold to an unwavering defense of the doctrine of biblical inerrancy.
  • an institutional approach to community that is unaccepting of differences in beliefs, cultures, socioeconomic backgrounds, religions, or races and promotes isolation and tribalism.

 

THIS BOOK IMPACTS 

I believe this book will have a profound impact on the

  • millions of Christians who are exhausted by the politics of nationalism, socialism, or any other ism; the ‘for or against,’ paradigm that seems to rule and define the Christian narrative today.
  • those spiritually moving from a transactional approach to God defined by adhering to a set of beliefs, and moving toward a relational approach to God defined by self-giving love.
  • those who are theologically rejecting the image of God as a violent, retributive, controlling Being, and embracing the image of God as the kind, reconciling and renewing Spirit at work within us and our world for good.
  • the faithful followers of Jesus who no longer identify with organized religion but are passionate about the work of reconciliation.

       

      A BRIEF EXCERPT

      For those unfamiliar with my writing...

      I am not a systematic theologian with letters in front of his name. I am a relational theologian; a son, a husband, a father, a brother, a friend – I am loved and I love. 

      In this book I have not written about God's reconciling nature through a rigid systematic lens, I have written through the lens of relationship. I don't approach God through disciplines, ethics, and the dogma of religious thought; I approach God as an adored son of my Father, a beloved brother of Jesus, an intimate friend of Holy Spirit.

      I have written to share what I am discovering about the perfection of God's love that you might be empowered to grow in your own discovery of God's love.

      Below is an excerpt from the book.

       

      LEAVING JESUS (article form)

      “I am ready to leave Jesus,” she said in an almost threatening way.

      I was talking to a friend over the phone. This was nearly the first thing she said at the beginning of a two-hour conversation in which she railed at God for her broken circumstances, deep sorrows, and vast disappointments. She was in incredible emotional pain, a drowning woman thrashing about for something solid to save her, something good, something she could trust, something better than the seemingly indifferent and controlling God she was so angry with. She was devastated and ready to leave her faith.

      I listened. I have been in many such conversations over the years.

      In these moments I’ve learned it’s not my role to fix things, it’s to simply listen with compassion, hope, and love.

      “Holy Spirit, guide my heart and thoughts with your affection.” I prayed quietly and I waited.

      In forty-six years of walking with my best friend Jesus, I have plenty of life-changing principles I can pass along; good and wise words. But when someone is drowning in an existential crisis, wise words won’t save them, only love revealed can meet this kind of desperation.

      And I’ve learned love wins, love always saves.

      Somewhere near an hour and twenty minutes, she came full circle. Like a lawyer who had systematically laid out the evidence that supported her case, she began her closing arguments by repeating her opening thesis. Flailing but exhausted, she stated again, “I am ready to leave Jesus.”

      There was a pause. Just enough of a pause.

      “I think you should,” I said.

      My response wasn’t what she expected and I think it both terrified and further angered her.

      “What!” desperation tinged her voice.

      I responded, “The Jesus you have been talking about, he’s killing you, I think you should leave him.”

      She was quiet for a moment, then, “What are you saying to me?”

      “The Jesus that reigns down pain and disappointment to teach you something about his love, the behavior obsessed Jesus who uses shame to manipulate you into doing what he wants, the abusive Jesus you have been describing to me for more than an hour, I think you should leave him. Personally, I left that Jesus a long time ago…

      I left the angry justice Jesus who demands retribution for all my sins, who practices distance and separation until I say ‘sorry.’ The Jesus who releases condemnation every day and twice on Sundays, who gets his glory through some form of eternal conscious suffering, yeah we’re no longer friends.

      The narcissist Jesus that sits on a throne reveling in my desperate prayers and the insecure worship songs that highlight my need, the controlling Jesus who loves to compare my weakness to his strength, we haven’t hung out in years.

      The fickle bi-polar moody Jesus who is happy one day and depressed the next, we don’t even text.

      The Republican or Democrat Jesus, the political Jesus, we wouldn’t even share a cab.

      I left the unkind, ungenerous, short-tempered, judgmental, punishing Jesus many years ago…”

      Yeah, I didn’t give my drowning friend such an extensive list of all the Jesus’ I’ve left, but she got it, she knew the truth when she heard it. Why, because God is love and we are His beloved; because God is a Father and we are His kids; because you recognize Truth as you are being set free.

      The rest of our conversation was spent on discovering, and choosing to believe in, an always good, always restoring, always forgiving, never leaving or forsaking, mercy extending, grace transforming Jesus.

      I believe we are all on a journey of discovering God; the Triune God that is perfectly revealed through Jesus on a cross reconciling all humanity to Himself not counting our broken thoughts and beliefs about Him against us.

      The list of Jesus’ I have left, some folks refer to it as deconstruction or rethinking, or reimagining. Jesus referred to it as repenting.

      Repent, change the way you think because the Kingdom is within reach, even closer still, it is within you. (See Matt 3:2 & Luke 17:20)

      Repent, exchange the way you think about God with how God thinks about Himself as revealed through Jesus.

      Repent, see yourself and your neighbor the way your heavenly Father does.

      Repent, He is better than you think, so keep awaking to better thoughts.

      I continue to leave my ego-driven Jesus. I continue to leave the Jesus made in the image and likeness of my broken experiences or some preachers fear; the prescribed Jesus of a rebellious fallen mindset. And the more I repent the more clearly I recognize the good news, the gospel; God is love and Jesus never leaves.

      Nothing separates me from His love, His great affection, peace, joy, hope, righteousness, forgiveness, grace (see Rom 8).

      God is love, so every time I leave my ego-driven, fear-based, shame-focused Jesus, I discover more fully a transforming intimacy with the Jesus that never leaves…

       

      RISKS AND CHALLENGES

      Regarding hitting my early 2022 deadline.
      Since COVID, ghostwriting has become a primary source of income. I am currently ghostwriting a book with another project on the horizon. If we pre-sell enough to hit the $10,000 goal, I am hopeful my agent, The Fedd Agency, can find this book a publishing deal. That publishing deal would provide a writing advance and would allow me to then commit all my writing time to finish the book within the February 2022 deadline.

      However, if we fall short of $10,000 (500 copies pre-sold), I will still push toward that 2022 Feb deadline, but would likely have to split my writing time between this book and another ghostwriting project. That could mean a longer wait for the book release.

      Regardless, the book is over half-written, fully outlined, and I am committed to finishing and releasing it as soon as possible.

      This book is a passion project, my best yes to my best friend, Jesus. And so, I have written it on spec, or, by faith. But now I am ready and honored to invite you to join me in reaching the finish line.

      God Bless!
      Jason Clark
story_txt:
AN INTRODUCTION
In Leaving (& Finding) Jesus, Jason Clark shares his de/reconstructing Emmaus Road faith journey, where he has discovered lasting joy, peace, a confident assurance for today, and hope for the future.
Jason is a bestselling storyteller who writes to reveal the transforming kindness of the love of God in a world traumatized by the religious abuses done in the name of the love of God. 
With grace and humor, Jason juxtaposes an inclusive, reconciling, self-giving view of God's love against an excluding, hierarchal, punishment-focused view of God's love.
Based on scripture, recent studies, personal and shared stories, church history, and Jason’s experience as a pastor and relational theologian, Leaving (& finding) Jesus encourages readers to stop building their faith upon the broken foundations of a transactional view of God, and instead, embrace the self-giving love of God that truly transforms our lives and our world.
This book focuses on one life-changing, joy-inducing, world-reconstructing thought; that nothing, absolutely nothing, not life or death, powers or authorities, not present or future, not our understandings, beliefs, systems, or actions, nothing separates us from the reconciling love of God.
 
WHY A PRE-SALES CAMPAIGN?
Writing a book is an expensive undertaking. Forget the years it takes to write it, there's editing, cover art, and book design, printing, publishing, and marketing.
Because I've been writing for years, I've developed relationships within the publishing world. With my experience and these connections, I can create this book at a lower cost. That means I can finish writing, and produce the book for  --

10,000 (approximately 500 copies pre-sold) provides for editing, cover design, and printing enough copies to fulfill the pre-orders and set the book up with booksellers for future sales within the US.
This pre-order campaign will be a HUGE jump start for this book and message, and also give you a discounted price and early access to the book. It's a win-win!
By contributing to this book project, you'll not only be personally encouraged and empowered to live and love with abandon, but you'll also help thousands of others be encouraged and experience abundant life as well. 
 
HOW TO PARTNER?  

Buy a book or 2 or 5 or 50.

story:
Overview

This campaign is to launch the children's book I Love Grandma's House: A Biracial Girl and Her Two Special Worlds. This story is written at a vocabulary level appropriate for young elementary school children. We are launching this campaign to help with printing, distribution, donations to local libraries and marketing.

 

 

About the Story

I Love Grandma’s House is the story of little Sage thinking of all the fun things she does with each of her grandmothers. Grandma Linda has rich brown skin and wears fancy clothes, Grandma Kathy has fair skin and a beautiful smile. Sage is told Grandma will pick her up from school but she forgot to ask which one! All day she thinks about the wonderful adventures she’s had with her grandmas and wonders who will pick her up.

 

Why This Story Matters

This book isn’t just sweet and charming, its important. So few children’s books featuring diversity go beyond the notion that its okay to be different. In this story Sage knows she’s different and never thinks anything of it. Each of her grandmothers explains the word biracial to her in their own way so she has the vocabulary to describe her life.

 

I believe this distinction has value because if little black and brown children only see themselves in books reassuring them its okay to be different, they aren’t given room to explore and relate to storytelling beyond that point.

The Authors

My Grandma Linda and I had the idea for I Love Grandma’s House when I was just seven years old. Now, eighteen years later we’re making that dream a reality. She and I co-wrote the story and I illustrated it.

 

The Illustrator

I was raised in a family of musicians, singers, and actors, so I round out the picture as the family illustrator. Working with oils, acrylics, gel mediums, wood, and found objects, I move from vision to execution with whatever materials strike me in that creative moment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share! Share! Share! The only way this book won't be a hit is if no one knows it exists. Sharing this campaign with your friends, family, or social network has a massive impact that we greatly appreciate.

Thank You

To Angie Ngo for doing an extraordinary job researching, marketing, and building the website for the book.

Thank you also to dribbble.com/bhony_bharath and Pixeden.com for the photoshop mockup template. graphicgoogle.com/free-brand-book-mockup-for-cover-presentation/

 

Connect With Us

You can learn more about me at my website sagemagee.com

or connect with us at facebook.com/ILoveGrandmasHouse

Thank you also to dribbble.com/bhony_bharath and Pixeden.com for the photoshop mockup template. graphicgoogle.com/free-brand-book-mockup-for-cover-presentation/
 
Connect With Us
You can learn more about me at my website sagemagee.com
or connect with us at facebook.com/ILoveGrandmasHouse

story:
What's all this, then?

Grab your dice or lightsabers and suit up, folks: we're now casting for key players in COSGRRRL's triumphant entrance into the glorious world of print, with its first ever five issue series: Elemental. Part literary magazine, part pop culture manifesto, and illustrated just enough to engage the third grade reader in you, COSGRRRL is on a mission. To fight evil. To geek out. To save the world.

Haven't you ever wanted to save the world? Well now you can: by snatching up COSGRRRL's first limited edition, signed print issues like they were bottled water during the apocalypse. How, exactly, is supporting COSGRRRL's print launch the same as saving the world, you ask?

Well, it's complicated, but suffice to say we here at COSGRRRL have worked it all out, and it has to do with being strong in our intellectual diversity, and talking about the things we love, and the fact that science fiction and fantasy are far superior (as far as topics go) to politics and news and religion on account of the fact that sci-fi and fantasy force us to explore our humanity and new frontiers of being while politics and news and religion just makes us want to smell our own belly button lint like Neanderthals. It's also a little bit about manifestation, and the idea that if we get a bunch of people who are different together talking about what they love, we're bound to solve more problems than we would shouting at each other all the godsdamned time.

And anyway, do YOU have a better idea for saving the world? You don't, do you? Well, then, my idea is as good as any, and it's a pretty damn cheap bet at just $25 per issue. 

If that's not enough reason: we use cool "A" words like “Afrocentrism” and “Anarchy”, and we shit-talk the Disney Channel, and write fanfiction according to our own particular...idiom. Yes, unfortunately, there IS a little bit of poetry in these issues too, but don’t hold that against the entire franchise. There are also velociraptors and copious uses of the “N” word in the fiction section, so the pace always picks back up again. 

Also, you KNOW you feel guilty for not reading more books. Well this issue is LIKE a book, in that it has many smart words, but UNLIKE a book, in that it’s shorter and includes some very interesting pictures indeed. 

Who's in it, and what IS it, exactly?

A mix of emerging writers (many of whom have been rejected from most outlets for being too unconventional or extreme), new writers, and widely published heavyweight bards: Rand Fishkin Gary E. Moore, Richard Brownell, TaLynn Kel, Evan Fleischer, Reverend Nigga Daddy, Bill Henning, Sarah Myles, and Southpaw Poet are just a sampling.

COSGRRRL: the Elemental Series is the magazine's first printed series, and includes five issues:

  • Issue #1: Origins (est. release March)
  • Issue #2: Mind / Air (est. release April)
  • Issue #3: Body / Earth (est. release May)
  • Issue #4: Emotion / Water (est. release June)
  • Issue #5: Spirit / Fire (est. release July)

Semi-illustrated issues are the size of a trade paperback, and range 100-120 pages each.

Barring the apocalypse and/or a hard stop from the Universe, issues will be released one month apart, beginning early March.

Who's behind this?

This humunculous of a publication is the creation of writer / educator (and scruffy-looking nerf herder) Marjorie Steele, who has been publishing COSGRRRL as a digital publication on Medium.com since October 2017. A Michigander, Marjorie is also an adjunct faculty at Kendall College of Art and Design of FSU, sits on The Court of Nerds, and plays the elven druid Yvanna on the CoN's Dungeons and Dragons podcast, Reverse Centaur.

Marjorie is proud of the weirdos and wizards she's attracted to her nerdly publication, and loves her freakish baby beyond all logical reason, and has therefore been obsessed with the idea of memorializing it in print. Now, with Grand Rapids artist Dustin Coon's ethereal illustrations bringing illumination to her writers' twisted tales, it's finally time. 

The issues are outlined, the works are edited, the layout has been designed, and Issue #1 is ready to print while artwork for Issues #2-5 is already underway. 

CENSORED FROM MEDIUM (also: poetry, dinosaurs, and space)

Yes, it's true, one of our comedic authors has had his works scrubbed from Medium.com on account of "inappropriate content". What was inappropriate about it? Well, you'd like to know, wouldn't you? But you won't--not unless you buy COSGRRRL: the Elemental Series. Let's see if you can pick their work out from the Table of Contents posted at the top of the page.

Controversial comedy isn't all that's in COSGRRRL, though--each issue is packed with Essays which critically analyze, Reviews which entertain, Cospoetry that scratches your brain, and Fiction that tickles your spine. All from a mix of new writers, established voices, and previously undiscovered geniuses.

Why are you fundraising, and what are you going to do with my money?

Our pro bono CFO has made very fancy spreadsheets detailing revenue and expenses he calls a "P&L" (whatever that means), which performs some very magical calculations to tell us how much it costs to print issues, and how many we need to print and sell in order to make any money on this whole messy publishing affair. Our Magical Money Spreadsheet tells us that in order to cover our upfront costs to produce, print, and sell the first two issues at a volume which creates a reasonable profit, COSGRRRL needs $25,000.

Once Issue #1 is printed, revenue from their sales (from COSGRRRL's own webstore, once this Indiegogo campaign has wrapped) will fund the production/printing of Issue #3, and so on through Issue #5.

As for why we're fundraising: Marjorie is flat broke, yo.

Yikes! That sounds hard. What if failure, tho?

Great question, Eskimo Dog: we shall not fail.

I mean, worst case scenario we don't raise money or sell issues as fast as we'd planned, and it takes longer for the issues to be released than anticipated.

But that's one of the reasons why our fundraising goal is based on the costs of two issues, rather than just the first one--to give us more of a cushion of inventory from which to build profit.

And anyway, isn't everything a risk, at the end of the day? Why the hell not try? We can promise you this publication has been more thoroughly strategized and analyzed than 80% of the other literary presses out there. Academic presses running off department funding can eat COSGRRRL's crunchy shorts.

Pour me that Kool-Aid! How can I help?

Well, back the project here on Indiegogo by buying the VIP Subscription to the entire five-issue series, of course.

And tip any extra cash you have lying around into the "Contributions" bucket, while you're at it. Extra contributions help us pay for artwork and print issues sooner. 

Tipping in an extra contribution is also a great way to show you value COSGRRRL--and Marjorie's journalism and publishing work at large.

If you're not Scrooge McDuck right now and the VIP Subscription pack is too steep (or if you have really morbid sensibilities and are concerned about any of us being alive by the time issues #2-5 are released), buy a VIP Issue package--or at least a single signed issue.

If that's just not feasible, never fear: use the Interwebs to ask other people to buy it for you! For a good cause! And to buy a whole godsdamned subscription for themselves while they're at it, because hey, they'll love it--and even if they don't, they'll have original, post-post modern fucking literature in their house, which they can set on their coffee table during parties to make people believe they're super artsy and woke.

Purchase perks, contribute, and share away!

Of course, once your issues do finally arrive, BE SURE to share a picture of the issue, and your favorite passage from it on Instagram, or wherever else it is you roam. #COSGRRRL

story:
The Story's Dedication 

I dedicate this story to all beings from all walks of life that crossed my path and touched my soul in one way or another, to all beautiful fairies out there and dark witches too, to the awakened soul as well as to a lost one, to an ordinary man and a woman, to a child and to an elderly and to the high's and low's one's life. 
Because the light will not exist without the darkness and that same light would not be there if you didn't pass the dark tunnel first, because, without a woman, there would not be a man and without them no child that would grow old and wise. I surrender my soul to the power of nature that I worship most of all. 
And in this contradiction of all existence, I bring the experience of my universal truth – the story of my life to you...

 

The Big Revelation & Purpose  

I do not have anything else to offer apart from the truth of my own path that the story will reveal. It has taken a great amount of courage to be seen this way and I still cannot believe I am putting my entire life out there for everyone to see! I hope that my book will encourage others to fulfil their dreams and set on the road to travel as much as they can! It has opened my eyes and was the Greatest Blessing that I was able to manifest in my Life so Far. After my first solo adventure to Nepal, I would take you on a journey to Cambodia, Thailand, Myanmar, Bali, Mt Shasta in California, China and Marrakech. Throughout my journeys, I meet fellow travelers en route and because I wear my heart on the sleeve I find myself in funny situations, adventures and encounters that would have never crossed my path otherwise. Even the cover of the book itself has a story behind it and yes that little person holding onto a rope is myself lost in a beautiful landscape between Heaven and Earth - ‘SIMPLY BE AT 33’ is a celebration of those stories written by Life itself which I have decided to share :)

 

The Process & Your Contribution

The book is currently being reviewed for copy-editing and the aim is to self-publish         ‘Simply Be at 33’on Amazon in January 2019. In the meantime, I would be forever grateful if you are able to help me with the cost of self-publishing as little or as much as you can.

Here is a breakdown of the fees I require to make this happen:

  • Manuscript review fees: £650
  • CopyEditing fees: £1000
  • Book Cover: £300
  • Possible Audible Recorded Version (Fees not known yet)
  • Fee for building a Website (Fees not known yet)

All my supporters will receive my eBook for Free.

I am only raising the amount necessary to cover the publishing costs. However, if I reach my target I will think of some Surprise or Promotion cards with my signature to spread my Love & Gratitude.

BTW I have just returned from the jungle in Peru... I am 35 Now – but those stories would only turn into a Book No 2 if ‘No 1 - SIMPLY BE AT 33’ becomes successful. For this to happen I need YOU :) 

If you believe Life is Full of Meaning I will take you for a Funny Ride full of Adventure :))

Thank you!  Thank you! Thank you!

& NAMASTE :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, help by spreading the word and sharing the link as far as you can to all your friends and loved ones who you think might benefit from reading a meaningful life journey of a solo female traveler. Who doesn't love a book with a heartfelt story? :)

story:
I am asking for funding to assist in the initial printing of this special edition of my autobiography.  I am very excited to be able to finally tell 'My Story'.  I wanted to write this book because I feel that my experiences have value for today's younger generation in the concepts of social norms and acceptance and also as a bit of history from the burlesque entertainment industry. It is a story of love, suffering, and the joy of living.   

Marinka

It is a story of love, suffering, and the joy of living.   Marinka

story:
A GOD MAY LIVE FOREVER, BUT DIES A THOUSAND TIMES...

Meet G.E. White with her debut novel Eyes of the Eternal, the first book in the Realms of Rebirth series.  This is an incredibly compelling story that will have readers hooked from the first sentence.  This book is perfect for fans of Percy Jackson looking for a more mature take on Greek mythology.  Eyes of the Eternal is a fast-paced adventure filled with intrigue, imagination, and unique characters you won't want to say goodbye to.

When a clever and skeptical young man learns that he is the reincarnation of an ancient Greek deity, he must team up with a mysterious demigod and the handsome God of Death to retrieve the fabled Eyes of the Eternal before a deadly wish is made and war engulfs us all.

Eyes of the Eternal sets a thrilling precedent for novels to follow, as it explores gender identity in young people while bringing readers along on a thrilling adventure.

This is a book by an exciting new talent with a voice and point of view that is greatly needed among young people today.  G.E. White (Gillian or Jill to her friends) writes about diversity and inclusivity in a way that normalizes gender identity and sexuality, with a hero that young people in the LGBTQIA+ community can relate and identify with.

Eyes of the Eternal will appeal to anyone who loves urban fantasy and supports the normalization of gender identity.  It is written in a fast-paced, electrifying manner that will have readers furiously flipping page after page to find out what happens next, while also leaving them impatiently awaiting the second book in the series.

Enjoy exclusive perks when you pre-order your copy of Eyes of the Eternal.

Eyes of the Eternal will be available for sale in Fall 2020.

story:
PALEOTRONIC MAGAZINE

Electronics are everywhere and in almost everything these days, involved with practically every facet of our daily lives, from work to leisure to today's culture.

Paleotronic Magazine celebrates the innovations that got us here by exploring the ways in which they forged our modern world, through their origins, what they did and what they became.

We'll examine how things work now from the perspective of how they worked then, exploiting the simplicity of early devices and programming languages to impart a greater understanding of current technologies in fields such as electronics engineering, software development and design.   

We're going to have fun too, revisiting classic video games and vintage toys, digging into underground geek and hacker scenes, and experiencing electronically-connected films, novels, television programs and music.

We'll also cover the present-day retro-technology niche, highlighting its influence on today's popular culture, and show you how you can engage with it by starting your own electronics-based projects, creating retro themed music, literature or art, collecting and restoring computers, consoles or other equipment, or developing your own retro-inspired video games.

Paleotronic Magazine is your ticket to travel both back into the past and journey into the future.

Make sure you come along with us.

Each month will also include a Feature Presentation, an in-depth look at innovations and events that shaped the world of today, from radio and television, to the rise of computers, to the Moon landing!

You can browse through an example issue of Paleotronic at http://paleotronic.com/preview-issue/

Paleotronic Magazine will initially be published every two months. 

MICROM8 "UPCYCLING" EMULATOR

As a bonus, subscribers get premium access to our companion microM8 application, a combined 8-bit computer emulator and fantasy console that allows you to not only explore a vast library of vintage software from a growing selection of systems, but also upcycle it with contemporary features such as three-dimensional visualisations, backgrounds and overlays, and digital audio. You can also create new programs in an enhanced BASIC development environment sporting additional functionality unavailable on classic 8-bit machines.

What's more, you can collaborate, communicate, play together, learn and share with the built-in microLink online service.

Learn to code the 8-bit way with microM8!

microM8 is available for Windows, Mac OS and Linux and currently emulates the Apple IIe, with additional emulations coming in the near future, and plans for iOS and Android versions.

You can test drive a beta version of microM8 now! Get it from http://microM8.com

Currently you can:

  • access our huge library of over 1000 BASIC programs and 10,000 Apple II disks!
  • edit existing programs or write new ones in enhanced color BASIC and 3D LOGO.
  • create novel presentations for classic games with custom color schemes, backdrops, overlays, music and more.

Over the coming months we will:

  • implement an expanded command syntax in BASIC with editors for creating sprites, tiles and music that rivals the best "fantasy consoles" allowing you to create 8-bit styled games with modern flair.
  • open the microLink on-line service with messaging, e-mail, multiplayer gaming competitions, high-score tables and much much more.
  • add support for additional classic 8-bit platforms like the BBC Micro, the Atari 800XL and the Commodore 64!

Once premium access is available, Paleotronic Magazine subscribers will get:

  • access to monitored help forums and chat rooms that will provide one-on-one assistance with using microM8 and learning to code.
  • access to special members-only social areas and game rooms.
  • special avatars and "flairs" and unrestricted time limits.
  • exclusive content and early access to new games.
  • an @microM8.com e-mail address.
  • early access to the micromates interactive tutorial system.

 

ADDITIONAL BONUS: 12 Years of Retro-Xmas Digital Mini-Mag

All backers will receive a copy of the 12 Years of Retro-Xmas digital mini-mag, filled with reminisces of electronic gifts from the 80s and early 90s! Take a trip down memory lane and relive the fun and excitement of Christmas mornings past. This special mini-issue is expected to be distributed in mid-December.

WHAT WILL THE MONEY BE USED FOR?

Well, firstly, it won't be used for our personal wages! We are committed to this, and while we may get paid out of future non-Kickstarter income, all Kickstarter pledges will go exclusively to printing and mailing costs, intellectual property licensing, software costs and bounties / awards to contributors. We want Paleotronic Magazine and microM8 to be the best they can be, and the more money we have to work with, the better we will make them for everybody. 

Which brings us to...

STRETCH GOALS

  • If we exceed our funding goals we will explore the following additions to our project:
  • More, bigger and better articles!
  • Monthly issues!
  • Paleotronic Podcast / VODcast!
  • Programming, Chip Music and Pixel Art Contests!
  • Bonus Digital Issues for Kickstarter Backers!
  • ...and more!

ABOUT THE TEAM

Melody Ayres-Griffiths learned to code in BASIC on a Timex Sinclair 1000 (ZX81) when she was 6, and has been hacking away ever since on both hardware and software, working professionally as an Apple and PC technician and a system administrator for most of the 2000s. She also interned in a graphic design house in the early 1990s and has stayed up-to-date with publishing technologies since, through her work providing professional support and training for popular media and design applications to several magazine and newspaper publishers. She has also written two novels, and contributed short stories and articles to a number of periodicals and publications. She is the editor of Paleotronic Magazine. If this campaign is successful, it will be her full-time job.

April Ayres-Griffiths was writing BASIC programs using pen and paper before she even had her first computer (a Commodore 64.) Today she is a senior software developer with a university degree and over a decade of commercial experience in all sorts of computer languages, from Fortran and Perl to C++ and Go, in industries from education to banking. She is the coding genius behind microM8, and believes passionately in the value of including early computing technologies in computer science curriculum for both children and adults. April works tirelessly evenings and weekends to bring microM8 to life.

April and Melody thank you for your support!

 

Risks and challenges

Since we have both published a preview issue of the magazine and developed a functional beta of our emulation platform, we are obviously passionate about the space and invested in our place in it. However, while it is plainly our intention to follow through and make both Paleotronic Magazine and microM8 the biggest and best they can be, we all know life can get in the way and sometimes even the best plans don't work out.

If this happens, we will pledge to release all remaining unpublished content on the Paleotronic website. refund all subscribers and advertisers a pro-rata amount based on remaining issues, and donate any other funds that are left to a kids coding charity. We're not in this for the money -- everything we raise in this campaign is meant to go towards creating and acquiring content and promotion of said content, and if we're not able to use it for that, we're not interested in holding on to it.

We like to think we're honourable people =) We will do our best to do right by this project.
story_txt:
PALEOTRONIC MAGAZINEElectronics are everywhere and in almost everything these days, involved with practically every facet of our daily lives, from work to leisure to today's culture.Paleotronic Magazine celebrates the innovations that got us here by exploring the ways in which they forged our modern world, through their origins, what they did and what they became.We'll examine how things work now from the perspective of how they worked then, exploiting the simplicity of early devices and programming languages to impart a greater understanding of current technologies in fields such as electronics engineering, software development and design.   We're going to have fun too, revisiting classic video games and vintage toys, digging into underground geek and hacker scenes, and experiencing electronically-connected films, novels, television programs and music.We'll also cover the present-day retro-technology niche, highlighting its influence on today's popular culture, and show you how you can engage with it by starting your own electronics-based projects, creating retro themed music, literature or art, collecting and restoring computers, consoles or other equipment, or developing your own retro-inspired video games.Paleotronic Magazine is your ticket to travel both back into the past and journey into the future.Make sure you come along with us.Each month will also include a Feature Presentation, an in-depth look at innovations and events that shaped the world of today, from radio and television, to the rise of computers, to the Moon landing!You can browse through an example issue of Paleotronic at http://paleotronic.com/preview-issue/Paleotronic Magazine will initially be published every two months. MICROM8 "UPCYCLING" EMULATORAs a bonus, subscribers get premium access to our companion microM8 application, a combined 8-bit computer emulator and fantasy console that allows you to not only explore a vast library of vintage software from a growing selection of systems, but also upcycle it with contemporary features such as three-dimensional visualisations, backgrounds and overlays, and digital audio. You can also create new programs in an enhanced BASIC development environment sporting additional functionality unavailable on classic 8-bit machines.What's more, you can collaborate, communicate, play together, learn and share with the built-in microLink online service.Learn to code the 8-bit way with microM8!microM8 is available for Windows, Mac OS and Linux and currently emulates the Apple IIe, with additional emulations coming in the near future, and plans for iOS and Android versions.You can test drive a beta version of microM8 now! Get it from http://microM8.comCurrently you can:
access our huge library of over 1000 BASIC programs and 10,000 Apple II disks!
edit existing programs or write new ones in enhanced color BASIC and 3D LOGO.
create novel presentations for classic games with custom color schemes, backdrops, overlays, music and more.
Over the coming months we will:
implement an expanded command syntax in BASIC with editors for creating sprites, tiles and music that rivals the best "fantasy consoles" allowing you to create 8-bit styled games with modern flair.
open the microLink on-line service with messaging, e-mail, multiplayer gaming competitions, high-score tables and much much more.
add support for additional classic 8-bit platforms like the BBC Micro, the Atari 800XL and the Commodore 64!
Once premium access is available, Paleotronic Magazine subscribers will get:
access to monitored help forums and chat rooms that will provide one-on-one assistance with using microM8 and learning to code.
access to special members-only social areas and game rooms.
special avatars and "flairs" and unrestricted time limits.
exclusive content and early access to new games.
an @microM8.com e-mail address.
early access to the micromates interactive tutorial system.


 
ADDITIONAL BONUS: 12 Years of Retro-Xmas Digital Mini-MagAll backers will receive a copy of the 12 Years of Retro-Xmas digital mini-mag, filled with reminisces of electronic gifts from the 80s and early 90s! Take a trip down memory lane and relive the fun and excitement of Christmas mornings past. This special mini-issue is expected to be distributed in mid-December.WHAT WILL THE MONEY BE USED FOR?Well, firstly, it won't be used for our personal wages! We are committed to this, and while we may get paid out of future non-Kickstarter income, all Kickstarter pledges will go exclusively to printing and mailing costs, intellectual property licensing, software costs and bounties / awards to contributors. We want Paleotronic Magazine and microM8 to be the best they can be, and the more money we have to work with, the better we will make them for everybody. Which brings us to...STRETCH GOALS
If we exceed our funding goals we will explore the following additions to our project:
More, bigger and better articles!
Monthly issues!
Paleotronic Podcast / VODcast!
Programming, Chip Music and Pixel Art Contests!
Bonus Digital Issues for Kickstarter Backers!
...and more!
