story:
"He stopped by our house frequently for many months.   They had told me in broad strokes who he was...trained as a painter in Paris at a pretegious school, the  son of a well to do family. He had an educated, gentle demeanor, and polite manner of speech.  I liked him well enough, he was gentle and genuine. There was obviously a problem though.  His cheeks had gone too gaunt probably some time ago; but Id only met him more recently, so I didnt have the before and after photograph of him in my mind . 

    After about the third time he stop by I caught on. Still wearing the same outfit, caring the same  shoulder bag , and wearing that same nervous demeanor, like wet clothes that cling to your skin uncomfortably.  The first time he asked for anything, it was for a shower. That's when it hit home for me. I got it. Over the next few months he'd stop in about three times a week, ask if he could use the bathroom sheepishly, ask for a piece of paper, and ask if he could draw a portrait of me.  Some days I would sit for him in the passageway sunshine , my children playing nearby,while he drew. His proficient pencil, quickly  flashing  easily and intensely on the drugged paper.  
    Looking back I think he did them, and left it as a form of re payment. Back then it seemed like maybe he just "needed to draw" . We all knew who he was,  and respected him deeply, even in his emaciated shaking state.  I'd offer him food which he  usually declined. It seemed almost unbearable for him to accept anything, or ask for anything.  Watching him was torturous, his sinewy body in complete discomfort, wiggling as though he wanted to slip right out of it.  
    I looked forward to the days when he would stop by. Maybe that sounds wrong to say but, I felt honored he trusted me that much and felt that comfortable enough to come by, which seemed  like a feat  in itself.  I was grateful he did because it also meant I knew he was still OK.  Then came a week where he didn't come. Then  two weeks. I tracked down a telephone number for  his family and spoke with his aunt, but she wouldn't tell me anything.  I explained to her my friendship with him but that didn't help pull out any answers. I never saw him again.  He left me with some beautiful sketches, done by the hand of a true master. I'm assuming he's dead , but anybody I ever ask never heard anything more either.
 Not all the stories of people who came by that house are sad ones we had so many  real winners too, and those ones leave me smiling.
Moving,  but also sometimes  humorous, rich stories that took place over many years , come together to create this honest and raw memoir. The book is  full of anecdotal stories on the ervolutionary  avant-garde Art movement that shaped and  gave me standing as an artist. But also of social advocacy, experiences of peace, war, drugs, birth, death, family, violence againt women, charity, healing, resiliance, perseverance, compassion, poverty, wealth and much more. 
 An excerpt from the Memoir



Funding this project  
•  publication of this book in November of 2016. 
•   funds the aquisition of a used computer for the writing, 
•   Helps cover the research trip to speak with historians, curators, journalists,   activists and peers in the art movement I was/ am a part of . 
•    creates suplimentary monies in carrying  my family of four children while I also work  on the writing, editing, and publishing of the book



Who and what youre helping
 You are a part of this story .  In reaching out to you you also become a part of  my story and my life. You are helping me plant this story into writing and publish. It is a piece of history.  Not only my own history, it is a legacy which belongs to my children, family,  my community, my peers and world and you. . 
Why its so important
 Before beginning this book I put  out a long chain of queries  about the significance and importance of this book, (in essence if this  story had in fact been relevant,  I spoke with journalists, artists, cinematographers, collectors, Gallery's, peers,  and other professionals who were not in the inner circle of this revolutionary  art movement, but rather experienced it together with us from an outside vantage point. I did so in order to establish whether or not the work we did during this time truly influenced.  I already knew from my point of view, and that of my peers that it was and has been important for all of us, but I needed to know  as well from external sources, to see if my observations were correct. The answer was unanimously yes. We were in fact a group of  highly motivated, inspired, active, hard-working, dedicated, young dreamers with both cause and mission.   The payoff was and has been monumental.  What we managed to accomplish did change the course of art history in Guatemala as well as  having huge social impact, and continues to do so to this day. 
 We created both an outstanding group, and individual reputation  for ourselves. That reputation has carrtied  based on the accomplishments and achievements nationally and internationally.  Working from the ground up has been and remains an essential aspect. Remaining  true to both the culture and people of this country, this work holds firmly to its original roots, concepts and ideas. 

 
Guatemala changed me...
It also gave me a place and a name. With over 22 years working in and with artistic social projects. An artist, a mother, a social advocate, an activist, a teacher and continual cultural pioneer. I have  worked internationally and studied therapeutic approaches with diverse communities, including the elderly, drug addicts, and children and adults with disabilities. I have worked organizing and hosting cultural events, founded and co founded cultural initiatives and is an award winning exhibiting artist since 1995. CV and work can be seen HERE
I currently reside in upsate NY, am a full time mother of four children, a full time employee, artist, do ongoing works of art in the studio. And...to boot it is also usual I also have these types of additional projects going, like writing this book
 How we changed a nation ?
 Sometimes you have to look back to move forward Art BOOMED in the USA during the 50s to 70s and gave us so many of North Americas most beloved artists.  Too many to name we got the likes of Ed Ruscha, Jackson Pollock, Andy Warhol, Basquiat, the Beats,  Gerard Malanga, Hans Namuth, poets, sculptors, filmmakers, photographers, musicians et all. It happened in Guatemala too but in the 1990's, and thats where I was. 
 Iconic Poet/Photographer Gerard Malanga at my studio 2009
In the right place at the right time, and no matter how lost to translation it may seem, it was the equivalent of being in the US during the 50s-70s . It is a rare and unique experience that few countries or artists in the world will still go through. as a developing country it simply had not gone through this process, but I was there for it when it happened. A once in a life time experience of a country and a people. This is her story, their story.  


The Domino effect 

 Because of this story is about Guatemala, it belongs to Guatemala. This is why  I have chosen to pay my work forward. The initiative for the school in the Ixil triangle run by Lucia Escobar. Internationally renown Guatemalan journalist, Lucia has published awarded articles on Femecidio  (The re occurring  killing of women in Guatemala), who, in her "spare time" ( besides recently being widowed, and is now a single mother raising two boys)  helps this particular Ixil school in  the very north of Guatemala where entire villages were massacred. ( Nobel Peace Winner Rigoberta Minchu can tell you all about it, Read her story too. )  giving the proceeds to Lucia's efforts with the children in the Ixil Triangle. Its a legitimate thing she is doing even if it looks low key and unprofessional, its real, and true.


Info

Here again is the link to the school program https://www.facebook.com/TelesecundariaSantaCla...

emilyhassell@gmail.com
www.emilyhassell.com
the school www.plazapublica.com.gt

story:
There was an idea to bring together a group of remarkable people, united by the Superheroes in Pop Culture course run by Smithsonian X, to see if they could become something more. To see if they could work together to redefine the classic superhero story, to realize their dream of bringing their characters to life. And this isn't just a good old-fashioned notion-- it’s a new project that wants to bring something fresh and unique to the superhero genre. Introducing NeoVerse: a collection of seven novels taking superhero lore and reinvigorating classic storytelling with a new breed of diverse, unique characters!

You read that right: novels. Not graphic novels, not comics. Since not all of us possess the talent to draw, we’ve decided to skip the comic format altogether and bring our heroes to life in a different way. The classic novel is about to get taken over by superheroes, and our goal is to build a single universe of our very own that will eventually crossover to form a whole team like you've never seen before. These guys are not your classic superheroes, and that’s what makes them special! You'll meet telekinetic Mistag; werewolf mercenary Gatler; Auroch, the guardian of his city; Crimson Thorn, assassin-turned-hero; newbie vigilante Patrol; cosmic peacekeeper Thomas and the invulnerable Shadow among many others. These heroes fight villains, monsters, criminals and their own personal demons in action-packed tales that we just can't wait to share with you.

NeoVerse is very much a 'by geeks, for geeks' project. To get it off the ground (and up, up and away!) we’re asking you to help us raise funds for this project so all of us can achieve our dream of being successful writers and create something new. The funds will go to copyediting, cover design, interior design, printing, distribution and marketing. Follow us on Facebook or Twitter to get updates, sneak peeks and get to know the team and the universe. Share, donate, spread the word and never shut up about it, because that's how legends begin! And we in turn will give you cool donor perks, live videos, characters you'll love and a crossover of epic proportions. 

Here's a full list of our planned novels so far:


“Auroch” by Casey van Camp (Release: June 2016)

Heroes, villains, and other extra powered individuals have become a common occurrence in the world and the people live in fear of those that abuse their gifts and threaten their lives. Heroes stand to protect those that cannot protect themselves but are increasingly outnumbered by those that abuse their gifts and threaten people's lives to get what they want.

Auroch, the protector, has taken to the streets to battle the forces of villainy and push back the darkness and corruption infecting his city. He stands as a symbol to the city to serve and protect what they care about and help those in need of help. The city and its police force are being inundated with monsters, villains, and creatures from all corners and cracks of the darkest realms and unofficial genetic experiments. The world is in need of a hero that can break them from the threats they face and Auroch is that shining beacon. Auroch is young however and must learn from his Father to use his powers wisely and avoid the temptations and influential powers of villains. The soul of the city and safety of its people hang in the balance.



“Black Thorns” by Enrique Betancourt (Release June 2016)

“Merrik Spark had been raised as an Assassin of the Cleansing, killing people who stand against the norm. Now, twenty-years old and an expert at killing, he seeks redemption. Once he learns that the man that trained him is looking to control his city and fill it with oppressive hatred, he returns from exile to protect his people against discrimination and crime. He becomes the Crimson Thorn. However, his dark methods left people wondering if he’s really a symbol of hope, prompting to more vigilantes to show up in Nexus City.

Soon enough, the hate crimes get worse and they have the days counted before Operation: Lazarus, the day or reckoning. While trying to keep a balance on his true nature and the two men he loves, plus reconnecting with his family, Merrik will be face with the true question of his identity: Is he a hero or a villain? The crusade will escalate to involve his family, his friends, and soon enough Nexus City will be a playground for vigilantes and criminals. The war between two cults of assassins will force the black thorns to unite and take a stand against the real enemy…”




“The Wolf” by Brigadier-Wolf (Release August 2016)

When you stop believing in monsters they go away. But every story holds some truth in it, even monster stories. For centuries mankind has turned a blind eye to the beasts that walk alongside them. At the turn of the century something changed in both man and monster. As man became more powerful, more and more monsters became known to the world.

Gatler an ex-Black Ops mercenary spent most of his life killing the hidden evils of the world for profit. Five years into his retirement he is called on again. Only this time he has something more important to protect; his daughter. Gatler tracks down his old team to take on their hidden agenda and above all protect his family. There is a reason you don't mess with The Wolf.


“Mistag” by Gage Lynn (Release October 2016)

Things in the world have been changing day by day. It seems that around every corner, a new super-powered freak shows up. Society is divided between hatred and love whenever the topic of these transcended beings is brought up. No one knows where they have come from, or why they have made themselves known to the world. That is where our story starts…

Michael Louis was a seemingly normal child to the general population, but his adoptive parents knew the truth. One day when he was just an infant, he was crying. When they walked into the room to check on him, his toys were floating in the air around him. Michael grew up and learned how to control these powers with the help of his parents. He realized the only way to control the powers, is to control his emotions. He knew that these powers could be used to help people, and so he became Mistag.

However, not all super humans are as kind-hearted as Michael. Some of them have had their minds warped by these special gifts. Others exploit these powers for darkness. Either way Michael must help them, and the people they threaten to hurt. But not everyone finds vigilantes helpful. The government despises the super humans and has hired guns to take care of them. One of the most skilled has been hired to take Mistag, and any other transcended being, down.


“Patrol” by Sabine Antigua (Release January 2017)

Kevin Rocita is a fast-talking DJ and martial arts enthusiast from Maharlika City, the illustrious home base of the Philippine super hero team the Three Stars. But when a powerful crime ring and a vengeful friend-turned-foe pose danger for both the heroes and ordinary civilians alike, the once-peaceful city threatens to turn into a warzone. And caught up in the middle is Kevin, whose martial arts savvy and untested taste for adventure makes him the perfect person to take on the Three Stars' tarnished legacy. Aided by crime-fighting veteran Tanya Reyes AKA Alitaptap, resident billionaire-genius Nicho Carrera and fellow novice Jessica Cruz AKA the Black Butterfly, Kevin becomes the masked crusader Patrol and takes on the drama, danger and high-octane delight that comes with being a vigilante. And along the way he learns a pretty important life hack: when you take on the responsibility, that's how you get the power.


“NeoDarkness” (Working Title) by Cade Bengert (Release January 2017)

Tyler is a high school student with depression. Every day is a chore of faking a smile, going through the motions, and hiding his pain. All he wants is to end his life and escape his problems... but he can't. Tyler has superpowers. He can't be hurt physically. But what does that mean for him mentally? What if there were another way to beat the darkness?


"The Wander Governor" by Thomas Wilson (Release March 2017)

Space, the Galaxy... where a whole new terrain dictated by governors if various space sectors. Each controlling various planets as "gems" that they use to boost their status. Much like a jeweled crown. One such governors is named Coronis Saleck, a mostly insane and enthused governor who owns a rare gem worth very little. One day he notices the birth of a young boy gifted with limitless healing potential and takes the boy as payment for a gem that gas list it's luster. As the boy grows he learns of his master's empathy towards the cruelty of space. A terrain where the strong survive. In his teenage years the boy gains a name Thomas Clearwater and the rights to travel to other terrains in order to become educated on how the system works. Yet Thomas himself apathetic to the ways of the universe until he meets a slave on the run. According to the rules of each terrain slaves must be killed if they run. Yet Thomas falls in love. Her master. Bane Darkstone the most influential governor promises death to one planet of Thomas is from if he does not deliver. As such Thomas must go from future governor of earth to wanted out law witnessing the kindness and beauty of other terrains all while trying to survive. This is a tale of intrigue loss, love, and the possibility of politics in space. It will be a series and it will be a mix of Star Wars and Guardians of the Galaxy. All while taking a fresh new take on space and it's limits...


Please help us raise our goal!

We are working with great artists from Kamui's Colors and Zain Naqvi.
story_txt: There was an idea to bring together a group of remarkable people, united by the Superheroes in Pop Culture course run by Smithsonian X, to see if they could become something more. To see if they could work together to redefine the classic superhero story, to realize their dream of bringing their characters to life. And this isn't just a good old-fashioned notion-- it’s a new project that wants to bring something fresh and unique to the superhero genre. Introducing NeoVerse: a collection of seven novels taking superhero lore and reinvigorating classic storytelling with a new breed of diverse, unique characters!You read that right: novels. Not graphic novels, not comics. Since not all of us possess the talent to draw, we’ve decided to skip the comic format altogether and bring our heroes to life in a different way. The classic novel is about to get taken over by superheroes, and our goal is to build a single universe of our very own that will eventually crossover to form a whole team like you've never seen before. These guys are not your classic superheroes, and that’s what makes them special! You'll meet telekinetic Mistag; werewolf mercenary Gatler; Auroch, the guardian of his city; Crimson Thorn, assassin-turned-hero; newbie vigilante Patrol; cosmic peacekeeper Thomas and the invulnerable Shadow among many others. These heroes fight villains, monsters, criminals and their own personal demons in action-packed tales that we just can't wait to share with you.NeoVerse is very much a 'by geeks, for geeks' project. To get it off the ground (and up, up and away!) we’re asking you to help us raise funds for this project so all of us can achieve our dream of being successful writers and create something new. The funds will go to copyediting, cover design, interior design, printing, distribution and marketing. Follow us on Facebook or Twitter to get updates, sneak peeks and get to know the team and the universe. Share, donate, spread the word and never shut up about it, because that's how legends begin! And we in turn will give you cool donor perks, live videos, characters you'll love and a crossover of epic proportions. Here's a full list of our planned novels so far:“Auroch” by Casey van Camp (Release: June 2016)Heroes, villains, and other extra powered individuals have become a common occurrence in the world and the people live in fear of those that abuse their gifts and threaten their lives. Heroes stand to protect those that cannot protect themselves but are increasingly outnumbered by those that abuse their gifts and threaten people's lives to get what they want.Auroch, the protector, has taken to the streets to battle the forces of villainy and push back the darkness and corruption infecting his city. He stands as a symbol to the city to serve and protect what they care about and help those in need of help. The city and its police force are being inundated with monsters, villains, and creatures from all corners and cracks of the darkest realms and unofficial genetic experiments. The world is in need of a hero that can break them from the threats they face and Auroch is that shining beacon. Auroch is young however and must learn from his Father to use his powers wisely and avoid the temptations and influential powers of villains. The soul of the city and safety of its people hang in the balance.“Black Thorns” by Enrique Betancourt (Release June 2016) “Merrik Spark had been raised as an Assassin of the Cleansing, killing people who stand against the norm. Now, twenty-years old and an expert at killing, he seeks redemption. Once he learns that the man that trained him is looking to control his city and fill it with oppressive hatred, he returns from exile to protect his people against discrimination and crime. He becomes the Crimson Thorn. However, his dark methods left people wondering if he’s really a symbol of hope, prompting to more vigilantes to show up in Nexus City.Soon enough, the hate crimes get worse and they have the days counted before Operation: Lazarus, the day or reckoning. While trying to keep a balance on his true nature and the two men he loves, plus reconnecting with his family, Merrik will be face with the true question of his identity: Is he a hero or a villain? The crusade will escalate to involve his family, his friends, and soon enough Nexus City will be a playground for vigilantes and criminals. The war between two cults of assassins will force the black thorns to unite and take a stand against the real enemy…”“The Wolf” by Brigadier-Wolf (Release August 2016)When you stop believing in monsters they go away. But every story holds some truth in it, even monster stories. For centuries mankind has turned a blind eye to the beasts that walk alongside them. At the turn of the century something changed in both man and monster. As man became more powerful, more and more monsters became known to the world.Gatler an ex-Black Ops mercenary spent most of his life killing the hidden evils of the world for profit. Five years into his retirement he is called on again. Only this time he has something more important to protect; his daughter. Gatler tracks down his old team to take on their hidden agenda and above all protect his family. There is a reason you don't mess with The Wolf.“Mistag” by Gage Lynn (Release October 2016)Things in the world have been changing day by day. It seems that around every corner, a new super-powered freak shows up. Society is divided between hatred and love whenever the topic of these transcended beings is brought up. No one knows where they have come from, or why they have made themselves known to the world. That is where our story starts…Michael Louis was a seemingly normal child to the general population, but his adoptive parents knew the truth. One day when he was just an infant, he was crying. When they walked into the room to check on him, his toys were floating in the air around him. Michael grew up and learned how to control these powers with the help of his parents. He realized the only way to control the powers, is to control his emotions. He knew that these powers could be used to help people, and so he became Mistag.However, not all super humans are as kind-hearted as Michael. Some of them have had their minds warped by these special gifts. Others exploit these powers for darkness. Either way Michael must help them, and the people they threaten to hurt. But not everyone finds vigilantes helpful. The government despises the super humans and has hired guns to take care of them. One of the most skilled has been hired to take Mistag, and any other transcended being, down.“Patrol” by Sabine Antigua (Release January 2017)Kevin Rocita is a fast-talking DJ and martial arts enthusiast from Maharlika City, the illustrious home base of the Philippine super hero team the Three Stars. But when a powerful crime ring and a vengeful friend-turned-foe pose danger for both the heroes and ordinary civilians alike, the once-peaceful city threatens to turn into a warzone. And caught up in the middle is Kevin, whose martial arts savvy and untested taste for adventure makes him the perfect person to take on the Three Stars' tarnished legacy. Aided by crime-fighting veteran Tanya Reyes AKA Alitaptap, resident billionaire-genius Nicho Carrera and fellow novice Jessica Cruz AKA the Black Butterfly, Kevin becomes the masked crusader Patrol and takes on the drama, danger and high-octane delight that comes with being a vigilante. And along the way he learns a pretty important life hack: when you take on the responsibility, that's how you get the power.“NeoDarkness” (Working Title) by Cade Bengert (Release January 2017)Tyler is a high school student with depression. Every day is a chore of faking a smile, going through the motions, and hiding his pain. All he wants is to end his life and escape his problems... but he can't. Tyler has superpowers. He can't be hurt physically. But what does that mean for him mentally? What if there were another way to beat the darkness? "The Wander Governor" by Thomas Wilson (Release March 2017)Space, the Galaxy... where a whole new terrain dictated by governors if various space sectors. Each controlling various planets as "gems" that they use to boost their status. Much like a jeweled crown. One such governors is named Coronis Saleck, a mostly insane and enthused governor who owns a rare gem worth very little. One day he notices the birth of a young boy gifted with limitless healing potential and takes the boy as payment for a gem that gas list it's luster. As the boy grows he learns of his master's empathy towards the cruelty of space. A terrain where the strong survive. In his teenage years the boy gains a name Thomas Clearwater and the rights to travel to other terrains in order to become educated on how the system works. Yet Thomas himself apathetic to the ways of the universe until he meets a slave on the run. According to the rules of each terrain slaves must be killed if they run. Yet Thomas falls in love. Her master. Bane Darkstone the most influential governor promises death to one planet of Thomas is from if he does not deliver. As such Thomas must go from future governor of earth to wanted out law witnessing the kindness and beauty of other terrains all while trying to survive. This is a tale of intrigue loss, love, and the possibility of politics in space. It will be a series and it will be a mix of Star Wars and Guardians of the Galaxy. All while taking a fresh new take on space and it's limits...Please help us raise our goal!We are working with great artists from Kamui's Colors and Zain Naqvi.

story:
Who is Spooner?

Spooner the Bear is a children's picture book that tells the story of Spooner, a young bear who's determined to change the trash-eating habits of his fellow neighborhood furry friends, and with any luck educate a few humans along the way! 

A message is being cunningly transmitted via Spooner the Bear. While engaging children in the richly-colored pages and neatly woven storyline, a hard-hitting message is being driven home to the parents – here’s a bear stating, from his point of view, what steps must be taken to stop his urban counterparts coming to forage in our trash cans and adversely affecting their health! This is a novel approach to a persistent dilemma, namely getting the message across to those with the power to do something about it, and this little tome does it by connecting kids and adults simultaneously. Growing up with the idea of safe trash-storage is a positive step for the future. Here’s the take-home message: WE create the problem, it’s up to US to solve it – perhaps with the aid of Spooner!

But, you don't need bears in your neighborhood to enjoy Spooner the Bear. The story and illustrations are hugely appealing as a fun kid's book regardless of where you live in the world. The story's theme, however, is also relevant to all urban wildlife species where animals seek food in our neighborhoods.

Here are a few of the beautiful illustrations from the book:

Where your money goes

The funds raised with this campaign will be used to print the first run of Spooner the Bear board books. Board books are one of the most expensive books to have printed and manufactured due to the materials used to keep them rigid. They are also hugely expensive to ship due to their weight (each book weighs 0.70 lbs). 

To keep costs per copy as low as possible we need to print a first run of 5,000 books. This will keep the price below $10 each retail and make the book far more marketable. 

All costs thus far have been absorbed by myself and Lainie the Illustrator but we're hoping that with this campaign we can generate enough copies to eventually make the book profitable and create an ongoing market for the Spooner the Bear book series.

Yes! Spooner is set to be a book series with a minimum of 4 books.

With your contribution to this project you are giving life to the ongoing adventures of the Spooner the Bear book series. 

Breakdown of costs:

  • Printing and manufacturing - 85%
  • Initial shipping of 5,000 books from the printer  - 5%
  • Marketing ads - 5%
  • IndieGoGo fees - 5%

What happens if I don't reach my funding goal?

This is a Flexible Funding campaign, which means you will get your books and perks regardless of whether or not I hit my goal. I believe in Spooner so much that I will make sure that the first run of books is funded one way or another! I'm just hoping I can rely on you to help me out with this campaign as then I won't have to sell a limb!

Spooner's Impact

Spooner the Bear has a real chance to connect with and convey a message to its audience:

  • the ongoing issue across America of bears coming into urban areas to seek food will continue to occur unless people become educated in safe garbage storage
  • it doesn't matter where in the world you live, people leave litter lying around. 

Spooner acts as a messenger and a role model to help kids from an early age understand the consequences of littering and garbage storage. The book also instills, in the parents reading it, a message that has been in front of them the whole time but may have been missed due to the methods by which this information has, in the past, been transmitted. Having spent the past 3 years reading board books to my son I have gained a great understanding of how a simple message in a kid's book sticks with me, especially when I end up reading the same book over and over again. I soon realized that this was a great conduit for passing on important information.

Why I Wrote Spooner the Bear

Having spent the past 7 years filming urban bears foraging for food in neighborhoods around Lake Tahoe, Carson City and Reno, Nevada I felt a strong urge to do something more than just produce films about the issue. Why? Because as these bears get more and more used to being in urban areas they get less afraid of humans and that's when the trouble starts. If a bear gets bold enough to break into your home it can become very dangerous. Imagine waking up, walking to the kitchen to get your coffee and there in front of you is a hungry bear foraging through your cupboards. THIS HAPPENS! And when a bear becomes that bold it becomes a threat to human safety and ... you can imagine the rest!

I believe this little children's board book can help instill an important message in a way that hasn't been used before. My GOAL is to get kids to grow up understanding this issue and nag their parents to DO THE RIGHT THING!

But also I thought it would be cool to write a fun kids book!


Book Review

Reviewed by Jack Magnus for Readers' Favorite 

Spooner the Bear is a children’s animal/picture book written by Jake Willers and illustrated by Lainie Bazzoni. Spooner is a young bear who lives quite close to a small town. The other local bears have gotten used to the idea of getting their food from the trash cans sitting outside the houses every night, and they make a terrible mess as they overturn the cans in their search for treats. Spooner and his friend, Fitzgerald the squirrel, travel to all the nearby towns looking for the messes the marauding bears leave and cleaning them up. At one point, they meet up with a giant bear named Rex, whose stomach is full of garbage from the cans he’s raided. Spooner tells Rex that he’s doing it all wrong. Bears should eat berries and greens, not garbage. Spooner also has a message for the humans he helps each night. If they use bear-proof containers, the bears would leave their garbage alone, and he and Fitzgerald could enjoy themselves at the lake instead of always having to clean up.

Jake Willers’ children’s animal/picture book, Spooner the Bear, is an entertaining and informative book about ways to make co-existence between people and bears work. Bears can’t resist the smells and tastes that exude from those garbage cans, and the resulting mess and unwanted interaction between species can easily be prevented. Lainie Bazzoni’s illustrations are superb! I love the colors and images of the natural places that she portrays, especially those featuring the lake and hillsides. Each panel is brightly and boldly colored, and the bears are a treat to look at, especially Spooner and the giant Rex. This book teaches kids and their parents about bears and how human food and trash is a big lure for them. Spooner the Bear is most highly recommended.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, please share this campaign widely. Use the share buttons at the top left of the screen next to the video.

Even if you can't afford to purchase a perk please share this campaign with your friends. I'd really appreciate it!

Note: International Shipping

Unfortunately to ship this board book overseas is very expensive due to its thickness and weight. There is an option for international shipping to the UK but it's twice the price of the book (yes that's the real shipping cost from the US to the UK not even taking into account the packaging costs). I am currently looking at getting 50 copies into the UK and shipping to buyers directly from there to reduce this cost. Please check the updates page for more info as I get this arranged.

story:
Short Summary

Soundings is a literary and visual arts journal published through the Sigma Tau Delta-Rho Mu chapter of Oklahoma Christian University. Soundings is based in Edmond, Oklahoma. The Soundings journal is published and distributed, at no cost, annually each spring. As a result, Soundings relies heavily on fundraising and donations. We need your help to continue providing our journals for free. We believe that arts and literature should be accessible to all. Please help us keep it that way!

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $1,350 to print the journal. Since we distribute the journal at no cost to you, the reader, most of our expenses go towards publication. As a result, we do not offer specific perks based on donation amounts, as we want to keep our costs as low as possible.
  • We rely heavily on fundraising efforts and your kind donations! Soundings really is a communal effort.

The Impact

  • Soundings creates a space for student artists and writers to submit and display their works--not only in the journal itself, but also at our various events! 
  • Our Open Mic nights allow for students to sing, perform spoken word, and display visual art as well.
  • Making student-produced, high quality art available for free is Soundings' main goal. Please help us reach it! 

Risks & Challenges

  • If we do not reach our financial goals, the journal might not be able to go to print. As a small literary arts journal at a small, Christian liberal arts school, we try to do amazing things for as low a cost as possible.
  • In order to ensure that Soundings' place as a curator of wonderful student art remains strong, please support with your donations and contributions! We appreciate every penny.

Other Ways You Can Help

We really need donations right now, but keep your eyes peeled for posts about our upcoming Christmas Market on December 1! You can find us on the web here:

  • Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ocsoundings/
  • Twitter: https://twitter.com/OCsoundings
  • Instagram: @ocsoundings
  • Website: http://www.ocsoundings.com/
  • Blog: https://soundingsliterary.wordpress.com/ 
Thanks for your help! Soundings is a communal effort, and we could not do this without you. We cannot wait for you to see our 2016 journal!

story:
Who We Are

As a podcaster on the Crime Cafe, I've had the pleasure of interviewing many great crime fiction and thriller authors. Thirteen of them have agreed to collaborate with me in creating two collective works. The authors contributing their books to the boxed set include:  Austin Camacho, Donna Fletcher Crow, W.D. Gagliani, Dale T. Phillips, M. Ruth Myers, Benjamin Sobieck, Jim Winter, Kenneth Wishnia, and Frank Zafiro. Our anthology will consist of short stories from: Bill Crider, Sasscer Hill, Jenny Milchman, A.J. Sidransky, and myself, These authors represent a wide-ranging variety of crime fiction fare. If you don't know their work, this represents a great opportunity for you to get to know them and help spread the word to everyone else. 

  • As crime fiction authors, we use the genre to tell so many different types of stories. The themes of our writing range from the Agatha Christie-style cozy, to the more technical police procedural, as well as the hard-nosed private eye or tough amateur sleuth.
  • With so many books to read these days, this project provides a curated sample of some of the best crime and noir fiction available.
  • We are all experienced crime authors, many of whom have won or been nominated for awards.
  • As a bonus, these collections will include transcribed interviews with each of the authors from my podcast.
I can't begin to say enough about how happy I am to be able to make this project a reality. With your help, I'm sure we'll reach our goal!

Our Referral Contest 

All contributors (no matter what level) qualify for our new referral contest. Everyone who contributes in the past, now or during the duration of the contest qualifies. The top three referrers (measured in amounts donated) will win one or more of the following out-of-print copies of the novels in the Sam McRae Mystery Series.

Remember, you must log in to Indiegogo if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Then, visit the campaign page on Indiegogo and look below the main video to share and copy your unique URL.

The referral contest will run until the campaign ends! May the odds be with you--and all of us! :)

What They're Saying About the Authors!

Some of our boxed set contributors!


"W.D. Gagliani drags you to the edge of your seat and keeps you there with the sheer power of his writing, all the way to the book’s chilling conclusion."
-- Maynard Sims, author

“Wishnia’s world is like a New York subway train–fast, loud, dirty and dangerous ..."
-- Booklist

"Dale Phillips writes a clean, efficient prose and spins a yarn that's as gritty as any I've read in recent years."
-- David Daniel, author

"Maggie Sullivan pistol whips a breath of fresh air into the moldy corpse of the hard boiled dick. ... Myers does a good job making her characters breathe."
-- William Bentrim, reader review


Some of our short story contributors!

"Bill Crider writes some the finest traditional mysteries around. He is a first rate plotter who also knows how to pace his material."
-- Ed Gorman, author

"Jenny Milchman mixes psychological thrills with adventure."
-- Shelf Awareness
"A.J. Sidransky's impressive debut novel is out of a little-known slice of Jewish history ... a murder mystery, a father-son tale, and an-only-in-New York story."
-- The Jewish Week


What We Need & What You Get

We need your support -- especially financial support -- in order to pay for the necessary ebook formatting, cover art, and transcription fees. In order to create a polished and well-edited ebook, it takes time and effort. None of this would be possible without the help of other professionals, who must be compensated for their work. So the highest priority is to pay them.

In return, you'll get acknowledged in one or both of the books. Depending on your giving level, you could qualify to receive one of the awesome Crime Cafe perks. These include Crime Cafe coffee cups, T-shirts, and more great stuff!

But that's not all! Along with Crime Cafe gifts, supporters can qualify for a digital copy of my first novel, Identity Crisis, which hit the New York Times ebook bestseller list in 2011.

Not only that, but we've added in an extra special perk available ONLY to those who sign on as early supporters and give at least $30 during the first four days of the campaign (i.e., by midnight of Sat., July 16).
If we don't reach our entire goal, be assured the funds will be distributed to everyone who has provided a service to make this project possible. Further, the funds will go toward the cost of the perks, as well as any fees due to Indiegogo. None of the authors, including myself, are paid out of the proceeds of this campaign. However, without your support, none of this will be financially feasible. So, any amount or type of support you can spare is welcome!

The Impact

This campaign represents more than just a publishing project. It's a means for authors to work in collaboration to promote, not only their work, but the works of colleagues within the crime and suspense genre.

As tough as it is now to create the bond between author and reader through online marketing and campaigns, that connection is essential between an author and his or her readers.

We seek to raise awareness not only of our own work, but the work of our peers. Just as a rising tide is said to lift all boats, it's our wish that this campaign will likewise benefit all crime fiction authors and raise awareness of the literary value of the genre.

What's at Stake and Our Challenge

Since this project isn't being produced by a publishing entity with a marketing department and public relations team, we face the risks indie authors must tackle in order to succeed in this effort. In order to succeed, we've chosen an innovative approach to reach and create a readership.

Here are some of the ways we hope to do so:

  • Please check out the author websites embedded above. I think you'll agree that this project includes many talented writers.
  • Follow me on Twitter and Facebook for updates on the campaign as it progresses!
  • Tell all your friends and family about this effort. Everyone loves a great story, right?

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute money, you can still help! Here's how:

  • Read and share our content. Follow me on Twitter and Instagram. The campaign is also on Facebook, Google Plus, and YouTube.
  • Sign up as an early supporter and help us with promotional support!
  • Get the word out about our campaign. Whether you like sharing things via social media, email, or in person, please tell others about us and what we're trying to do.
Thank you for reading this! And thanks so much for your support, whatever that support may be. We appreciate you!
story_txt:
Who We Are
 As a podcaster on the Crime Cafe, I've had the pleasure of interviewing many great crime fiction and thriller authors. Thirteen of them have agreed to collaborate with me in creating two collective works. The authors contributing their books to the boxed set include:  Austin Camacho, Donna Fletcher Crow, W.D. Gagliani, Dale T. Phillips, M. Ruth Myers, Benjamin Sobieck, Jim Winter, Kenneth Wishnia, and Frank Zafiro. Our anthology will consist of short stories from: Bill Crider, Sasscer Hill, Jenny Milchman, A.J. Sidransky, and myself, These authors represent a wide-ranging variety of crime fiction fare. If you don't know their work, this represents a great opportunity for you to get to know them and help spread the word to everyone else. 


As crime fiction authors, we use the genre to tell so many different types of stories. The themes of our writing range from the Agatha Christie-style cozy, to the more technical police procedural, as well as the hard-nosed private eye or tough amateur sleuth.
With so many books to read these days, this project provides a curated sample of some of the best crime and noir fiction available.
We are all experienced crime authors, many of whom have won or been nominated for awards.
As a bonus, these collections will include transcribed interviews with each of the authors from my podcast.

I can't begin to say enough about how happy I am to be able to make this project a reality. With your help, I'm sure we'll reach our goal!


Our Referral Contest 


All contributors (no matter what level) qualify for our new referral contest. Everyone who contributes in the past, now or during the duration of the contest qualifies. The top three referrers (measured in amounts donated) will win one or more of the following out-of-print copies of the novels in the Sam McRae Mystery Series.

Remember, you must log in to Indiegogo if you have not already, or create an account by signing up here. Then, visit the campaign page on Indiegogo and look below the main video to share and copy your unique URL.

The referral contest will run until the campaign ends! May the odds be with you--and all of us! :)

story:
The Goal

In October, 2015 a historic event will be held at the Barber Vintage Motorsports Museum in Birmingham, Alabama. As part of the 11th annual Barber Vintage Festival, a once-in-a-lifetime reunion of the iconic motorcycles produced by the late John Britten will be held, the first such reunion on North American soil. 

A similar reunion was held in Britten's home town of Christchurch, New Zealand in February of this year and it proved to be a moving tribute to the legacy of a man and a team of enthusiastic supporters who left an astonishing mark on the motorcycle industry. The ten V1000s produced by Britten's team represented the pinnacle of road racing technology at the time, mixed with some of the most innovative experimentation in chassis design seen in the 1990s. These machines are icons and continue to stun onlookers some 20 years after John's untimely passing, 19 years after they were retired from racing.

They are my icon, the machine that has inspired me to pursue all that is weird and wonderful in motorcycles and to celebrate alternative ideas - and the people who pursue them. For the past year I have been quietly working on an in-depth profile of Britten's motorcycles, and this reunion represents the best chance I have to document the individual machines and interview the owners, riders, and participants in John Britten's attempt at conquering road racing.

So OddBike needs your help to attend the Barber Vintage Festival to further the research needed to complete this article. John Britten's story has been told many times, but never in a way that has fully explored the truth behind the creation of one of motorcycling's single greatest machines, or how a relatively tiny operation succeeded in doggedly pursuing a series of unusual ideas and advanced technology in a bespoke machine that has yet to be equalled in terms of public impact and racing success.  

The Britten story is one that inspires breathless hyperbole, and for good reason, but the true story of how the V1000 came to be has not been properly addressed outside of a singular biography written by Tim Hanna (which, incidentally, I highly recommend reading). My aim is to apply my inimitable style of honest, accurate, and technically detailed writing to the Britten story and offer it for free consumption online. This work will be the crowning jewel of OddBike's archive of unusual motorcycles. I also intend to document my personal journey in researching this subject and examining the machines with a separate editorial piece.

Your support will directly contribute to the writing of this story, a long-form article that will be published on Odd-Bike.com as a free and honest tribute to one of the greatest motorcycles of all time and the people who made it happen. 


The Expenses

The expenses that I am aiming to cover with this campaign are as follows:

Return airfare from Calgary to Birmingham - 600$

Ticket for "An Evening with Britten" charity dinner at the Barber Museum - Prices TBA, traditionally 150$

Three day admission to the Barber Vintage Festival - 80$

T-shirt and sticker printing, shipping fees, and Indiegogo fees - 170$

Further expenses will be out of my own pocket.



Other ways you can help

To keep expenses to a minimum I humbly ask if anyone in the Birmingham area has a spare couch or bed they can offer please contact me at jasonevariste (AT) gmail.com. I expect to arrive Wednesday October 7th and leave Monday October 12th. 

If you are in town for the festival please get in touch with me, I'd be happy to meet with some of my followers for some BBQ and beer while I'm in Alabama!

As with the previous OddBike campaign, a few OddBike logo perks will be on offer to campaign supporters! I thank everyone in advance for helping fund this project, and I hope I can meet some of you at Barber - this reunion will be a once in a lifetime event and I would not recommend missing it!

story:
Praise for Thumar


I found Tim Murray’s book “Thumar” a delightful read and I couldn’t put it down. When I finished the last page, I wanted more…can’t wait for Tim to come out with his next book.

David Blonsksi ~ Artist, Musician, and owner of Timeless Productions.


“I found this story quite enjoyable. I particularly liked the character development. I felt like I would recognize the main characters if they walked into the room. It is refreshing to read a story in which the main characters make decisions based on what is good for the world (or worlds) rather than themselves.

John Pearsley ~ MA Biochemistry, Criminalist for the ECPD


“This book is bold and magical indeed.”

Xiao Ban Fan, PhD Chemical Engineering and Published Author

                                                     

                                                       



About this Project

“Enter the world of Thumar in the 25th century. It's a time of incredible technological advancement, but there is a cruel and heartless syndicate at work culling the "galactic herd." They are waging an insanely genocidal effort to direct events and create their ideal order for the known universe. "Thumar" is just the beginning of an exciting new series."

My name is M. Timothy Murray; I am the author of this new  science fiction novel, the first of a series. The second book is complete in its first draft form. The third is in progress, 710 pages to date. Writing is a passion for me. I do it for the love of creating. It brings me joy to present "new worlds" for reading pleasure.

These books are years in the making with a lot of help from friends and family. Many thanks go out to those who have helped. Without you, I would not be where I am today.This is a dream that I have done my best to make a reality. You can help me pass this final hurdle and reward you for your participation.

Thumar is a finished product, except for the cover art and printing, and will be self-published on Create Space and Amazon books, and available soon in E-Book form. The purpose of this crowd funding proposal is to raise funds to have the cover art professionally rendered and to finance a book tour to promote the sales of the book.

Risks and Challenges

Self-publishing can be a full time job. With your help, I can aggressively promote this exciting undertaking. My goal is to tour to promote this book. More than one beta reader has commented on the fact that the book would make a good movie.

I have spent the last three years enlisting the help of friends who have taught, or still teach English to refine my manuscript. I employed beta readers to give me their true “reader’s perspective.” All of them were positive with honest view points. Many hours with my wife reading to me allowed me to disconnect momentarily from a writers myopic viewpoint. All of this has helped me in the editing process. I have done my utmost to present the most professional product I am able to.

With your help, success will come faster for the advertising and publication. Together, we can all win. Please read the crowd funding rewards section to carefully determine at which level you would like to participate

Your investment will include the creation and printing of professional book cover art. This is the final step to publication. A website will follow with a blog section, and contact information. Road trips will be part of my agenda. With your level of participation, your town, city or home can make my schedule.


                                     



Writing Samples

Just then, two phase blasts hit The Armstrong, one just aft of the bridge and another port side, at mid-ship. The bridge exploded with debris, everyone was slammed into something solid or found themselves on the deck. Commander Morgan rose first with blood dripping from a head wound. He still had his senses about him. Captain Arnold lay bleeding on the deck, along with half of the bridge crew.


                                                      

                                  


       

 “Mikal! We just received a message from HQ on screen. It’s marked urgent! Mikal!”

Mikal roused himself from his nap, “Vander, you’re on this shift. What’s so damned important that you have to wake me up?”

“HQ sent orders to initiate a class-A storm in the Pegasus Sector Now!” Vander snapped back.

“Shit! Why didn’t you say so in the first place?” Mikal responded as he rose out of his bunk quickly for a large man, most of Mikal’s bulk was muscle. With a little belly that he swore he was going to work off when this present assignment was over. He joined Vander at the central console and studied the message.

“Check the Pegasus sector for any inhabited systems, Vander, what have we got?”

“There are the Keks, Terelians, Ductas, and the Thumarian systems,” Vander reported.

“The Kek, Terelian, and the Ducta’s systems we could live without. The Thumarians could play a vital part in our future plans.” Mikal paused as he made up his mind. “Plot the storms path to intercept the Kek and Terelians. The Thumarian system should catch only the very edge. Target the star P1-A42b and set course immediately.”


                                                      

                                     



We entered the Oort cloud, passing numerous sized rocks, from pea to house size. “Good flying, Commander.” Just then, a two hundred foot asteroid floated in front of us, too fast for us to avoid.

Dr. Keleg screamed, “Admiral!”

“We’re about to find out how the dimensional generator works. Stay on course, Commander.”

Her knuckles were white as she held our course. We all stopped breathing the moment we passed through the meteor as if it was thin air. An audible gasp of relief escaped us all.


                                                       

                                    



“Thumar set off a matter anti-matter detonation.” Vander moaned. “The resulting shockwave deflected seventy-seven point five percent of the storm away from their inner solar system. Thumar was spared somehow, they figured out in seven days what took us one hundred and fifty years to perfect.”

“Shit! We’re screwed now. Your damn creature figured it out, didn’t he? That SOB set us back at least one hundred and fifty years of culling the galactic herd. The Prime Council is going to have our heads. Well, he’s your lab rat. You’re going answer for this one, Vander!”


                 

                                    Editor-in-Chief, Harley, the scrappy cat!


Additional Perks

Lieutenant Commander

  • A professional artist’s rendition of Derak and Shesain with a print of the book cover art signed by the artist.

  • A VIP invitation to the official USA release party. Travel and accommodations not included.

Commander

  • A framed professional artist’s renditions of Derak and Shesain with a print of the book cover art signed by the artist.
  • A VIP invitation to the official USA release party. Travel and accommodations not included.

Captain

  • A framed professional artist’s renditions of Derak and Shesain with a print of the framed book cover art signed by the artist.

  • A private reading with up to 15 of your friends and family will be included, with signed copies of the book for all, and a meet and greet time with the author. Travel is restricted to the continental US only.

  • A VIP invitation to the official USA release party, and any international release parties. Travel and accommodations not included.

story:
What This Project is All About

Hello Friend, my name is Bassey Efiok and I am the author of “DAILY PRAISE AND PRAYER”; a popular book that’s empowering many to easily connect with God and find true peace and joy through effective praise and prayer. The book brings you a collection of powerful praises and prayers that you can use anytime to praise God freely and passionately and to pray effectively so that you can receive answers for your needs.

The book was released just last year, yet it has greatly inspired many lives. Most of the readers who have communicated with me are so excited about the book that they are asking for more contents: They are asking for more praises and prayers with broader coverage to meet most human needs and desires

For these reasons, I have launched this project to create a new and expanded edition of Daily Praise and Prayer. I envision a new edition of a daily devotional published in BOOK, VIDEO and eBOOK formats in full color with photos and graphics.  It will be very exciting, very precious, very rewarding, easy to read and a keepsake to readers. 

But as excited as I am about creating this book, I realize that I very much need your support. I’ll very much appreciate your financial support to help cover the cost of creating and publishing this book. Knowing that there is a community of people like you out there participating in creating this book and waiting for it’s debut, strengthens me much to get it over the finish line. It will feel like it is “our book” and not just “my book.”


What This Book Can Do For You

Praise and prayer are very powerful spiritual tools that enable people to worship God beautifully, joyfully, powerfully and with a personal touch. Whether we admit it or not, deep in the consciousness of every human being, there is a mysterious yearning for One who is greater than all of us. This yearning is an in-born beacon alerting us to the One true God who loves all of us. Many have searched far and wide in the hope of finding Him and building a closer relationship with Him, but have not yet succeeded. This book can help. 


What We Need and How You Can Help

To fully realize this book as I envision it, I need to raise about $15,000. I also need to reach many people with information about the project. I believe many will be gladdened by the content and purpose of this book. Here are two ways that you can help me meet these needs.

1. Financial Support. I will very much appreciate your generous financial support to help pay for the cost of professionally creating and producing this book. Kindly donate generously and choose a reward in return.

2. Share This Information. I will also very much appreciate your generous efforts in sharing information about this project with your family, friends, associates and social media contacts. 


How The Funds Shall Be Spent

Funds will be spent according to the following allocations:

  • Editing    12%
  • Graphics and Video Design    20% 
  • Page layout Design and Pre-press  15%
  • Initial print of 700 copies  18%
  • Marketing    35%
  • Total  100%


What You Get With Your Donation 

Below, find the donation levels and the perks that come with it. Donate as much as you possibly can.

$15 – One digital copy of Daily Praise And Prayer

$30 –  One hard copy of Daily Praise And Prayer (unsigned)

$50 – One autographed hard copy of Daily Praise And Prayer + A JinHao 250 Gold Trim Fountain Pen

$100 – One autographed hard copy and one e-book of Daily Praise And Prayer. Plus  one JinHao 250 gold-trim fountain pen.

$300 - Two autographed hard copies and two e-books of Daily Praise And Prayer for you and your partner or friend. Plus one Lanxivi Jinhao 159 Gold Trim Fountain Pen. Plus, your name will be printed on the acknowledgement page of the book.

$500 - Three autographed hard copies and three e-books of Daily Praise And Prayer for you and your family and friends. Plus one Parker IM Gold-Trim Fountain Pen (a $50 value). Plus, your name will be printed on the acknowledgement page of the book. Will send the extra copies to whoever you designate.

$1000 - Five autographed hard copies and Five e-books of Daily Praise And Prayer for you and your family and friends. Plus one Sheaffer Prelude Gold-Trim Premium Fountain Pen (a $95 value). Plus, your name will be printed on the acknowledgement page of the book. Plus I will pray for you, your family and your business for one month, and you can send in your prayer requests to me during this one month. Will send the extra copies to whoever you designate.

$5000 - Seven autographed hard copies and Seven e-books of Daily Praise And Prayer for you and your family and friends. Plus one Diplomat Excellence A Gold-Trim Premium Fountain Pen, engraved with your name (a $200 value). Plus, your name will be printed on the acknowledgement page of the book. Plus I will pray for you, your family and your business for five months, and you’ll have direct access to me during these five months for prayers and spiritual guidance. Will send the extra copies to whoever you designate.

$7000 - Nine autographed hard copies and Nine e-books of Daily Praise And Prayer for you and your family and friends. Plus one Parker Premier Gold-Trim Premium Fountain Pen engraved with your name (a $300 value). Plus, your name will be printed on the acknowledgement page of the book. Plus I will pray for you, your family and your business for twelve months, and you’ll have direct access to me during these twelve months for prayers and spiritual guidance. Will send the extra copies to whoever you designate.


This Project Shall Surely Be Completed 

Every project has its own challenges. But we are sure to resolve any challenges that may come up and complete this project. I bring in tremendous expertise from having successfully written and published the first edition of this book, and other books that I authored in the past. Even if this fundraising campaign does not reach its target, the project will still be be completed because I will  find other ways to raise additional funds. I have already dedicated numerous hours and funds to the writing aspect of the book.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the Campaign With Others. Please share this campaign as widely as possible. The Indiegogo share tools under the video at the top of this page make this nice and easy.

And that's all there is to it.

story:
I am a professional luthier, and have been building performance level steel-string, flamenco and classical guitars for almost 45 years.  Among other things, I am known for a number of innovations now becoming common in handmade guitars:  ergonomic body bevels (which I call the Armrest and Ribrest) and being the co-creator of the Sideport Soundhole, a second soundhole on the upper side of the guitar that acts as a monitor for the player and enhances the outgoing sound.  I have been awarded the Saidye Bronfman Award For Excellence, Canada’s highest award for craft, and have been made a member of the Order Of Canada, our highest civilian honour.


Separate from the guitars themselves, I’ve become known around the world for the hand engraved Inlay Art that I put on the necks of my guitars.  These are always one of a kind designs, always original art, responding to my clients’ themes, and rendered in dozens of species of shell, stone, legal ivories and metals.


In 2003 the first book about my Inlay Art, “A Guitarmaker’s Canvas—The Inlay Art Of Grit Laskin” was published by Backbeat Books of California.  That book sold out its print run and is no longer available in its original form.

For the last three and half years I have been working on a follow-up volume to that book.  This time I am focusing on 50 complex Inlay projects that have been completed over the last 13 years.  This new book, an oversize, hard-cover, coffee-table book with a primary title of “GRAND COMPLICATIONS”, will be a much more in-depth look at my creative process, as well as being filled with more than 400 images. 

The focus of this book is really to pull back the curtain on my process of creating the design, of responding to clients’ ideas and illustrating their stories.  Here’s an except from the book’s Preface, which makes that point:

  [I’m on the phone, long distance, with a client.  I’ve reached the point in the construction of this guitar that a decision on the theme of the inlay must be made. 

“Ummmm…” he says, then pauses, “Peace! That’s what I want.  Do something on Peace.” 

“Okay, Okay…sure.  I can do that, “ I reply. “But what are you seeing when you say the word ‘Peace’?”

“Oh, nothing specific,” he answers.  “I want to see what you come up with.”

  I hang up.  My mind is immediately swamped with images of people, places, events, all in some way or other linked to my sense of the word ‘Peace’.  Simultaneously my left brain is deluging me with questions: Do I know enough about this client to be able to guess his sympathies?  His nation is currently at war—what if I make too bold an anti-war statement with my design?  Will I offend him? Please him? I think he’s old enough to have participated in or protested the war in Vietnam—should I pull images from that era?  From today?  from the Occupy Movement?  and on and on.

  Sometimes the creative freedom offered by a client like this is a blessing, sometimes a curse.  Polar opposite from this are clients who bombard me with so many disparate themes and concepts, in email after email, phone call after phone call, that this can equally be both a blessing and a curse.  Yes, I may be given much to work with but how do I extract only the right elements from another person’s very personal experiences? How do I distil a novel’s worth of their themes and digressions into a film script, with a focused central narrative?]

GRAND COMPLICATIONS will take the reader on a journey into my own thoughts, following me as I sometimes crawl my way to the final designs, through the difficulties and successes, hitting stumbling blocks but then following the sparks that lead me to solutions. 

Why Am I Fundraising?

The short answer is that this will be an expensive book to produce.  And in current times, arrangements with publishers of this kind of book require it to be a co-production, in which we share the editing, design and printing costs and they do the marketing and promotion.  I do have a publisher involved, FIGURE 1, based in Vancouver, BC, and they have distribution around the world.

As some visual artist friends have explained to me, this publishing model has always existed in the art world.  Many of the beautiful coffee-table art books you see, especially those illustrating the work of living artists, are almost always 50% financed by either the artist, the gallery who represents them, or an institution.

I have accepted this model and will hope to be able to raise the funds I need to contribute my share.  Publication is scheduled for early October, 2016.

I hope you can help me get this book published!

Thank you for considering this project.

William ‘Grit” Laskin

story:
Did you know that the Jamaica Blue Mountain Coffee that is the favourite brew of Agent 007, James Bond, is grown and packaged in East Rural St. Andrew, Jamaica? Did you also know that international reggae icon, Bob Marley, one of Time Magazine’s 100 Most Influential People of the Twentieth Century, once had his home in Bull Bay, in this same East Rural St. Andrew? Well, now you do!


The Vision

As I seek to become the next Member of Parliament (MP), it has been a remarkable experience learning the nuances of one of the most complex constituencies in Jamaica. Ours is a very special constituency with countless stories of people who have helped make Jamaica an unforgettable place on the world map. At the core of our campaign is the belief that if we work together we can accomplish even more extraordinary things in East Rural St Andrew. 

Through our joint concerted efforts – what we call fullticipation - we will:

  • Activate the village spirit in our communities (take ownership of solutions).
  • Energise our community-based organisations  (take responsibility for planning & execution).
  • Utilise the research and body of work of local scientists, engineers and NGOs (consult national know-how).
  • Leverage global partnerships for foreign direct investment (access international expertise & funding).
We intend that ultimately (over the long term) this will translate to an improved road network; accessible potable water; education; employment opportunities; and a structured social welfare safety net for our most vulnerable.

Winning the Seat

But first we have to win the seat in the upcoming General Elections and we need your support! In order to achieve consistently effective engagement that translates to votes, we need to raise US$60,000 towards the overall campaign cost. This will assist with:

  1. Political rallies and Community Walks – getting the message out to large groups convened in one place and connecting with people where they are – in the streets, at the neighbourhood shop or sitting on their verandahs
  2. Our people – providing training, materials and systems. Our campaign office is supported by administrative staff and volunteer canvassers.
  3. Logistics – getting our people and programmes to all corners of the constituency. Transportation before and during elections is critical.
  4. Marketing – being the face people associate with solutions and effective leadership. We need advertisements, flyers, T-shirts, buttons and media support.
We are ready to do the work that will make us a model constituency for social justice and development in Jamaica. Your input will add substantive value to our campaign and efforts. Please donate now!


Thank you!

Thank you so much for reading. Please do watch our video so you may learn more about the people and the communities I intend to represent.

Together we can!

One Love,

Imani

story:
American Female: a true tale of adventure

I'm Emily, a Saint Louis, MO native, author, producer, creative, and doer. I've devoted the past three years of my life to writing, editing, and creating American Female: a true tale of adventure. It is the next Great American Novel, best described as "The Devil Wears Prada" meets "Eat, Pray, Love" while "On the Road," and filled with action, adventure, passion, scandal, and self-actualization.

Middle-class, mid-career, and Midwestern, twenty-something Emily Carpenter walks into a new job that isn’t middle anything. In only slightly more time than it takes to get a passport, this brave adventuress finds herself thrust into a world of lavish luxury, corporate hijinks, and personal scandal. Jet-setting around the globe with her sociopathic boss, she discovers the line between right and wrong is generally negotiable, and almost always in a language other than English. Forced to her breaking point, Emily has to decide what is more important: her old self-respect or her new career. But first - she’ll have to survive.


Teamwork Makes the Dream Work

This true tale of adventure demands to be shared, so I've teamed up with a talented group of creatives to make it happen.

Our collaboration resulted in some incredible stuff, including high-quality designs, a suite of four American Female short film book trailers with custom music production, a kick-ass launch party featuring craft beer from 4Hands Brewery, gourmet food from Burger 809, live art by Cherokee Street Reach artists, AF trailer screening and pop-up shop, AF art & print gallery, and NYC DJ Nebraska Jones flying in to spin all night.  

American Female Trailer Suite

The American Female Trailer Suite presents a visual and aural experience through the four main themes of the literature: tension, mysticism, adventure, and passion.

#1 TENSION


#2 MYSTICISM


#3 ADVENTURE


#4 PASSION



What I Need

I need $10,000. As an independent author, publisher, and marketer, I'm 100% financially responsible for the American Female book launch. I've been making it happen, but now I need your help. Your donation will allow me to actualize my vision in its entirety and bring my story, my passion - my dreams - to life.

Every single dollar will go toward the launch of American Female. This will allow me to 1.) complete the recording of the AF audio book, 2.) finish the creation of an AF art appendix, 3.) print books to ship out for reviews (key for a successful launch), 4.) invest in additional marketing and publicity efforts to spread the word and increase visibility of the book and trailers, 5.) support the 2016 AF book tour, and 6.) begin work on the AF screenplay (scheduled to commence June 2016).

Stretch Goal

Funding raised beyond the initial goal will be applied in the above areas as needed to ensure the success of the American Female book launch, specifically preparing for the creation of the American Female screenplay, and a few other awesome AF-related projects I've had on the back burner just because they didn't fit in the budget. 

What You Get

With your donation, you become an integral part of bringing the next Great American Novel to life. You will also receive perks based on my favorite things: CREATING and EXPERIENCES. Choose from autographed copies of American Female, launch party tickets, custom bookmarks and t-shirts, hand-painted AF art, storytelling sessions, and real life adventures.

I have full confidence that with your support, we can meet the AF financial goal. If for some reason it is not met, 100% of the funds will still be put to use toward the American Female book launch expenses, as described above. This is happening, no matter what.

The Impact

Your donation makes a HUGE impact. 

Supporting this project is not only supporting me - it is supporting each and every person who has contributed to the creation of American Female in all its forms. From filmmakers to music producers, designers and animators, to small businesses and more, I've been able to create jobs and provide opportunities for the creative and entrepreneurial community to put their expertise to work. Help me continue to do this, and bring American Female to life.

Your donation also supports fostering more creativity. With every copy of American Female sold, $1 dollar will be donated to the Cherokee Street Reach, an organization focused on empowering Saint Louis City youth through art and experiential learning 

Risks & Challenges

Life is risk and of course there are challenges to encounter (I've encountered many along the way thus far), but I don't quit, so I can't fail.

You can help this project be successful by donating now and spreading the word. 

Please tell your friends and family. Share with them the passion I have for this story. Tweet, Facebook & Instagram my campaign. Share the trailers! Word of mouth is the best referral. I appreciate all of the support.

Always in Gratitude,
Emily
