story:
IF YOU STILL WANT TO SUPPORT THIS PROJECT email me at AlmaAlexander@AlmaAlexander.org for a PayPal link where you can do so...

 

CONFIRMED PARTICIPATING AUTHORS: Jane Yolen, Brenda Cooper, Irene Radford, Marie Brennan, Seanan McGuire,  Aliette de Bodard, Jacey Bedford, Joyce Reynolds-Ward, and more - FOUR DAYS LEFT to support this project and get new stories from all these wonderful writers!

 

Hello, my name is Alma Alexander… and I am one of the unmoored.

I have been lucky enough in my lifetime not to have been one of those truly adrift – I have never been forced out of a home, or a country, or made to go to strange places I could not understand, against my wishes, terrified and frozen. But I left the country of my birth aged 10, never to return there permanently to try and re-connect the severed roots. This does not mean I ceased to love it – this is the ground where the bones of my ancestors are buried, where their ghosts walk yet if such things can be; this is the place where the river I love so much runs eternally between shores of mud and thistle and weeping willow, the place where a sliver of my spirit lives still, lives always. And I understand, on that visceral level, what it means to be FORCED to leave a place one calls home.

I feel for the children whose early – whose *only* – memories involve bombs and fire and fury and guns and bullets and dust and blood and loss and grief. I feel for the emptiness I see blossoming behind their eyes, underneath the pain, the inability to understand why such things can be. I understand the way an older child might feel when torn apart from those first precious friendships with one’s peers, from the security and warmth of a family home; when witnessing the carnage of a hot war blowing up around them, none of their doing, something that they can do absolutely nothing about and that is completely capable of destroying everything they have ever believed to be true, like a dragon breathing a plume of flame on their lives and leaving ashes behind.

I watch these driven people who have lost everything climb on overladen boats which sink under the weight of frightened women and children and the few men who are trying to save them. I can see pictures daily of the hungry, of the abandoned, of the families torn apart, of children sitting catatonic with pain and loss under streaks and smears of blood and dirt. I can see it all on the news, on social media, in headlines, across the world, every day.

And I wonder what I can do. What I, and those like me, can do.

We can tell stories. Not THEIR stories – those are theirs to tell, some day, maybe. But stories like theirs. Stories which will reach out and tell other people about the truth of their lives, through the “lies” of fiction, of fantasy. We can shine a light, we who create art, into the dark places of this world. That is what we are for. That is what we do. That is what the best of us do, anyway. What we want to do. What we NEED to do.

This project is a collection of stories. Some by names you might recognize quickly; others, from writers who might have a more intimate, more visceral, connection with the subject matter, and of whom you might not have heard (yet). We are here to tell the stories. And when you choose to help us do this, with this book, with the collection of stories by the “Children of a Different Sky”, you join us to learn, and to share, and to grieve, and to make sure that the least and the most bitterly lost amongst us are not – are NEVER – forgotten.

Back in the land I come from, there is a beloved poet called Aleksa Santic, and a beloved and well known poem entitled, “Ostajte ovdje” – “Stay Here”. Young children of my heritage and culture know these lines – they are engraved on the souls of the humans of my nation. They are these:

Ostajte ovdje – sunce tudjeg neba

Nece vas grijat k’o sto ovo grije.

Gorki su tamo zalogaji hljeba

Gde svoga nema i gde brata nije.

 

Loosely translated,  with poetic licence, they read:

 

Stay here – the sun of a foreign sky

Will never warm you like this one in your own heaven

Bitter is the bread in that place

Where you you’re among strangers and not amongst your brothers.

 

We who were born under that sun, understand. There is no place like home, after all.

Like I said, I was never amongst those forced to leave such a place, which they knew, which they loved, where they belonged. But I left, nevertheless. And the poet is at least halfway right in that I never really feel more myself then when I (rarely, now) return to stand on the shores of the river which flows past the city of my birth. I, too, in a distant and rather more comfortable sense than some are today, am a refugee.

    

And this book, this collection, this effort to gather the stories and to make sure that they are not forgotten, this is my attempt to help save both the souls and the bodies of those who now need us most.

The vast majority of the money raised by this crowdfunding project will be passed on to several agencies who work with and offer aid to the refugees of our era. They used to be Jewish children running from the German Reich; today, they might be Syrian kids running from the ruins of Aleppo or Yazidi women fleeing enslavement in the darkness of cultural recidivism; Tomorrow, they might be ourselves.

We are all one. And there, where one of us stumbles over rubble, bloodied and in pain, having lost everything… there, but for the grace of God, goes any of us.

If you marched in a pussy hat in any city in the world where like-minded people gathered together… if you had the courage and the fury to follow your passion  by being one of the thousands who streamed to America’s airports after Donald Trump’s heavy-handed sledgehammer blow of the refugee/immigrant travel ban in the last days of January 2017… if you spent your precious time on the phone to your representatives decrying the injustices of the new era… I salute you, and I love you all, very much. If for whatever reason you could not march or raise your voices in the “No Fear/NoHate” cries at the airport or your voice strangles in your throat if you have to speak on the phone to a stranger… there are always ways to make your stand. Supporting this crowdfund – buying this book – throws your support both towards the writers and artists and other publishing professionals who made this happen, and in the days of defunding the arts that also is a statement of defiance, and makes certain that you have been a part in funneling much needed funds to organizations which work directly with the lost and the dispossessed. You helped. You can sit right there at your computer, right now, and click the “No Fear/No Hate” button. Help us help those who need us most in this moment.

 

Pass the word about this. Share with people you know who might be willing to come on board.

 

SUBMISSION GUIDELINES for the anthology are in the Updates!

 

STRETCH GOALS!

 

$8000 – all contributors at $5 or higher receive a .pdf copy of Alma Alexander’s short story, “Refugees”

$8500 –all contributors at $5 or higher receive a .pdf copy of Alma Alexander’s Pushcart-Prize-nominated story, “The Bones of Our Ancestors, the Blood of Our Flowers”. It will be ILLUSTRATED. By me. I am no great shakes as an artist but you’ll have the artist’s vision both in words and in pictures.

$9500 – all contributors at $5 or higher receive a Kindle ebook of Alma Alexander’s collection “Weight of Worlds”

$10,500 – all contributors at $5 or higher receive an ebook copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail’s “Yesterday’s Dreams”

$11,000 - all contributors at $5 or higher receive an ebook copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail’s “The Halfling’s Court”

$11,500 - all contributors at $5 or higher receive an ebook copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail’s “A Legacy of Stars”

$13,000 – all contributors at $10 or higher receive a copy of the novella “Silver Shark”  by Ilona  Andrews, exploring the adventures of a woman who is a refugee from an bleak industrial war-ravaged world.

$15,000 – all contributors at $15 or higher will receive an illustrated hard copy of  “The Bones of Our Ancestors, the Blood of Our Flowers” – but this time illustrated by James Artimus Brown.

$18,000 –  contributors of $25 or higher receive a paperback copy of “Letters from the Fire” by Alma Alexander and R A Deckert (while stocks last;  these are the last available copies of the paperback edition, now out of print; if the number of contributors at this level exceeds the number of available books, or expresses a preference for it, an ebook version of the book can be substituted.)

$19,000 – 5 additional stories will be included in the anthology.

$20,000 – for all those who contribute $150 or more, Nisi Shawl will offer a Tuckerization in her new novel!

$25,000 – 8 more stories  and an additional charity recipient will be added to the anthology

Additional stretch goals may be added as they become available.

I am no great shakes as an artist but you’ll have the artist’s vision both in words and in pictures.$9500 – all contributors at $5 or higher receive a Kindle ebook of Alma Alexander’s collection “Weight of Worlds”$10,500 – all contributors at $5 or higher receive an ebook copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail’s “Yesterday’s Dreams”$11,000 - all contributors at $5 or higher receive an ebook copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail’s “The Halfling’s Court”$11,500 - all contributors at $5 or higher receive an ebook copy of Danielle Ackley-McPhail’s “A Legacy of Stars”$13,000 – all contributors at $10 or higher receive a copy of the novella “Silver Shark”  by Ilona  Andrews, exploring the adventures of a woman who is a refugee from an bleak industrial war-ravaged world.$15,000 – all contributors at $15 or higher will receive an illustrated hard copy of  “The Bones of Our Ancestors, the Blood of Our Flowers” – but this time illustrated by James Artimus Brown.$18,000 –  contributors of $25 or higher receive a paperback copy of “Letters from the Fire” by Alma Alexander and R A Deckert (while stocks last;  these are the last available copies of the paperback edition, now out of print; if the number of contributors at this level exceeds the number of available books, or expresses a preference for it, an ebook version of the book can be substituted.)$19,000 – 5 additional stories will be included in the anthology.$20,000 – for all those who contribute $150 or more, Nisi Shawl will offer a Tuckerization in her new novel!$25,000 – 8 more stories  and an additional charity recipient will be added to the anthologyAdditional stretch goals may be added as they become available.

story:
What's this all about?

Starship Moonhawk is about to blast off in a whole new way, and you, the dedicated fans of both my series and the actors we've chosen to play your favorite parts, will finally be able to help us get to the next level. That level is: THE DRAMATIC AUDIOBOOK! Specifically, a roughly 40-50 minute full-throttle audio experience from the episode "The Death of Perseus".

What We Need:

In order to pull this off, we need your help! We have script editors, producers, a director, actors and artists to consider, and this is where you come in. We want to create a "movie in your mind" experience, and your pledge will help us toward that goal.

What Will I Get?

You will receive an unparalleled entertainment experience in the form of the best dramatic audiobook we are able to produce. Not only will it have voice acting, but it will have sounds and an original musical score from Jared Cowing and Keith W's band. We also have some fantastic rewards for going above and beyond in this endeavor. Rewards such as a rare look into the early days of the webcomic as well as parts of the soundtrack I commissioned that have yet to be used. Or, perhaps you'd rather mingle with the cast and crew of my podcast, Up Late with Mace. The opportunities are all there.

The Impact

You personally will get to come away with a piece of entertainment history. We're not the first audiobook of this kind, but we want this one to be the one you remember first. We want to be the one you talk about when the subject comes up at your book club or around the water cooler. But we can only get there with the help of your contributions.

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges are many, but we want this to be a positive experience for all. Plus, we want to be able to bring our players back to do the next volume and the next after that. In order to make that happen, we must be successful with this, our first outing. I've never undertaken a project of this scope before, so I am sailing into uncharted waters. The good news is that I have an experienced team of professionals led by my producer/director Keith W., and I feel that under their guidance, we will be able to bring you a truly unforgettable story experience.

I hope you all have a great time supporting us and watching the magic happen.

Michael C. Prokop 
Creator, Starship Moonhawk


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Let's raise the roof and make some noise, folks! Be sure to blog, repost and Like this bad-boy all over the Internet!
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools, too!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
¿Quienes somos? ¿Who are we? 

La Fundación Colectivo Frente Unido está conformada por un grupo de jóvenes profesionales de las áreas de Historia, Sociología, Ciencia Política, Psicología, Comunicación Social, Fotografía y Cine. Pese a encontrarnos en distintas ciudades -Buenos Aires, Quebec, Bogotá, Medellín- hemos podido construir una red a la distancia en pro del proyecto de investigación ¡Camilo Vive! del cual formamos parte.

Este proyecto que nació en una hermosa primavera porteña en el año 2010 se ha propuesto recuperar la mayor cantidad de archivos y objetos en todos sus formatos de y sobre Camilo Torres Restrepo; archivos y objetos que por demás se encuentran dispersos en varios países del mundo. 

Colectivo Frente Unido Foundation it’s an organization that formed by a group of young historians, sociologists, political scientists, phycologists, social communicators, photographers and filmmakers. We have built an investigative network called ¡Camilo Vive!, in several cities like Buenos Aires, Quebec, Bogotá, Medellin and others, around the life and thought of Camilo Torres Restrepo with the purpose of rescuing his memory and legacy. 

This Project, which was born during the beautiful Argentinian spring of 2010, wants to recollect and recover, as much as possible, all of the objects and archives about, and of, Camilo Torres Restrepo Available in the world.

¿Qué haremos? ¿What shall we do? 

Como sabemos de la gran cantidad de archivos (algunos institucionales y oficiales, otros de carácter privado) existentes sobre Camilo Torres Restrepo y de su proyecto político el Frente Unido del pueblo del año 1965, nos hemos propuesto como primer paso de esta campaña recuperar y salvaguardar aquellos archivos y objetos que se encuentran en las ciudades de Bogotá y Medellín. Esto lo haremos a partir de tareas concretas de escaneo, fotografía y sistematización.

As we know, there is a vast quantity of private and institutional archives about Camilo Torres Restrepo and his políticalproyect, created in 1965, el FrenteUnido. Therefore, as a first step, we have the commitment to find, recover and safeguard the objects and archives available in the cities of Bogotá and Medellin. We would concentrate our labor in organizing, scanning and photographing the pieces of history that we should find. 

¿Qué queremos? ¿What do we want? 

¡Queremos compartir contigo nuestros hallazgos! Que tú puedas acceder de manera abierta y gratuita a toda la información concerniente a Camilo Torres Restrepo y su proyecto del Frente Unido del Pueblo. Mucha de ella, ¡información nunca antes vista!

Con ello también buscamos promover la creación colectiva del conocimiento a través de la lectura, escritura, reflexión y diálogo en torno a Camilo y su proyecto político. 

Nuestra experiencia investigativa nos lleva a afirmar que este es un valioso aporte y una gran oportunidad para la preservación de la memoria social y política no solo de Colombia sino que además de América Latina. 

¡We want to share with all of you our findings! Our primary goal it’s to share to the world all the documents, objects and information that we collect about Camilo Torres Restrepo and his political project (FrenteUnido). The reason for this, it’s that we would like to promote, through the reading, the writing, the thinkin and the discussion, the building of a collective knowledge of Camilo and his political project. 

Our experience as social scientiststell us that this project might be an important step in the road to preserve the social and political memory of Colombia and Latin America, because, in the end, that’s it what Camilo is: part of our history.


¿Por dónde empezaremos?

Como te habíamos mencionado anteriormente son muchos los archivos por indagar, así que hemos realizado una primera selección basados en un orden de prioridades:

As we have already mentioned you, there are lots of archives about Camilo waiting for being studied. However, because our limited time and hands to work, we need to prioritize our work in the main archives. These archives are:


Archivos/Archives:

  • Archivo General de la Nación, Bogotá
  • Universidad Nacional de Colombia, Bogotá
  • Biblioteca Luis Ángel Arango, Bogotá
  • Biblioteca Pública Piloto, Medellín
  • Universidad de Antioquia, Medellín

We are also very interested in the photographic testimonies of Camilo, and his political project, that why we would search in a series of newspaper for all the photos related to him. The newspapers were we would search are:

Fototecas:

  • Periódico Voz
  • Periódico El Tiempo
  • Periódico El Espectador
  • Periódico El Vespertino
  • Periódico El Espacio
  • Periódico La Prensa
  • Archivo Prensa Latina

¿Qué necesitamos? ¿What does we need for succeeding? 


Recursos tecnológicos apropiados y de alta calidad:

  • Escánares de alta resolución
  • Cámaras fotográficas
  • NAS (Network Attached Storage) para salvaguardar la información
  • Grabadoras digitales de voz

Además de sufragar el trabajo de 4 asistentes de investigación y la creación y mantenimiento de una página web.

We need high tech equipment’s like: high resolution scanners, Network Attached Storage for saving the information recollected, professional cameras and digital recorder for the verbal testimonies. We also need to pay four investigators and for the creation and maintenance of an official web page.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar
Other ways to help us   

No sólo necesitamos dinero, nos puedes ayudar:

  • Compartiendo tus testimonios, anécdotas, fotos y/o archivos de Camilo.
  • Sumándote a la campaña enviando un video: ¡Camilo vive!
  • Difundiendo esta campaña: usa las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.

Off course we need some money for achieving our goals, but it’s not the only thing that we need. Other ways of collaborating with this project, besides donation, are:

  • Sharing with us your anecdotes, testimonies, documents or photos related to Camilo.
  • You can join us in this initiative by sending a video were you say “¡Camilo Vive!
  • We would be very grateful with you if you help us by sharing this campaign through the social networks. 

¡Gracias por tu solidaridad! ¡Thanks for your solidarity!

story:
"YOU HAVE CANCER”

Holy Crap! Those are three little words no one ever wants to hear. They will change your life forever. They sure changed mine. For me, it was ovarian cancer and the prognosis was not great.  My thoughts went from cancer to fear to pain to death in a nanosecond. I couldn’t think straight. The next thing I knew, I was being set up for more scans…more blood work and scheduled for surgery. My life had been taken over by strangers. I felt overwhelmed and out of control. I needed some time to think but, really, who could think?

 Nothing in my forty years as a nurse ever prepared me for being on the receiving end of this kind of news. I knew that I needed to get a jump on the fear so that I could be a full participant in my own healing. After all, it was my body. I was able to deal with the fear pretty quickly with a lot of support. That gave me a little breathing room.  As much as I wanted the cancer out of my body right now, I learned that a cancer diagnosis is not an emergency and it is not a death sentence. It was essential for me to step back, get on top of the fear allowing me to make some rational decisions after exploring all of my treatment options before I committed to anything.

I had long ago integrated a mind-body-spirit approach to the patients in my care and found I had to do the same thing for myself. I believe deeply that the body has an amazing ability to self-heal. A cut on the finger heals in days with little more than a Band-Aid. We can get over a cold with some Tylenol, rest and a box of tissues. We expect that.  We don’t give it a second thought. That’s just how the body works, however, we have been taught you can’t just “get over” cancer. Cancer is different. Or is it? My job was to figure that out.

I boldly told my doctor (with more than a bit of false bravado) that I was going to make it all go away. The nurse in me wanted the surgery so that I could hedge my bets and also it to prove to myself (and the doctors) that I was already healed. The woo woo part of me pulled out all the stops to fulfill my intention for complete wellness. Much to everyone’s surprise, indeed shock, the surgery revealed that the huge tumor wrapped around my right ovary was no longer cancerous and all of the twenty or so biopsied “hot spots” were clean. A second tumor on the left was nowhere to be found. I didn’t need any chemo or radiation because there was nothing left to treat. Yay for me!  

This is just a small snapshot of my story and an over-simplification, of course. It is important to say that I did not do this alone. I had a goodly amount of Divine Intervention, a gifted surgeon and my awesome Healing Team of friends, family and colleagues who lovingly supported me with an unwavering belief that I would be well.

THE MISSION

So why am I telling you all this since everything worked out well for me? Because of my experience, I am now on a mission to help others touched by cancer to do what I did. That is, to help them overcome their fear, take back their power, overhaul their belief system that tells them cancer is a death sentence and then embracing a holistic approach to healing that includes celebrating their wellbeing by caring for their mind, body and spirit. Sounds like a great idea but how?

THE BOOK

I am, currently, putting the finishing touches on my book, Extraordinary Healing, Ordinary Miracle: Choosing WellBeing over Fearing Cancer . Part I chronicles my journey from a highly probable death sentence (statistically speaking) to my complete healing. It highlights all of the positive shifts in my own thoughts, feelings and beliefs about cancer and of the many miracles I experienced along the way.  In Part II, I deconstruct what I did for my healing and why I did what I did. As to exactly how that would all happen...well, I left that up to the universe.                

                                                          

                                

   

                                    THE GOAL

The first phase of the mission is to begin a movement that shifts the focus from our current healthcare system which is really a disease management system to a WellBeing Restoration and Maintenance system. This paradigm shift Starts with each of us as individuals and then helping it go viral (pun intended) to the masses.

This is a huge and lofty goal.  I have been a pediatric nurse for more than forty years so I understand “baby steps”. I am seeking funding through Indiegogo to take the first baby step which is to get my book out (optimistically  in July 2015) to you and anyone who has been touched by cancer . For that to happen, I need to cover the costs of editing, formatting, cover design, website design, initial printing, perk fulfillment, promotion and Indiegogo fees. The approximate bare bones budget is $7,500.

I will also use my book as calling card to get more speaking engagements to share my message with ever larger audiences.  By the way, if you have group that could use good speaker (some might even say a really, really good speaker) with an inspirational and compelling message, please let me know.

THE STRETCH GOAL

If we go beyond the original goal, all additional funds will be used for our stretch goal to complete the development of our WellBeing Restoration and Maintenance Program for those facing not just cancer but any catastrophic illness or injury by empowering them to make their own health choices and helping them navigate the health care system by bridging the gap between traditional medicine and holistic healing.

                        THIS IS WHERE YOU COME IN

So that’s the mission. I need help. I need your help. I am not asking that you walk or run for anything or to wear a disease-of-the-month ribbon of any color. I'm asking you to claim one of the awesome perks I am offering to you for your caring and generosity. Even if you can only give a small amount or none at all, I ask that you spread the word any way you can by sharing it with everyone you know. You can shout it from the rooftops, post it on Facebook, Tweet it, Blog it or send it out in an email, snail mail, Morse code or smoke signals. The more people who know about it, the more people we can help. Who among us has not been touched by cancer in some way? Together we can make a difference. Together we can make a miracle.  I am asking you to help make extraordinary healing an ordinary miracle for us all.

                            WHO IS NURSE CRILLY?          

                                 

That’s me, Patricia French Crilly, a brand new nurse back in 1973. I’m affectionately known to my colleagues and clients as Nurse Crilly. I have spent my nursing career as a neonatal and pediatric nurse, however, in 1988 I used hypnosis to quit smoking and began to integrate other CAM (Complementary and Alternative Medicine) modalities with nursing. This gave me a unique skillset to bring to my current practice as a Holistic Nurse Navigator for WellBeing where I assist my clients in identifying and achieving their personal goals for healing the mind, body and spirit by bridging the gap between allopathic medicine and holistic healing.

I am certified as an Advanced Clinical Hypnotherapist, a Stress Management Consultant, a Psych-K Practitioner and an EFT Practitioner and Trainer. I am the author of Tap It and Zap It! A Grownup’s Guide to EFT for Kids and have hosted my own radio show, B-Positive with Nurse Crilly. I design and conduct informative, motivational and inspirational workshops and seminars for the general public, corporations and health care professionals. Some upcoming topics are Self-Directed Wellness, Navigating the Shark Infested Waters of the Health Care System and Integrating CAM Modalities for Your Self-Care Regimen.

After fulfilling my mission to help others for more than forty years as a nurse, my journey to WellBeing showed me a new direction.  I am now driven to share my story from a diagnosis that paralyzed me with fear to changing my self-limiting belief that cancer is a death sentence and then becoming empowered to restore and maintain my WellBeing against tremendous odds. After a long career in traditional nursing, I had found myself declaring, “Been there, done that. What’s next? I am excited to pursue this new journey with a renewed vigor and a sense of urgency to help others Celebrate their own WellBeing.   

                                   THANK YOU!

any chemo or radiation because there was nothing left to treat. Yay for me!   
This is just a small snapshot of my story and an
over-simplification, of course. It is important to say that I did not do this
alone. I had a goodly amount of Divine Intervention, a gifted surgeon and my
awesome Healing Team of friends, family and colleagues who lovingly supported
me with an unwavering belief that I would be well.
THE
MISSION
So why am I telling you all this since everything worked out
well for me? Because of my experience, I am now on a mission to help others touched
by cancer to do what I did. That is, to help them overcome their fear, take
back their power, overhaul their belief system that
tells them cancer is a death sentence and then embracing a holistic approach to
healing that includes celebrating their wellbeing by caring for their mind, body and spirit. Sounds like a great
idea but how?THE BOOKI am,
currently, putting the finishing touches on my book, Extraordinary Healing, Ordinary Miracle: Choosing WellBeing over
Fearing Cancer . Part I chronicles my
journey from a highly probable death sentence (statistically speaking) to my
complete healing. It highlights all of the positive shifts in my own thoughts,
feelings and beliefs about cancer and of the many miracles I experienced along
the way.  In Part II, I deconstruct what
I did for my healing and why I did what I did. As to exactly how that would all happen...well, I left that up to the universe.                                                                                                                
                                    THE
GOAL
The first phase of the mission is to begin a movement that
shifts the focus from our current healthcare system which is really a disease
management system to a WellBeing Restoration and Maintenance system. This
paradigm shift Starts with each of us as individuals and then helping it go viral (pun intended) to the masses.This is
a huge and lofty goal.  I have been a
pediatric nurse for more than forty years so I understand “baby steps”. I am
seeking funding through Indiegogo to take the first baby step which is to get
my book out (optimistically  in July 2015) to you and anyone who has been touched by cancer . For
that to happen, I need to cover the costs of editing, formatting, cover design, website design, initial printing, perk fulfillment, promotion and Indiegogo fees. The approximate bare bones budget is $7,500.
I will also use my book as calling card to get more speaking
engagements to share my message with ever larger audiences.  By
the way, if you have group that could use good speaker (some might even say a really, really good speaker) with an inspirational and compelling message, please let
me know. THE STRETCH GOALIf we
go beyond the original goal, all additional funds will be used for our stretch
goal to complete the development of our WellBeing
Restoration and Maintenance Program for those facing not just cancer but
any catastrophic illness or injury by empowering them to make their own health
choices and helping them navigate the health care system by bridging the gap
between traditional medicine and holistic healing.
                        THIS
IS WHERE YOU COME IN
So that’s the mission. I need help. I need your help. I am not asking that you walk or run for
anything or to wear a disease-of-the-month ribbon of any color. I'm asking you
to claim one of the awesome perks I am offering to you for your caring and generosity.
Even if you can only give a small amount or none at all, I ask that you spread the word any way you can by sharing it with everyone you know. You can shout it from the rooftops, post it on Facebook, Tweet it, Blog it or send it out in an email, snail mail, Morse code or smoke
signals. The more people who know about it, the more people we can help. Who
among us has not been touched by cancer
in some way? Together we can make a
difference. Together we can make a
miracle.  I am asking you to help make extraordinary healing an ordinary miracle for us all.
                            WHO IS NURSE CRILLY?          
                                 That’s me, Patricia French
Crilly, a brand new nurse back in 1973. I’m affectionately known to my colleagues
and clients as Nurse Crilly. I have spent my nursing career as a neonatal and
pediatric nurse, however, in 1988 I used hypnosis to quit smoking and began to integrate
other CAM (Complementary and Alternative Medicine) modalities with nursing. This gave me a unique skillset to bring to my current practice as a Holistic Nurse Navigator
for WellBeing where I assist my clients in identifying and achieving their
personal goals for healing the mind, body and spirit by bridging the gap
between allopathic medicine and holistic healing.I am certified as an Advanced
Clinical Hypnotherapist, a Stress Management Consultant, a Psych-K Practitioner and an EFT Practitioner
and Trainer. I am the author of Tap It and Zap It! A Grownup’s Guide to EFT
for Kids and have hosted my own radio show, B-Positive with Nurse Crilly. I
design and conduct informative, motivational and inspirational workshops and
seminars for the general public, corporations and health care professionals.
Some upcoming topics are Self-Directed
Wellness, Navigating the Shark
Infested Waters of the Health Care System and Integrating CAM Modalities for Your Self-Care Regimen.

After fulfilling my mission to help others for more than forty years
as a nurse, my journey to WellBeing showed me a new direction.  I am now driven to share my story from a
diagnosis that paralyzed me with fear to changing my self-limiting belief that
cancer is a death sentence and then becoming empowered to restore and maintain
my WellBeing against tremendous odds. After a long career in traditional
nursing, I had found myself declaring, “Been there, done that. What’s next? I am
excited to pursue this new journey with a renewed vigor and a sense of urgency to help others Celebrate their own WellBeing.   
                                   THANK YOU!

story:
Help me write my book on Latin American street art

For the past 5 years I've been leading tours in San Telmo, Buenos Aires' oldest and most bohemian barrio, covering not only the street art and graffiti that's everywhere but also contemporary art, fileteado, mural art, Argentine history and local culture.

Many folks are surprised to find out that while building a business and giving tours, I was also on chemo and fighting cancer. I'm now in remission and ready for a new project and new run at life. (Although something tells me this is my last chance to make a difference.)

I've received a Certificate of Excellence from TripAdvisor 3 years in a row. Guests have called my tour "extraordinary" and "eye-opening." Perhaps the most appreciated comment I've received, however, is this one: "Rick's obvious affection and passion for these places [La Boca and San Telmo] give the tours an added dimension I've rarely felt." 

The Travel Chica rated my tour one of the top 6 experiences in Buenos Aires.

I've been written up and interviewed by About.com, Matador, Time Out, The Real Argentina and the Buenos Aires Herald, among others.

I've also been writing about street art and contemporary art in Buenos Aires since I moved here more than 6 years ago. I was editor, director and co-founder of a bilingual arts blog and non-profit org called Juanele AR. We sponsored street art murals, gave grants to local artists and produced some great videos. 

Some of my recent writing is here. I've also tried to keep a record of the city's changing walls here on my flickr account, back when I had a camera, that is, or access to one.

I'd like to take the knowledge I've gained here in Buenos Aires and my passion for both street art, writing and photography and turn it into a big, beautiful self-published book, not only about street art and artists but the importance of public art to life in Latin America. It will be full of stories and people, not just art.

I'll start with a few cities outside of Buenos Aires, then Chile (Valpo!), Perú, Uruguay, Bolivia, Brazil, Columbia, Panama, Costa Rica, Guatemala and finally Mexico with my last stop being Mexico City before I go back to the States.

It's going to be a big project, though, at least a year. So, I need some help.

What I Need

  • A camera. Back in my cancer-fighting days, I sold everything I owned in order to survive. I've managed to buy a new laptop and saved some money for travel but I need a high-quality pocketable camera and a travel tripod to get the photos I want for the book.
  • Medical supplies. I still have ongoing medical issues due to three surgeries and 3 years of chemotherapy. Although inflation has made some stuff I need more than quadruple in price, it's still cheaper here than in Uruguay or Chile, my first stops. So I need to stock up.
  • Traveling expenses. Before I start on my adventure, I'm going to finally get my TEFL certificate so I can make some cash teaching English along the way, and I'll have some money of my own to start out, but I'd really rather not be worrying about eating and paying for visas while I'm writing this book.
  • A backpack, because I don't have one big enough yet, although everything I now own can easily fit on my back.
  • Clothing and gear. I made it through the cancer ordeal with basically the clothes on my back. (Long story.) I'd like to have shoes I can walk in and more than one pair of pants.

What You'll Get

  • Every contributor (and anyone who has ever taken my tour) will have access to exclusive content on my blog, The Street Art Scribe. Videos, blogs, notes on how the book is going, and the scoop on what sort of trouble I’m getting into. I don't look for trouble! It comes to me! 
  • Go deep and help me write this thing.
  • Contribute a little more money and get a digital copy of the book.
  • Contribute more and get big prints of my photographs.
  • Contribute even more and get both a digital and hardcover copy of the book. (Still thinking about a title.)
  • I'll also be keeping 3 physical scrapbooks with signed art contributed by the artists I meet as well as memorabilia from my trip. Contributors of $500 or more will receive a one-of-a-kind artistic document of my travels.

If I don't reach my goal...

I'll buy the cheapest, decent camera I can get. It just has to be good enough for pre-press.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also donate a little money every month Gumroad's subscription service.

Other than sharing this campaign, maybe you have some stuff you could donate to help me travel? Any travel-related items would be great. Care packages could be organized once I get outside of Argentina. NO ONE sends packages to Argentina anymore because of crazy import taxes, and I'll have to buy the camera outside of Argentina.

Amazon gift cards would help as well, as I need to read as many books about street art as I can. iTunes gift certificates would be great as well as there's some photography-related  software I need to buy.

I'm excited to share this adventure with everyone, particularly the folks who have taken my tours in the past!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
*** thank you gift ***


wireless smartphone & tablet charger

for every $45 contributed to our campaign, we'll send you one state-of-the-art wireless charger (worth $69 each) as a gift! once you've experienced the convenience of wireless charging – no more yanking out cables to answer your phone or fussing over different chargers! – you'll never want to charge any other way. it charges your devices at the same speed as your regular charger too, and works with all popular smartphones and tablets, such as apple, samsung (even the latest s6!), htc, nokia, lg, etc. so you've always got enough juice to use unbargo ;)




******





tips

as media insiders ourselves, we know reporters get their stories in two main ways – they get lucky with sources (not the way you think), or they get a press release.

most of the time, they get a press release.


trashed

but of the tons of press releases reporters get, less than 5% are published due to space constraints and rigid editorial approval.

the rest end up in the trash.

"but," you might protest, "who's to say some news in that discarded 95% of press releases wouldn't interest me?"

"precisely," we will answer. "strangers who don't know you – mostly editors – are deciding what news you get to know."*cue darth editor and his bright saber



this sucks.

lightbulb

so we had a lightbulb moment!

how about a revolutionary search engine that takes all the same press releases reporters get and feeds that news to the world for free?

that way, not only would you get to choose the news that's important to you, and get it fast, you'll know everything reporters do, and know it first too – before it's even reported.


freedom

unbargo is for you if you believe in freedom, and if you believe:

• you're the only person who should decide what news matter to you

• you've the right to all the news meant for you

• you don't need somebody else thinking for you

 help free the news.

(and we'll help you free your smartphones and tablets from wires with our thank-you gift!)



why the need for unbargo?

unbargo makes the world a better place as it provides a borderless service for any newsmaker anywhere to post their news for anyone to read. the one and only purpose of any press release is to reach the reader. but, newsmakers usually need to persuade reporters first. even if reporters are convinced, they still need to find an angle to win their editors over. and if their editors agree, those press releases need to be re-written and edited, before they're published much later, days or sometimes months after they were received. in our perhaps-idealistic viewpoint, news should be reported because of newsworthiness, not because of better contacts or finances. by providing a free service for newsmakers to get news out directly to readers, we're leveling the playing field for businesses of all sizes. plus, we made it much, much simpler with unbargo. just send your press release to news@unbargo.com and it will be auto-extracted, ready to reach readers, unedited and uncensored.


who is behind unbargo?

our international team comprises former-and-current news folks in both old and new media – from print newspapers and magazines to online news, tv and radio – including a former editor-in-chief of two major rival national newspapers (not at the same time of course). thus, we've the edge as we already have unfettered access to press releases worldwide.


how does unbargo get its press releases?

besides us already having access to tons of press releases daily, tens of thousands more will be sent to unbargo every day by newsmakers direct, and pr agencies on behalf of their clients. all these press releases will be auto-converted to web format and instantly uploaded so news gets out asap – which is what newsmakers need and what readers want. all press releases are presented under 20 separate categories, spanning hard and soft news, from business to beauty and tech to travel.


what's the difference between unbargo and existing wire agencies?

wire agencies are for the press, unbargo is for readers. wire agencies aim to persuade the press to feature news so as to reach readers, but while this may have been necessary in the past when going through the press was the only way, the internet changed all that. unbargo is focused on creating a reader-centric, reader-friendly service, one that delivers news straight from the source (newsmakers) direct to readers.


name 3 highlights of unbargo?

1. it's familiar
unbargo looks the same on mobile or desktop, and on different OS or browsers, because we insist on similarity. you'll always know the functions you're already used to seeing instead of re-exploring where each is on the different platforms and how each works all over again (try spotting the differences of facebook on mobilephone and tablet below). unbargo's font size even cleverly adjusts to accommodate the viewing distance and screen size of specific gadgets.


2. it's smart
unbargo is designed to learn from you. whenever you search, it gets better at giving you the most relevant news right at the top, so you get what you're looking for faster each time. and every time you click "x" on search results that aren't what you want, not only will those results be removed from (just) your view, making it easier for you to focus, unbargo will also learn how to better spot what you want in future.

                                        


3. it remembers
unbargo provides a history page (see below), for you to re-access everything instead of wracking your brain remembering what you read before. you can remove anything from this page easily by clicking the delete button. history also contains keywords you used during specific searches so you can fine-tune your results. readers who wish to can keep searches anonymous simply by not logging in.

                                      



what does unbargo need funding for?

so far we've paid for unbargo's development out of personal conviction, but to make it the world-changing revolution it can be, we need help funding the crucial extras. we'll have to store millions of press releases around the world annually, as well as the mountains of hi-res photos that come with them – and storage is costly even with cloud hosting (good thing there's youtube so we don't need to store videos too!). also, we're working hard to make our search engine capable of giving you relevant results instantly, so it's literally available to you the second it's sent to reporters. at the same time, we're negotiating with third parties to bring past press releases to you, to create the most complete database in the world. in the works as well is analytics for newsmakers with key metrics. and, as press releases will be posted in their original language, we're looking to include a 'translate this' function too. in other words, any amount raised will go towards expenses for tech development, cloud hosting, database acquisitions...(our listed goal is a low $1,000 because we aim to hit the target quickly and build on that first success towards our final goal of $1,000,000. success begets success!)


is unbargo against traditional news outlets?

unbargo isn't here to compete with traditional news outlets. but, since it's impossible for them to report all the news, we feel readers should still have access to everything else that isn't reported too, but on-demand. this is why unbargo is designed as a search engine instead of a news website – you search for what you want, and you get only what you want. because, when you like something, whether it's food or fashion, don't you want to be the first to know everything about it fast and first? now, at the exact moment anything is released to a reporter, often months before it's even reported, you’ll know it too:

  • latest mobilephone – 2 months ahead
  • newest japanese cafe - 3 months ahead
  • hottest high-street wear - 5 months ahead
  • upcoming family movie - 6 months ahead
  • launch of luxury bag - 10 months ahead
  • brand-new supercar - 12 months ahead


could unbargo benefit reporters?

all reporters have stories they care about get cut all the time. very often, even important stories are cut  – just because editors deem them unsuitable for reasons they rarely share. unbargo lets reporters tell their untold stories. they just need to get verified on unbargo to be given publishing rights, a special icon and the choice to withhold their identity. once a reader sees that special icon, they'll know they're reading a piece by someone whom we've authenticated as a reporter from a respected online or offline publication, and who cares enough to get their news out.


are press releases useful?

at first glance, compared to your everyday news report, a press release may seem just too detailed (pls scroll all the way to the bottom to see an actual apple watch press release). but, when you want to know more about that topic – suddenly "too much info" becomes goldilocks' "just right". unbargo's most useful topic is perhaps advisory news - it could literally save your life. right now, advisory news is only available on hundreds of different websites, such as health alerts from the cdc, the wanted list of the fbi or an important product recall. with unbargo, you can get all advisories emailed to you (see below) so you can keep your family and friends safe.

           


unbargo advisories can keep my family and friends safe?

hundreds of consumer products were recalled last year in the united states alone to prevent deaths or injuries - but how many of these did you hear about? various independent watch sites frequently publish product recalls when problems are detected, but the press rarely reports these unless they are part of a "bigger story" – like after a fatality has occurred. this means we're usually in the dark about dangers we've brought into our own homes! when brands are responsible enough to issue an alert, for e.g. "IKEA Recalls Crib Mattresses Due to Risk of Entrapment" (see below), unbargo plays its part by delivering such advisories to your inbox immediately!

when will unbargo be launched?

beta will be ready by may 2015, with the full launch three months later.



contact founder – joseph@unbargo.com



testimonials

here are some unsolicited testimonials we've received. we confirm certain unrelated sentences have been omitted or amended from the original quotes, but context has not been altered or enhanced, except that text has been reproduced in lowercase following corporate guidelines. we can also confirm no animal, plant, human nor alien was harmed in the production of these testimonials.


newspaper feature

the press is sometimes painted as the dark side, or as controlled by rich owners with their own personal or political agenda to create their 'news of the world'. you've no idea how many messages we've received from contributors denouncing the press for picking what to report.

but to be fair, there are limited column inches available in any printed publication, and even on an unlimited platform like the internet, there are only so many hours in a day to report the news. when faced with such space and time constraints, picking becomes a necessity.

however, picking shouldn't be based on preference or prejudice. not preference because that's a story close to your heart, nor prejudice because your mind is already closed to that story. if a story needs to be told, it should stand purely on its merits and be reported. and that's one of the rare utopian beliefs that can and should have a place in our society today.

unfortunately, many news empires are helmed by traditional executives and gatekeepered by conservative editors. thus, when it comes to picking news, it tends to be based on preference or prejudice still.

so after a reporter from mypaper interviewed us, then told us later that our story might be pushed to another date, which is the usual lingo for "no go!", we assumed the powers-that-are had objected, as standard press may see unbargo as a threat or competitor.

so imagine our surprise when this article eventually came out. thank you mypaper (lydia lam, you rock!).

                                          



sample of an actual press release

Apple Unveils Apple Watch—Apple’s Most Personal Device Ever 

CUPERTINO, California—Apple® today unveiled Apple Watch™—its most personal device ever—featuring revolutionary new technologies and a pioneering user interface with a beautiful design that honors the rich tradition of precision watchmaking. Apple Watch introduces a specially designed and engineered Digital Crown that provides an innovative way to scroll, zoom and navigate. The Digital Crown is Apple’s most revolutionary navigation tool since the iPod® Click Wheel and iPhone® Multi-Touch™. Apple Watch will enable you to communicate in new ways right from your wrist by sending and receiving messages, answering calls to your iPhone, and with Digital Touch, sending something as personal as your own heartbeat. Apple Watch also introduces comprehensive health and fitness apps that can help people lead healthier lives. Apple Watch is available in three distinct collections—Apple Watch, Apple Watch Sport and Apple Watch Edition.

“Apple introduced the world to several category-defining products, the Mac, iPod, iPhone and iPad,” said Tim Cook, Apple’s CEO. “And once again Apple is poised to captivate the world with a revolutionary product that can enrich people’s lives. It’s the most personal product we’ve ever made.”

“With Apple Watch, we’ve developed multiple technologies and an entirely new user interface specifically for a device that’s designed to be worn. It blurs the boundary between physical object and user interface,” said Jony Ive, Apple’s senior vice president of Design. “We’ve created an entire range of products that enable unparalleled personalization.”

Apple Watch introduces a revolutionary design and iOS-based user interface created specifically for a smaller device. Apple Watch features the Digital Crown, an innovative way to scroll, zoom and navigate fluidly, without obstructing the display. The Digital Crown also serves as the Home button and a convenient way to access Siri®. The Retina® display on Apple Watch features Force Touch, a technology that senses the difference between a tap and a press, providing a new way to quickly and easily access controls within apps. Apple Watch introduces the Taptic Engine and a built-in speaker that together discreetly enable an entirely new vocabulary of alerts and notifications you can both hear and feel. Apple custom-designed its own S1 SiP (System in Package) to miniaturize an entire computer architecture onto a single chip. Apple Watch also features Wi-Fi 802.11b/g and Bluetooth 4.0 to pair seamlessly with your iPhone.

Apple Watch comes in three distinct collections—Apple Watch, Apple Watch Sport and Apple Watch Edition—available in two different sizes, 38 mm and 42 mm. The beautifully designed and durable enclosures are crafted from custom alloys of polished or space black stainless steel, space gray or silver anodized aluminum and 18-karat rose or yellow gold. Apple also created an entire range of watch straps: the high-performance elastomer Sport Band; the Milanese Loop in a flexible magnetic stainless steel mesh; the Leather Loop in soft, quilted leather that conceals magnets for quick fastening and adjustment; the leather Modern Buckle, which closes with a solid metal clasp; the leather Classic Buckle; and the stainless steel Link Bracelet. Apple Watch comes with a unique charging system that combines Apple’s MagSafe® technology with inductive charging for a quick connection that snaps into place.

Apple Watch is an extremely accurate timepiece that’s also customizable for personal expression. Apple Watch comes with 11 watch faces ranging from traditional analog faces to new faces like the dynamic Timelapse face; the Astronomy face with its interactive, real-time 3D model of the earth, sun, moon and planets; and the Solar face, a contemporary sundial. Apple Watch can be personalized in appearance and capability with additional information such as upcoming events, moonphases or your activity level, enabling millions of possible configurations.

Taking advantage of its location on your wrist, Apple Watch provides timely information that can be viewed at a glance. Smart Replies and dictation let you respond quickly to messages, and with Handoff, you can start a message on your Apple Watch and continue where you left off on your iPhone. Swipe up from the watch face for Glances that quickly show you information you care about, such as your current location, stocks or your next meeting. Pressing the side button brings up Friends, a view of your favorite people, so you can contact them quickly and easily. Digital Touch allows you to send a sketch, a gentle tap, an audio message through Walkie Talkie or even your own heartbeat. Apple Watch lets you interact quickly and conveniently with the world around you, so you can pay for coffee using Apple Pay™,* board a plane with a Passbook® boarding pass, control your Apple TV® or get directions.

Apple Watch includes a groundbreaking Activity app designed to help motivate you to be more active throughout the day, and an all-new Workout app designed to provide the metrics you need during dedicated workout sessions. Apple Watch uses the accelerometer, a built-in heart rate sensor, GPS and Wi-Fi from your iPhone to provide a comprehensive picture of your daily activity. The Activity app measures three separate aspects of movement: calories burned, brisk activity and how often you stand up during the day. The Workout app provides goal-setting and pacing during popular session-based workouts, such as running and cycling. The companion Fitness app on iPhone collects your activity data so you can see your activity history in greater detail. Apple Watch uses this history to suggest personal, realistic goals, reward fitness milestones and keep you motivated.

Apple introduces WatchKit, providing new tools and APIs for developers to create unique experiences designed for the wrist. With Apple Watch, developers can create WatchKit apps with actionable notifications and Glances that provide timely information. Starting later next year, developers will be able to create fully native apps for Apple Watch.

Pricing & Availability Apple Watch will be available in three collections. Apple Watch, with a polished or space black stainless steel case and a choice of straps; Apple Watch Sport, with a space gray or silver anodized aluminum case and Sport Band; and Apple Watch Edition, with an 18-karat rose or yellow gold case and a choice of straps exclusive to this collection. Apple Watch straps include the Sport Band in black, blue, green, pink and white; the Classic Buckle in black and midnight blue; the Leather Loop in bright blue, light brown and stone; the Modern Buckle in midnight blue, brown, soft pink, rose gray and bright red; the Milanese Loop in stainless steel; and the Link Bracelet in brushed stainless steel and polished space black. Apple Watch will be available in early 2015 starting at $349 (US). Apple Watch is compatible with iPhone 5, iPhone 5c, iPhone 5s, iPhone 6 or iPhone 6 Plus running the latest version of iOS 8.

* Apple Pay is only available in the US.

Apple designs Macs, the best personal computers in the world, along with OS X, iLife, iWork and professional software. Apple leads the digital music revolution with its iPods and iTunes online store. Apple has reinvented the mobile phone with its revolutionary iPhone and App Store, and is defining the future of mobile media and computing devices with iPad.

(408) xxx-xxxx
