how that actual press release looks on unbargo

                                            



*** remember to get your thank-you gift today! ***
story_txt:
*** thank you gift ***
 
wireless smartphone & tablet charger

for every $45 contributed to our 
campaign, we'll send you one state-of-the-art 
wireless charger (worth $69 each) as a gift! once you've 
experienced the convenience of wireless charging – no more yanking out cables to 
answer your phone or fussing over different chargers! – you'll never want to charge any other way. it charges your devices at the same speed as your regular 
charger too, and works with all popular smartphones and tablets, such as 
apple, samsung (even the latest s6!), htc, nokia, lg, etc. so you've 
always got enough juice to use unbargo ;)


****** 




tips



as media insiders ourselves, we know reporters get their stories in two main ways – they get lucky with sources (not the way you think), or they get a press release.
most of the time, they get a press release.




trashed




but of the tons of press releases reporters get, less than 5% are published due to space constraints and rigid editorial approval.
the rest end up in the trash.


 



"but," you might protest, "who's to say some news in that discarded 95% of press releases wouldn't interest me?"


 


"precisely," we will answer. "strangers who don't know you – mostly editors – are deciding what news you get to know."*cue darth editor and his bright saber







this sucks.


 
lightbulb











so we had a lightbulb moment!



how about a revolutionary search engine that takes all the same press releases reporters get and feeds that news to the world for free?



that way, not only would you get to choose the news that's important to you, and get it fast, you'll know everything reporters do, and know it first too – before it's even reported.


 

freedom



unbargo is for you if you believe in freedom, and if you believe:
• you're the only person who should decide what news matter to you




• you've the right to all the news meant for you





• you don't need somebody else thinking for you




 
 help free the news.
(and we'll help you free your smartphones and tablets from wires with our thank-you gift!)








why the need for unbargo?

unbargo makes the world a better place as it provides a 
borderless service
for any newsmaker anywhere to post their news for anyone to read. the
one and only purpose of any press release is to reach the reader. but, newsmakers 
usually need to persuade reporters first. even if reporters are convinced, they 
still need to find an angle to win their editors over.
and if their editors agree, those press releases need to be re-written 
and edited, before they're published much later, days or sometimes months after they were
 received. in our perhaps-idealistic
viewpoint, news should be reported because of newsworthiness, not because of
better contacts or finances. by providing a free service for 
newsmakers to get news out directly to 
readers, we're leveling the playing field for businesses of all sizes. 
plus, we made it much, much simpler with unbargo. just send your press 
release to news@unbargo.com 
and it will be auto-extracted, ready to reach readers, unedited and 
uncensored.



who is behind unbargo?
our international team comprises former-and-current news folks in both old
 and new media – from print newspapers and magazines to online news, tv and radio – including a former editor-in-chief of two major rival 
national newspapers (not at the same time of course). thus, we've the 
edge as we already have unfettered access to press releases worldwide.



how does unbargo get its press releases?
besides
 us already having access to tons of press releases daily, tens of thousands 
more will be sent to unbargo every day by newsmakers direct, and 
pr agencies on behalf of their clients. all these press releases will be auto-converted to web format and instantly uploaded so news 
gets out asap – which is what newsmakers need and what readers want. all press releases are
presented under 20 separate categories, spanning hard and soft news, from business to beauty and tech to travel.






what's the difference between unbargo and existing wire agencies?wire agencies
are for the press, unbargo is for readers. wire agencies aim to persuade the press to feature news so as to reach readers, but while this may have been
necessary in the past when going through the press was the only way, the
internet changed all that. unbargo is focused on creating a reader-centric,
reader-friendly service, one that delivers news straight from the source
(newsmakers) direct to readers. 



name 3 highlights of unbargo?
1. it's familiarunbargo looks the same on mobile or desktop, and on different OS or browsers, because we insist
on similarity. you'll always know
the functions you're already used to seeing instead of re-exploring where each is on the different platforms and how each works all over
again (try spotting the differences of facebook on mobilephone and tablet
below). unbargo's font size even cleverly adjusts to accommodate the viewing
distance and screen size of specific gadgets.




2. it's smartunbargo is
designed to learn from you. whenever you search, it gets better at giving you
the most relevant news right at the top, so you get what you're looking for
faster each time. and every time you click "x" on search results that
aren't what you want, not only will those results be removed from (just) your
view, making it easier for you to focus, unbargo will also learn how to better
spot what you want in future.


                                         


3. it remembersunbargo
provides a history page
(see below), for you to re-access everything instead of
wracking your brain remembering what you read before. you can remove anything
from this page easily by clicking the delete button. history also contains
keywords you used during specific searches so you can fine-tune your results. readers who wish to can keep searches anonymous simply by not logging in.




                                       

what does unbargo need funding for?so far we've paid for unbargo's development out of personal conviction, but to make it the world-changing revolution it can be, we need help funding the crucial extras. we'll have to store millions of press releases around the world annually, as well as
the mountains of hi-res photos that come with them – and storage is costly even
with cloud hosting (good thing there's youtube so we don't need to store videos too!). also, we're working hard to make our search engine capable of giving
you relevant results instantly, so it's literally available to you the second it's sent to
reporters. at the same time, we're negotiating with third parties to bring past press releases to
you, to create the most complete database in the world. in the works as well is analytics for newsmakers with key metrics. and, as press releases will be
posted in their original language, we're looking to include a 'translate this'
function too. in other words, any amount raised will go towards expenses for
tech development, cloud hosting, database acquisitions...(our listed goal is a low $1,000 because we aim to hit the target
quickly and build on that first success towards our final goal of $1,000,000. success begets success!)







is unbargo against traditional news outlets?


unbargo
 isn't here to compete with traditional news outlets. but, since it's impossible for them to report
 all the news, we feel readers should still have 
access to everything else that isn't reported too, but on-demand. this is why unbargo is designed as a search 
engine instead of a news website – you search for what you want, and you get
 only what you want. because, when you like something, whether it's food or fashion, don't you want
 to be the first to know everything about it fast and first? now, at the exact 
moment anything is released to a reporter, often months before it's even
 reported, you’ll know it too:

latest mobilephone – 2 months ahead
newest japanese cafe - 3 months ahead
hottest high-street wear - 5 months ahead
upcoming family movie - 6 months ahead
launch of luxury bag - 10 months ahead
brand-new supercar - 12 months ahead






could unbargo benefit reporters?
all reporters have stories they 
care about get cut all the time. very often, even important stories are 
cut  – just because editors 
deem them unsuitable for reasons they rarely share. unbargo lets reporters tell their untold stories. 
they 
just need to get verified on unbargo to be given publishing rights, a 
special icon and the choice to withhold their identity. once a reader 
sees that special icon, they'll know they're reading a piece by someone 
whom we've authenticated as a reporter from a respected online or 
offline publication, and who cares enough to get their news out.





are press releases useful?
at first glance, compared to your everyday news report, a press
release may seem just too detailed (pls scroll all the way to the bottom to see an actual apple watch press release). but, when you want to know more about that topic – suddenly "too much info"
becomes goldilocks' "just right". unbargo's
most useful topic is perhaps advisory news - it could literally save your life. right
now, advisory news is only available on hundreds of different websites, such as health
alerts from the cdc, the wanted list of the fbi or an important product recall.
with unbargo, you can get all advisories emailed to you (see below) so you can keep your family and
friends safe. 

            


unbargo advisories can keep my family and friends safe?
hundreds of consumer
products were recalled last year in the united states alone to prevent
deaths or injuries - but how many of these did you hear about? various independent watch sites frequently publish product recalls when problems are detected, but the press rarely
reports these unless they are part of a "bigger story" – like after a
fatality has occurred. this means we're usually in the dark about
dangers we've brought into our own homes! when brands are responsible enough to issue an alert, for e.g. "IKEA Recalls Crib Mattresses Due to Risk of Entrapment" (see below), unbargo plays its
part by delivering such advisories to your inbox immediately!








when will unbargo be launched?
beta
 will be ready by may 2015, with the full launch three months later. 


contact founder – joseph@unbargo.com




testimonials
here are some unsolicited testimonials we've received. we confirm certain unrelated 
sentences have been omitted or amended from the original quotes, but 
context has not been altered or enhanced, except that text has been 
reproduced in lowercase following corporate guidelines. we can also 
confirm no animal, plant, human nor alien was harmed in the production 
of these testimonials.
















newspaper feature

the press is sometimes painted as the dark side,
 or as controlled by rich owners with their own personal or political 
agenda to create their 'news of the world'. you've no idea how many 
messages we've received from contributors denouncing the press for picking what to report.
but to be fair, there are limited 
column inches available in any printed publication, and even on an 
unlimited platform like the internet, there are only so many hours in a day to report the news. when faced with such space and time constraints, picking becomes a 
necessity.
however, picking shouldn't be based on 
preference or prejudice. not preference because that's a story close
 to your heart, nor prejudice because your mind is already closed to that story.
 if a story needs to be told, it should stand purely on its merits and 
be reported. and that's one of the rare utopian beliefs that can and should have a 
place in our society today.
unfortunately, many news empires are helmed by traditional executives and gatekeepered by conservative 
editors. thus, when it comes to picking news, it tends to be based on 
preference or prejudice still.
so after a reporter from mypaper
 interviewed us, then told us later that our story might 
be pushed to another date, which is the usual lingo for "no go!", we 
assumed the powers-that-are had objected, as 
standard press may see unbargo as a threat or competitor.
so imagine our surprise when this article eventually came out. thank you mypaper (lydia lam, you rock!).

                                           

sample of an actual press release



Apple Unveils Apple Watch—Apple’s Most Personal Device Ever 
CUPERTINO,
 California—Apple® today unveiled Apple Watch™—its most personal device 
ever—featuring revolutionary new technologies and a pioneering user 
interface with a beautiful design that honors the rich tradition of 
precision watchmaking. Apple Watch introduces a specially designed and 
engineered Digital Crown that provides an innovative way to scroll, zoom
 and navigate. The Digital Crown is Apple’s most revolutionary 
navigation tool since the iPod® Click Wheel and iPhone® Multi-Touch™. 
Apple Watch will enable you to communicate in new ways right from your 
wrist by sending and receiving messages, answering calls to your iPhone,
 and with Digital Touch, sending something as personal as your own 
heartbeat. Apple Watch also introduces comprehensive health and fitness 
apps that can help people lead healthier lives. Apple Watch is available
 in three distinct collections—Apple Watch, Apple Watch Sport and Apple 
Watch Edition.
“Apple introduced the world to several 
category-defining products, the Mac, iPod, iPhone and iPad,” said Tim 
Cook, Apple’s CEO. “And once again Apple is poised to captivate the 
world with a revolutionary product that can enrich people’s lives. It’s 
the most personal product we’ve ever made.”
“With Apple Watch, 
we’ve developed multiple technologies and an entirely new user interface
 specifically for a device that’s designed to be worn. It blurs the 
boundary between physical object and user interface,” said Jony Ive, 
Apple’s senior vice president of Design. “We’ve created an entire range 
of products that enable unparalleled personalization.”
Apple Watch
 introduces a revolutionary design and iOS-based user interface created 
specifically for a smaller device. Apple Watch features the Digital 
Crown, an innovative way to scroll, zoom and navigate fluidly, without 
obstructing the display. The Digital Crown also serves as the Home 
button and a convenient way to access Siri®. The Retina® display on 
Apple Watch features Force Touch, a technology that senses the 
difference between a tap and a press, providing a new way to quickly and
 easily access controls within apps. Apple Watch introduces the Taptic 
Engine and a built-in speaker that together discreetly enable an 
entirely new vocabulary of alerts and notifications you can both hear 
and feel. Apple custom-designed its own S1 SiP (System in Package) to 
miniaturize an entire computer architecture onto a single chip. Apple 
Watch also features Wi-Fi 802.11b/g and Bluetooth 4.0 to pair seamlessly
 with your iPhone.
Apple Watch comes in three distinct 
collections—Apple Watch, Apple Watch Sport and Apple Watch 
Edition—available in two different sizes, 38 mm and 42 mm. The 
beautifully designed and durable enclosures are crafted from custom 
alloys of polished or space black stainless steel, space gray or silver 
anodized aluminum and 18-karat rose or yellow gold. Apple also created 
an entire range of watch straps: the high-performance elastomer Sport 
Band; the Milanese Loop in a flexible magnetic stainless steel mesh; the
 Leather Loop in soft, quilted leather that conceals magnets for quick 
fastening and adjustment; the leather Modern Buckle, which closes with a
 solid metal clasp; the leather Classic Buckle; and the stainless steel 
Link Bracelet. Apple Watch comes with a unique charging system that 
combines Apple’s MagSafe® technology with inductive charging for a quick
 connection that snaps into place.
Apple Watch is an extremely 
accurate timepiece that’s also customizable for personal expression. 
Apple Watch comes with 11 watch faces ranging from traditional analog 
faces to new faces like the dynamic Timelapse face; the Astronomy face 
with its interactive, real-time 3D model of the earth, sun, moon and 
planets; and the Solar face, a contemporary sundial. Apple Watch can be 
personalized in appearance and capability with additional information 
such as upcoming events, moonphases or your activity level, enabling 
millions of possible configurations.
Taking advantage of its 
location on your wrist, Apple Watch provides timely information that can
 be viewed at a glance. Smart Replies and dictation let you respond 
quickly to messages, and with Handoff, you can start a message on your 
Apple Watch and continue where you left off on your iPhone. Swipe up 
from the watch face for Glances that quickly show you information you 
care about, such as your current location, stocks or your next meeting. 
Pressing the side button brings up Friends, a view of your favorite 
people, so you can contact them quickly and easily. Digital Touch allows
 you to send a sketch, a gentle tap, an audio message through Walkie 
Talkie or even your own heartbeat. Apple Watch lets you interact quickly
 and conveniently with the world around you, so you can pay for coffee 
using Apple Pay™,* board a plane with a Passbook® boarding pass, control
 your Apple TV® or get directions. 
Apple Watch includes a 
groundbreaking Activity app designed to help motivate you to be more 
active throughout the day, and an all-new Workout app designed to 
provide the metrics you need during dedicated workout sessions. Apple 
Watch uses the accelerometer, a built-in heart rate sensor, GPS and 
Wi-Fi from your iPhone to provide a comprehensive picture of your daily 
activity. The Activity app measures three separate aspects of movement: 
calories burned, brisk activity and how often you stand up during the 
day. The Workout app provides goal-setting and pacing during popular 
session-based workouts, such as running and cycling. The companion 
Fitness app on iPhone collects your activity data so you can see your 
activity history in greater detail. Apple Watch uses this history to 
suggest personal, realistic goals, reward fitness milestones and keep 
you motivated.
Apple introduces WatchKit, providing new tools and 
APIs for developers to create unique experiences designed for the wrist.
 With Apple Watch, developers can create WatchKit apps with actionable 
notifications and Glances that provide timely information. Starting 
later next year, developers will be able to create fully native apps for
 Apple Watch.
Pricing & Availability
Apple Watch will be available in three collections. Apple Watch, with a 
polished or space black stainless steel case and a choice of straps; 
Apple Watch Sport, with a space gray or silver anodized aluminum case 
and Sport Band; and Apple Watch Edition, with an 18-karat rose or yellow
 gold case and a choice of straps exclusive to this collection. Apple 
Watch straps include the Sport Band in black, blue, green, pink and 
white; the Classic Buckle in black and midnight blue; the Leather Loop 
in bright blue, light brown and stone; the Modern Buckle in midnight 
blue, brown, soft pink, rose gray and bright red; the Milanese Loop in 
stainless steel; and the Link Bracelet in brushed stainless steel and 
polished space black. Apple Watch will be available in early 2015 
starting at $349 (US). Apple Watch is compatible with iPhone 5, iPhone 
5c, iPhone 5s, iPhone 6 or iPhone 6 Plus running the latest version of 
iOS 8. 
* Apple Pay is only available in the US.
Apple 
designs Macs, the best personal computers in the world, along with OS X,
 iLife, iWork and professional software. Apple leads the digital music 
revolution with its iPods and iTunes online store. Apple has reinvented 
the mobile phone with its revolutionary iPhone and App Store, and is 
defining the future of mobile media and computing devices with iPad.
Press Contacts: Nat Kerris
Apple

Sarah O'Brien
Apple

may be trademarks of their respective owners.

story:
Who are we?

We are an adventurous family of eight, starting a traveling journey around the nation, to explore, meet our country face-to-face, and to bring back some useful strategies for rural resilience to our upstate New York communities. We have been living and working in the rural Albany County hilltowns for the last five years, deeply embedded in our community, running a general store (see medusageneralstore.blogspot.com), and raising a young family. The state of the economy, steady warming of our planet, the sense of isolation faced by many in our region, and the seeming lack of any help on the horizon has led us to this latest quest.

What are we up to?

While there are lots of examples of urban sustainability projects, from innovative urban agriculture to high speed transport to green energy, there are remarkably few maps provided to those of us in rural areas. The possibility that the new economy will be primarily one of dense urban areas causes many of us to wonder: are we relevant? Will many rural regions, with their small villages and towns, cease to exist altogether? Most importantly, are there examples of rural resilience we can borrow? Are there farming regions on the fringe of metropolitan areas that have embraced the principles of the new economy in a way that has generated social equity, prosperity and a plan for climate resilience?


I am a PhD, with a history of work in sustainable community development, and a deep commitment to our rural regions. I have a background in research, concentrated on judgment and decision making, as well as system dynamics modelling. This project will focus on interviews and mutual sharing of experiences, both successes and failures, and plans for the future. We will provide a clear record of our interviews and talks, mapping our way via the web across the country. Where possible, we will provide video footage and photography, as well as any relevant and available data and analysis. When complete, we will finally have a compilation of the types of rural resilience and long term sustainability projects that offer hope and promise.

How can you help?


We are seeking monetary support - we are attempting to fund this project through our own savings and through crowdsourced dollars. We have some money saved, but need some more to cover gas and food for a few months on the road. We have a charming 1976 L'Espirit RV, a tent and crazy amounts of enthusiasm. 

We are anticipating an April 1 departure, depending on weather and finances. The trip is flexible - so we are going for as long and far as money allows. the more cash we can raise, the longer we will be on the road. The first $500 will complete some needed repairs and renovations on our RV - we will be posing  video as soon as that is complete!  

We have also been compiling lists of those communities who fall into one of two categories - they are either very similar to our rural communities, in terms of demographics, geography or history, or they offer specific solutions that have proven beneficial to their rural communities. We are asking for your help with either of those lists, specifically the latter - nominate a place for us to visit!

We will be uploading tentative maps as soon as possible. For now, we are roughly planning a route south, then west. 

We are very excited about this journey - a pilgrimage to America, so to speak - and welcome your input.  And we look forward to having you along for the ride!

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you. Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.  Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.  Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited! Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.    The Impact Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:  Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world. Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one). Make it real for people and build trust.    Risks & Challenges  People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.  Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles. Describe your plan for solving these challenges.    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Spoken Word Version of The Radiance Sutras

For years, people around the world have been asking me to record The Radiance Sutras in my own voice - to make an audio book. Now I am ready. The Sounds True version of the book is out, 

the album Elixir is out.

the Radiance Sutras

This campaign is to raise money for studio time, engineering time, postproduction, album design, artwork, and advertising, to create an audio book of The Radiance Sutras, which will be available as a direct digital download and a physical CD, with additional printed materials. 

First, a story . . . 

The Radiance Sutras is the name for my version of a classic yoga meditation text, the Vijnana Bhairava Tantra, from Kashmir around 800 AD. I first encountered this text about 47 years ago. 

This is how it happened. 

One day in 1968, when I was a freshman at the University of California, I signed up to participate in a brain-wave biofeedback study. Learning to control your brain waves by looking at flashing lights sounded interesting. Also they paid more than I was making mowing the greens at a nearby golf course. Due to the flip of a coin, I was selected to be a control subject in the study, meaning that I received no instructions whatever; I was just hooked up with electroencephalogram (EEG) wires stuck all over my head and left in total darkness and total silence, in a soundproofed room in the physiology lab, for two to three hours at a time, every day for several weeks.

At the time, I had never heard of meditation. Not knowing what else to do, I simply paid attention to what was going on. Gradually my senses opened up in ways that I had no words to describe. My sense of self melted into the dark. I merged with blackness and infinity and entered a world of spacious peace. Space itself seemed to be made out of harmony. 

Walking out of the lab each afternoon, I felt refreshed and wonderful. It was as if my entire previous life had taken place in a mild sleep state, and now I was fully alert. It was as if I had never seen the world before, and everything alive seemed to glow, especially the trees. I began to appreciate every detail of light, every touch of air, every sound, with extraordinary clarity. Light itself seemed soluble, an elixir I was drinking in through my eyes and the pores of my skin. I was drenched in moving peacefulness. The perceptions seemed natural—as if this is the way the world has always been—but I had been too oblivious to notice.

The feeling was similar to the peaceful joy of surfing, but more intense and steady. I felt like myself, but this was a self I had never spent time in before. I was very much in my body, aware of the current of life flowing through me, and at the same time I could feel an extended sense of touch reaching out in all directions. I was in love with existence.

The experiment continued for weeks. I enjoyed going to the lab each afternoon and sitting there in the dark for hours, then walking out into the light and discovering a new world. I got used to living in this free and open state in which I just breezed through tasks that previously had been chores. I noticed that even taking calculus tests was easy; my mind was lucid, and I could remember a formula that I had glanced at the night before, then derive its applications right there during the test.

The heightened sensing and superb functioning lasted for a month or so after the experiment was over. It was a continuous and self- maintaining state. Then it started to fade away, and I missed it. The physiology lab seemed like an interesting place, and I needed a job, so I started to work there. At a meeting one afternoon, a female graduate student read from the Vijnana Bhairava Tantra, just a few lines of the conversation between Shakti and Shiva. Her words vibrated in the air with brilliance. After the meeting was over, I asked her about it. She handed me the book, a paperback copy of Zen Flesh, Zen Bones by Paul Reps. It was open to a page:

Radiant one, this experience may dawn between two breaths. After breath comes in (down) and just before turning up (out)—the beneficence.

As the breath turns from down to up, and again as breath curves from up to down—through both these turns, realize. 

As I read that, a quiet happiness filled my being. This description felt intimate and familiar, an echo of my experience in the lab. An electric current lit me up from the inside out, everywhere in my body. In one instant, everything changed. I was standing there in the lab, but the world was full of new possibilities, because the words in the book spoke to the heart of what happened during those hours in the dark room and afterwards. I immediately jumped into my car and drove to the nearest bookstore to buy the book. 

Standing there in the bookstore, I read:

Wandering in the ineffable beauty of Kashmir, above Srinagar I come upon the hermitage of Lakshmanjoo. It overlooks green rice fields, the garden, of Shalimar . . . Water streams down from a mountaintop. Here Lakshmanjoo—tall, full bodied, shining—welcomes me. He shares with me this ancient teaching from the Vigyan Bhairava and Sochanda Tantra, . . . and from it Lakshmanjoo has made the beginning of an English version. It presents 112 ways to open the invisible door of consciousness.

Hmm, I thought, so there is a teacher by the name of Lakshman Joo who lives this teaching, and he says there are many doors to consciousness and each one can be practiced. 

In this way, my first taste of the revelations the Vijnana Bhairava Tantra came from sitting in silence and darkness, with no knowledge of meditation. The next came through the written word, the sense of being electrified by the current of power behind the words of Lakshman Joo and Paul Reps. It was obvious to me that they were writing from inside the same pulsating current of life force that I was being introduced to.

My experience in the lab taught me that meditative attention occurs spontaneously. From the Bhairava Tantra I learned that there are many pathways into meditation. Learn to shift your attention slightly, and you will find them, and you will find the ones that are svanurupa, suited to your character (“natural, innate, well suited”). The life force flowing through the body invents techniques as needed—just tune in. These two insights, of the instinctive naturalness of meditation and the tremendous variety of approaches, have been guiding and inspiring me ever since. 

In 1987, after finishing my PhD, the thought came to do a fresh version of the text. Of course, at first I said, "Who, me? Certainly, in the whole world, there would be someone else would have put into English some of the music, poetic imagery, and tips for practice contained in the text." But eventually I said yes, and thus began my adventures in decoding the Sanskrit of the Vijnana Bhairava Tantra, and creating a fresh version. 

In 1991, I self-published an initial version, by the title, SUBTLE BODIES. It made its way around the world, in dancer and tantric circles. Every year for several years after that I would take a few months off, and spend all day, from around 4 in the morning until late in the afternoon, living inside the Sanskrit text, the practices it teaches, and the various ways of expressing it in English. The Sanskrit is so rich and intricately woven that it suggests dozens of meanings. I often come up with twenty or thirty different versions of each verse, and let dancers, yogis, and meditators select the one that is most interesting to them in terms of practice. Over the years, this has led to many different published versions, and eventually the Sounds True edition.

Finally I am ready to do the spoken word edition.

story:
Short Summary


  • My name is Kathleen, and I am a single mum of three wonderful children (9, 11 and 14) who works full-time, is in the final two semesters of her BA Hons in Illustration degree, and who is also a very passionate biker.
  • I am a complete book fanatic (mostly crime thrillers and Terry Pratchett) but I also like a good magazine to flick through. I love my bikes and thought I would like the press that is out there for bikers and yet I have been left cold by its lackluster female interest. According to DVLA statistics, there are 500,000 female bike license holders in the UK, so why is the industry so poor at pitching their press to this rapidly growing market? I did some surveying amongst my lady biker friends and got a lot of feedback, most of which was in agreement with my findings of nothing out there for women, only testosterone fueled pages and design that makes you feel that a lack of XY chromosomes means bikes are off limits. I set about getting a subscribers behind my project and managed to get the first edition off the ground hoping that the pace would continue to pick up a plethora of advertisers would help me keep the printing going, while my lovely lady subscribers kept the content rolling in.
  • My problem is, despite my best efforts, the advertisers have remained absent and I can't afford to print the now due second edition. I need the money to satisfy the current 250 subscribers with the next edition, and also to up the ante on marketing to persuade the advertising community that it will be a worthwhile publication to advertise in. I honestly believe that once the ball is really rolling this will be a success as there is so much I can offer that the standard biker mags can't, in that I have a personal connection with my readers, and am encouraging them to be my reporters, columnists and contributors. It is something they can call their own and be a part of, and hopefully, with the right support, it will become a hub for lady bikers worldwide!

What I Need & What You Get


  • My funding will go toward the printing costs (c.£1500) and postage (£400), as well as advertising the publication to encourage more subscribers and to pitching it at advertisers so they can offer their support in the future.
  • As a sponsor, you will get to advertise your business if you have one, your charity if you prefer or have mention of your support in the editorial. You get to choose how you are remunerated in fact. If you want to be part of the team, i.e. a partner in the business, I am even prepared to entertain that for your continued investment and support. It really is up to you!
  • If I don't make the entire amount, it will still go to the project as I have previously described. I fully intend to keep nagging people to get behind me until I am on my knees. I KNOW this project is worthwhile and will become a success if I get enough support, it's just getting people inspired enough to want to take female biking seriously - as seriously as I do!


Risks & Challenges


  • I am a professional graphic designer and marketer. I am solely managing the design and marketing of the publication and am happy to do that. I have a band of very willing supporters that include journalists and photographers as well as printers who are all doing their bit to make this happen. It isn't without risk - no investment is. Of course I may never be able to get this off the ground but the 4,500 Facebook supporters I have, and the 250 or so subscribers who have already got on board definitely feel it is something they want. I get a steady flow of interest and I just want to increase that and make this a force to be reckoned with, and something that becomes a brand to trip off the tongue like MCN or 100% Biker.
  • I don't give up easily and I already have a lot on my plate, yet I am prepared to take on more. I love challenges and hate being proved wrong. I am tenacious and confident. I am bold and almost precocious with my self belief when the bit is between my teeth. If I get the support I need, I will do my utmost to make it happen! I often get called a fixer in my professional life, and I believe this rings true with my projects...


Other Ways You Can Help


  • If you can't afford a fiver, don't worry, your desire to help can be actioned by sharing and spreading the word about The Lady Motorcyclist! Social Media is a contemporary bush telegraph - let it do the work!

And that's all there is to it - oh get your wallet out!!

story:
Revolutionary Art & Writing

Kevin Rashid Johnson is a political prisoner and the Minister of Defense for the New Afrikan Black Panther Party - Prison Chapter. He is an outspoken communist revolutionary whose life is in constant danger from assassination by the state. Rashid has worked to create a body of insightful political writings and powerful artwork that both educates and inspires comrades around the world. 

His first book, "Defying the Tomb" is the story of his political awakening and development, and features his insights through the correspondence between him and another revolutionary political prisoner, Outlaw. It is recommended reading to every revolutionary minded person fighting for liberation.

Now Rashid has needs your help to raise the funds necessary to continue his work as he prepares to publish a series of important revolutionary writings he has carefully worked to transmit despite brutal suppression and surveillance by the prison officials and agents of the state, and carefully transcribed by a team of volunteers. 

The Next Step

All funds raised will be applied directly to publishing costs. Even if the goal is not met, every single cent donated helps. 

Join the Struggle

Many of Rashid's works are freely available online at his blog: http://rashidmod.com/

Helping Rashid publish his books, essays, and art in physical format ensures that his essential work reaches the most people, and is made available to other prisoners, aiding the goal of the NABPP-PC to "transform the razor-wire plantations into schools of liberation"! 

Spread the Word!

Rashid's first book, "Defying the Tomb" can be purchased through from leftwingbooks.net, AK Press, and Amazon

You can also help by sharing this fundraiser, and Rashid's facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/kevinrashidjohnson on social media. 

To receive updates about Rashid’s writings and artwork, as well as his situation in prison, and news about other NABPP-PC members and comrades, sign up for Rashid's newsletter at http://rashidmod.com/?page_id=1160

story:
Barefoot loves books, even more than not covering their feet. We've worked day and night for over a year and now we're celebrating our anniversary by compiling our works crafted between 2014-15 and the stories of their production. We are printing 600 limited edition copies of hardcover, high quality books to be distributed across the world to design aficionados. We have until 17th of May to realise the project and make it as good as it can be. All the funds raised will be used towards the production and the delivery of the rewards and the books. 

Barefoot Design is established in Istanbul in 2014. We collaborate with designers from Istanbul and Berlin and we work and produce works on different mediums, from traditional media to web. We can take that small sketch you made on your notebook and turn it into a poster, t-shirt, letterhead, book, web site, magazine, chair, couch, tv, cat, elephant, car, truck, airplane, smell of freshly cut grass, dust on a lightbulb. 


The book will include a selection of illustrations and designs we have created between 2014-15 with the stories of their production, how they came to be realised from its inception to the final stage. It is a book of works and stories every design lover might be interested in. We've put in the creation of our works a great amount of love and now we want to preserve what they means to us through creating a book that will live forever.


FEATURES

  • 182 Pages
  • 212 x 300mm
  • Super smooth high-quality paper 
  • Hardcover 
  • Multi Colored


Funds that will be raised during the campaign will be used only for producing and delivering the rewards and 600 limited edition books. Rewards that include books does not count towards 600 copies. So we'll be printing at least 600. Since in addition to books rewards will include t-shirts, jumpers and posters, some of the budget will be used for preparing and delivering them. Here is a small infographic showing an estimated budget plan:



As for the schedule only delay after the completion of the campaign will be for producing 3 Art Director rewards if they will be chosen by the community. Since this reward includes creating 3 works from scratch through collaborating with you, it might take one or two months to complete it. We are estimating a three-month period at most for finishing the printing and necessary preparations for delivering the rewards and the books.


Producing books is very costly, especially if they are of high quality prints. Without your support this project might not be realised and we might never have the chance to make our works reach design lovers through the great form of a book. Also crowdfunding is a great way to make people involved in a project. We want you to be  a part of this process through your support, creativity and feedback and we need  you helping us make our book more awesome . Everyone loves books and there should be a lot more of them created with love and care.

Here is a collection of what our rewards include. We have a variety of perks for you to choose from and we'll be updating new ones during the campaign.




There are practically no risks involved -designs and illustrations that will be included in the book are already produced except the art director reward that will involve creating 3 (at most) new designs from scratch. We have found a wonderful printing house that will help us realise the production of the book. Now it is just a matter of reaching the target amount and start printing as soon as possible. 


When will the rewards be delivered?

We will start sending the perks as soon as the fundraiser will be completed. The only caveat might be that we'll need some time for creating 3 works included in the Art Director reward that might be chosen by potential funders. In that case we might need two months for starting sending the perks. If the Art Director reward won't find any funders we'll start printing within one month of the project's completion. 


How will you get me informed and reach me for rewards that need my feedback?

We will regularly update our campaign page for keeping you informed and we'll also contact you via e-mail -the one you've used for signing-up to Indiegogo- for other details regarding the rewards.
I liked one t-shirt or poster more than the other, can I choose between them?

Absolutely, before posting the rewards we'll contact you for hearing about which t-shirt or poster you prefer.
How will you give a design tour of Istanbul?

We'll meet with you in order to see the design landmarks in Istanbul during one day. This will be basically a small history class on the past and present of Istanbul's design culture. 
I have other questions, can I ask them?

Sure, just contact us from our profile page.
story_txt:
Barefoot loves books, even more than not covering their feet. We've worked day and night for over a year and now we're celebrating our anniversary by compiling our works crafted between 2014-15 and the stories of their production. We are printing 600 limited edition copies of hardcover, high quality books to be distributed across the world to design aficionados. We have until 17th of May to realise the project and make it as good as it can be. All the funds raised will be used towards the production and the delivery of the rewards and the books. 


Barefoot Design is established in Istanbul in 2014. We collaborate with designers from Istanbul and Berlin and we work and produce works on different mediums, from traditional media to web. We can take that small sketch you made on your notebook and turn it into a poster, t-shirt, letterhead, book, web site, magazine, chair, couch, tv, cat, elephant, car, truck, airplane, smell of freshly cut grass, dust on a lightbulb. 





The book will include a selection of illustrations and designs we have created between 2014-15 with the stories of their production, how they came to be realised from its inception to the final stage. It is a book of works and stories every design lover might be interested in. We've put in the creation of our works a great amount of love and now we want to preserve what they means to us through creating a book that will live forever.











FEATURES



182 Pages
212 x 300mm
Super smooth high-quality paper 
Hardcover 
Multi Colored




Funds that will be raised during the campaign will be used only for producing and delivering the rewards and 600 limited edition books. Rewards that include books does not count towards 600 copies. So we'll be printing at least 600. Since in addition to books rewards will include t-shirts, jumpers and posters, some of the budget will be used for preparing and delivering them. Here is a small infographic showing an estimated budget plan:


As for the schedule only delay after the completion of the campaign will be for producing 3 Art Director rewards if they will be chosen by the community. Since this reward includes creating 3 works from scratch through collaborating with you, it might take one or two months to complete it. We are estimating a three-month period at most for finishing the printing and necessary preparations for delivering the rewards and the books.


Producing books is very costly, especially if they are of high quality prints. Without your support this project might not be realised and we might never have the chance to make our works reach design lovers through the great form of a book. Also crowdfunding is a great way to make people involved in a project. We want you to be  a part of this process through your support, creativity and feedback and we need  you helping us make our book more awesome . Everyone loves books and there should be a lot more of them created with love and care.

Here is a collection of what our rewards include. We have a variety of perks for you to choose from and we'll be updating new ones during the campaign.








There are practically no risks involved -designs and illustrations that will be included in the book are already produced except the art director reward that will involve creating 3 (at most) new designs from scratch. We have found a wonderful printing house that will help us realise the production of the book. Now it is just a matter of reaching the target amount and start printing as soon as possible. 


When will the rewards be delivered?We will start sending the perks as soon as the fundraiser will be completed. The only caveat might be that we'll need some time for creating 3 works included in the Art Director reward that might be chosen by potential funders. In that case we might need two months for starting sending the perks. If the Art Director reward won't find any funders we'll start printing within one month of the project's completion. 




How will you get me informed and reach me for rewards that need my feedback?
We will regularly update our campaign page for keeping you informed and we'll also contact you via e-mail -the one you've used for signing-up to Indiegogo- for other details regarding the rewards.

I liked one t-shirt or poster more than the other, can I choose between them?
Absolutely, before posting the rewards we'll contact you for hearing about which t-shirt or poster you prefer.

How will you give a design tour of Istanbul?
We'll meet with you in order to see the design landmarks in Istanbul during one day. This will be basically a small history class on the past and present of Istanbul's design culture. 

I have other questions, can I ask them?
Sure, just contact us from our profile page.

story:
[Update!!

Oh my goodness, folks! I got into a literary program that’s even better for my needs and goals: VONA, founded by lmaz Abinader, Junot Díaz, Victor Díaz and Diem Jones in 1999, develops emerging writers of color through programs and workshops taught by established writers of color.Over 2,000 writers from around the globe have participated in VONA...and now, thanks to you, I get to be one of them!

The program cost is the same as it was for Lambda which is $1,350 and they awarded me a partial scholarship of $400. This means that with your generous support I’ll be able to attend with only spending a minimal amount from my own pocket. Thank you so much! Your support has been incredible and invaluable. I couldn’t have done it without you!

With gratitude,

Ola]


Short Summary

Dear Community,

I've been writing most of my life, but only in the past few years - through the gentle coaching of some incredible writing mentors and peers - have I started to value my literary voice. I was recently accepted into the prestigious VONA, which marks the first time any literary accomplishment of this sort has been bestowed on me. This people of color focused writers workshop, the only one of its kind throughout the US, will enable me to strengthen my craft and, eventually, access opportunities to get my essays and short stories published.

Here's more information about the workshop.


What We Need & What You Get

$1,350 is what I need to make this dream of mine come true.Your contributions will be essential in helping me cover the retreat's tuition and expenses.


The Impact

By donating to my fundraising campaign, you're helping to add to the chorus of queer and trans African literary voices. For many of us, intense and virulent homophobia/transphobia means that our bodies become sites of state-sanctioned violence, while our stories are sensationalized and/or invisibilized. I want my writing to give voice to those African activists who have to organize in the shadows, and embolden others who have nowhere to turn and no resources to support them. I want my writing to paint a more colorful and layered picture of what being Nigerian can look like. VONA represents an opportunity for grounding in my mission as a writer and a chance to find the structure, instruction, mentorship and community I need to grow my craft. You can help me manifest this mission by adding your support to my campaign. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps! Helping to spread this word about my fundraising campaign - posting about it on your social media pages or emailing your friends about it - can also be quite impactful.

story:
Behind The Books

Aaron Hughes, Managing Director of RRPI sits down with author J.K. Harrison and discusses his unconventional approach and how he plans to turn the publishing world on it's head for reader and writer alike.

Q: When first coming up with the idea for RRPI, what was the thought process? If you could pick a few things that you wanted to do differently than the competition, what would you say those are?

A: The thought process behind the creation of RRPI was to end the elitism. I was a real estate agent after I got out of the Marine Corps, as such I provided a service to buy and sell homes. There was no legal requirement behind our position, only the tradition and ease of completion to use an agent. The same is true about the current publishing industry. There is a sense of "You need us".

Not anymore. Anyone can publish a book through a wide variety of means. So what do you need a publishing company for? What point is there to have one sign you? Exposure? They commonly target authors who have a large social media following. Marketing assistance? Not much. Generally they'll plop a few shares and that's it. So this is where I thought of something different.

I want to open the flood gates and mentor authors. I want their bright and wonderful ideas, I want to help mold them into something that can bring merriment to the masses. I want to help them grow into something fantastic. So I thought "How do you do that?" I bounced ideas off of my wife and Ashley, our Branding Director, and came up with a solid concept.

RRPI is a company that goes after the small fry to help them complete their dream of becoming a professional author. We figure out how they work, how they think, and what they need that they can't easily do themselves. Some people need a boot in the rear end, whereas others need to know that what they're writing isn't garbage, while some just need a timeline for completing work.

Every unknown author has been tread upon by society, their friends and family, publishing companies or more. With each submission for a contest, or query, I give them an answer, “Yes” or “No”, but more importantly, why. I detail what I liked and disliked about their story. Where I would go with it and what they should do. Currently there are two people who submitted to me for publishing and I told them to go back and fix things then I'll sign them. It is a test to see if they can adapt.

So in short, RRPI is about the author bringing their best, adapting their best to give the reader the easiest path into their mind. A path to see the worlds and characters that are hidden away. A path to bring joy and love, adventure and intrigue, and so much more to the world.

Q: When you say you accept all submissions, that means you're giving everything a fair chance, right?

A: Correct. We accept submissions for consideration to publish from any genre and experience level. We also do not limit submission times to certain dates like other companies. We believe this hinders the possibility to have creative people come to us. Creativity doesn't know timetables.

Q: So would you say you focus more on creativity than the average company?

A: We focus on the author and their creative process. We take time to understand their abilities and limitations and work with them to bring out their best for the reader.

Q: My understanding of traditional publishing is limited, but it seems like authors have more input with RRPI than the average publisher. How intentional is that?

A: One-hundred-percent intentional. When I created RRPI, I wanted authors to work with us through the process and learn what needs to be done. Not sit in the dark and wait for orders. If they know what it takes, they build trust with RRPI and it becomes easier with each book that comes through the mill.

Q: You don't have genre limitations and you have said you don't go after an established author. Is there something particular you're trying to offer readers that you feel like they aren't currently being offered by the industry?

A: Open creativity. With genres and established authors you get preconceived notions. With a mix of genres or new authors you get surprises. It's a way to bring new things to the world of literature and show that not everything needs to be put neatly into a box. The real world is messy and so are the worlds that our authors create. RRPI wants to bring a whirlwind through the literary community and we want every reader to be caught up in the flow.

Q: With that in mind, what is your process for deciding if an author and work would be a good fit with RRPI? What kind of issues are you willing to help an author work through that more traditional publishers would move past?

A: I don't look at the word count or the genre. I don't care about that. A good story is something that speaks to you. If I get that feeling of hunger to read more while reading someone's submission, I love it. If I don't realize how long it took me to read it, I dive after the author to get them to sign with me. I will work through most any issue with an author. We have a few authors that have severe anxiety issues, others with families that take precedence, not to mention day jobs. Our job as a publishing house should be to make sure that our authors are happy; happy authors equal productive authors. Authors who feel included, who feel communicated to, who feel that their needs are important to the publishing house will work harder than anyone else out there. Its how I've always treated people I work with and people in my personal life. It's how I got my wife to marry me, well that and constant pestering until she said yes.

Q: How does RRPI balance the unforgiving business world with the creative process? Those two things usually seem at odds with each other.

A: They very much are. We work with the author to establish what real life requirements they have and set dates, goals, deadlines, etc. based off that. It's like balancing a truck on a toothpick, but it is possible. The key is to be as aggressive as your life allows you to. To plan far ahead of time so that you have plenty room for error and adaptation.

Q: You mentioned being a real estate agent and there is definitely an undertone of the Marine Corps in some of your answers. Are there things from these other fields that you think offer an edge?

A: I think that one must experience life before they move into what they want and are meant to be. As a real estate agent I had to field my own business opportunities by finding clients out of the blue. It allowed me to work independently and develop my own style of business management and leadership. As a Marine, of course it lends a lot to my perspective. Everything in business needs to be looked at coldly and my training taught me how to look at a problem from an outside perspective.

Q: Awesome. That leads directly into my next question. How do you plan to do that? We've talked a good bit about what you're offering authors, but what about the competition? Do you view other publishing venues--traditional, indie, self--as competition?

A: I don't believe that they are competition. They have different talent, different books, and different perspectives. RRPI is unique just as every other publishing house or self-publisher is unique. We bring our own sense of flare and style to the scene just as they do. I plan to revolutionize the publishing scene by producing quality books while shoving against the stigma that you must define your own niche in publishing in order to develop credibility. I believe consistency and customer service creates credibility. That is what I plan to offer and plan to execute by our daily existence as a company.

Q: What advice do you have for people who are still trying to get to the point of being ready to publish and maybe feeling overwhelmed by the whole process?

A: The answer is always “no” unless you ask. Just stop, breathe for a moment, and move on. If you get rejected, it's all right. Everyone has been rejected, they know how you feel. You aren't alone. I've fought just like you have to find my place in the world. I've fought to accomplish my dreams, to come back from nothing. I and many others are right there beside you. You may not see us, but you're on the same trail as we are. Remember this and persist. I want to see what story you have to tell, and so does the rest of the world. Keep writing, things will get better.

Synopsis

Larissa Markus is a humble clerk in a clothing shop with a hidden past when she is swept off her feet by the charismatic Professor.  Their whirlwind romance explodes in her face and leads her down a tumultuous path of adventure, intrigue, love and violence.  Airships, pirates, corsets, torture, murder, and more await in the first novel of the Blood and Destiny Series from E.C. Jarvis.

The Machine is an adult steampunk fantasy book. Possible triggers are present within the book including but not limited to sex, murder, torture, and violence.

The Prologue of The Machine

 


PROLOGUE

    Cid reached up to scratch his head. He grunted when the attempt was thwarted by the strap of his goggles and the thick leather glove on his hand. It had escaped his mind that he was wearing either. He looked at his hand for a moment, debating whether the itch was irritating enough to warrant taking off the glove and removing his goggles. He opted to use the spanner in his left hand to get it instead.
    “Fucking pointless,” he muttered to himself and then threw the spanner back into his toolbox, knocking off the blueprints that sat on top. The box jostled and the lid slammed shut.
    The machine stood in front of him, dominating the room. Its outer shell, constructed from brass and silver, had two great domes that reached up to the ceiling of the control room. It was finished. The steam turbine had been tested and the cooling systems were in place, the condensers and pumps ready to work and every wire connected. The only thing missing was the fuel—the Anthonium.
    Cid chewed on his nail; he didn’t stop when the leather of his glove came between his teeth instead of his fingernail. Absentmindedly, he chewed on the glove instead.
    “How long has he been gone?” Cid called to one of the workers nearby. The short and rotund man looked up at the clock on the wall and then glanced back.
    “Umm, an hour?” the man said with a shrug before scuttling off to get on with his work.
    “Awfully useful, you are,” Cid grumbled. He headed to the machine and fiddled with the controls inside a hatch, muttering to himself.
    The door to the room on the level above opened and Cid turned to look up at the balcony. The Professor entered, his long blond hair flowing with each stride. Cid had expected his employer to bring the Anthonium in so they could test the machine tonight. Instead, the Professor had brought a girl with him. Her own mop of blond curls bobbed as they walked together into the room.
    Cid scrunched up his face. He tried to remind himself that this was the Professor’s project. His pride and joy, his design, built with his money, and if he wanted to show it off for the sake of some skirt, that was his choice. Still, it didn’t stop Cid from feeling irked by the situation. Not that he would dare allude to that fact.
    “What does it do?” Cid heard the young woman ask.
    “It’s a small-scale fission reactor, used to generate power through a sustained chain reaction. The heat generated from the reaction with the core element is passed through a fluid, which releases steam. The steam powers a set of turbines which pass a charge to a generator.”
    Cid sunk his forehead into his hand as he listened to the Professor attempt to explain the most complex machine in the entire world to someone who clearly had no concept of it. It was like listening to a physics Professor explain the workings of the universe to a monkey.
    “It will do wonders for our world, Larissa,” the Professor continued. “This will give us incredible power, make our furnaces obsolete, and block out the winter. With this, we’ll be masters of our enemies. I need only one more element to make it work.”
    Cid just about managed to stop himself from bursting into fits of hysterical laughter when he heard the Professor promising all kinds of love and affection to the poor, startled creature in exchange for the one thing Cid needed—and perhaps a few more things the Professor desired.
    Before Cid realized it, the girl had agreed. Now, she handed over her necklace, complete with the Anthonium they’d been so desperate to find. Cid watched with one eye between his fingers as the Professor scooped her into an embrace and dropped the necklace over the balcony.
    Cid caught it. He uncurled the fingers of his glove. It was a much smaller sample than he had planned for, but it didn’t matter. It was enough. He ripped the chain of the necklace from the stone, discarded it, and turned to the machine.
    One side panel was open; a small housing sat ready for the Anthonium. He inserted the stone into the clips and stood back. In his haste he forgot to shut the panel. Sweat dripped from his brow. His heart thumped inside his chest as he took to the controls and prodded the buttons.
    The machine clicked and whirred into life. The initial readouts were good. The generator was operational. The cooling towers came online. From one second to the next, the entire thing had come alive, and most importantly of all...
    “By the Gods!” Cid yelled. “It’s working, Professor. It’s fucking working.”
    The Professor turned, smiling down at Cid until the girl grabbed him, resuming the kiss. Some odd noises came from the direction of the door on the level above; several thumps that didn’t sound like knocking. Without warning, the entire doorway exploded inwards with a deafening boom. Chunks of wall and wood shattered. The aftershock from the blast sent the Professor and the girl tumbling over the balcony. Cid turned, grabbed the blueprint on his toolbox, and rushed for cover behind one of the tall cabinets, his heart thumping against his ribs.
    The sound of gunshots echoed around the room, followed by a hiss. Cid shut his eyes tight and waited. It had all been a waste, a complete and utter waste of time and effort. A final, massive explosion rocked the entire building to the core. Something smacked into the side of his head and blackness surrounded him.
    He awoke scrunched in a ball behind the cabinet. The acrid smell of smoke assaulted his senses. As he tried to breathe, his lungs protested the lack of clean air. Cid crawled out into hazy darkness. What remained of the machine still burned, billowing smoke and ash into the room. The roar of the fire blocked any other sounds. Bodies charred nearby in the flames.
    Through the smoke he saw the young woman sprawled out on her back; the Professor was gone. Cid crawled toward her, dragging himself along and keeping as low to the ground as he could. As he drew close to the fire, he realized he still clutched the blueprints—the only copy. He passed one final glance up at the machine, tossed the blueprint into the flames, and reached out to grab the girl. She seemed to be the only thing left to save.
