grunted when the attempt was thwarted by the strap of his goggles and the thick
leather glove on his hand. It had escaped his mind that he was wearing either.
He looked at his hand for a moment, debating whether the itch was irritating
enough to warrant taking off the glove and removing his goggles. He opted to
use the spanner in his left hand to get it instead.    “Fucking pointless,” he
muttered to himself and then threw the spanner back into his toolbox, knocking
off the blueprints that sat on top. The box jostled and the lid slammed shut.    The machine stood in front of him,
dominating the room. Its outer shell, constructed from brass and silver, had
two great domes that reached up to the ceiling of the control room. It was
finished. The steam turbine had been tested and the cooling systems were in
place, the condensers and pumps ready to work and every wire connected. The
only thing missing was the fuel—the Anthonium.    Cid chewed on his
nail; he didn’t stop when the leather of his glove came between his teeth
instead of his fingernail. Absentmindedly, he chewed on the glove instead.    “How long has he been
gone?” Cid called to one of the workers nearby. The short and rotund man looked
up at the clock on the wall and then glanced back.    “Umm, an hour?” the
man said with a shrug before scuttling off to get on with his work.    “Awfully useful, you
are,” Cid grumbled. He headed to the machine and fiddled with the controls
inside a hatch, muttering to himself.    The door to the room
on the level above opened and Cid turned to look up at the balcony. The
Professor entered, his long blond hair flowing with each stride. Cid had
expected his employer to bring the Anthonium
in so they could test the machine tonight.
Instead, the Professor had brought a girl with him. Her own mop of blond curls
bobbed as they walked together into the room.    Cid scrunched up his
face. He tried to remind himself that this was the Professor’s project. His
pride and joy, his design, built with his money, and if he wanted to show it
off for the sake of some skirt, that was his choice. Still, it didn’t stop Cid from
feeling irked by the situation. Not that he would dare allude to that fact.    “What does it do?”
Cid heard the young woman ask.    “It’s a small-scale
fission reactor, used to generate power through a sustained chain reaction. The
heat generated from the reaction with the core element is passed through a
fluid, which releases steam. The steam powers a set of turbines which pass a
charge to a generator.”    Cid sunk his forehead
into his hand as he listened to the Professor attempt to explain the most
complex machine in the entire world to someone who clearly had no concept of
it. It was like listening to a physics Professor explain the workings of the
universe to a monkey.    “It will do wonders
for our world, Larissa,” the Professor continued. “This will give us incredible
power, make our furnaces obsolete, and block out the winter. With this, we’ll
be masters of our enemies. I need only one more element to make it work.”    Cid just about
managed to stop himself from bursting into fits of hysterical laughter when he
heard the Professor promising all kinds of love and affection to the poor,
startled creature in exchange for the one thing Cid needed—and perhaps a few
more things the Professor desired.    Before Cid realized
it, the girl had agreed. Now, she handed over her necklace, complete with the Anthonium they’d been so desperate to find.
Cid watched with one eye between his fingers as the Professor scooped her into
an embrace and dropped the necklace over the balcony.    Cid caught it. He
uncurled the fingers of his glove. It was a much smaller sample than he had
planned for, but it didn’t matter. It was enough. He ripped the chain of the
necklace from the stone, discarded it, and turned to the machine.    One side panel was
open; a small housing sat ready for the Anthonium.
He inserted the stone into the clips and stood back. In his haste he forgot to
shut the panel. Sweat dripped from his brow. His heart thumped inside his chest
as he took to the controls and prodded the buttons.    The machine clicked
and whirred into life. The initial readouts were good. The generator was
operational. The cooling towers came online. From one second to the next, the
entire thing had come alive, and most importantly of all...    “By the Gods!” Cid
yelled. “It’s working, Professor. It’s fucking working.”    The Professor turned,
smiling down at Cid until the girl grabbed him, resuming the kiss. Some odd
noises came from the direction of the door on the level above; several thumps
that didn’t sound like knocking. Without warning, the entire doorway exploded
inwards with a deafening boom. Chunks of wall and wood shattered. The
aftershock from the blast sent the Professor and the girl tumbling over the
balcony. Cid turned, grabbed the blueprint on his toolbox, and rushed for cover
behind one of the tall cabinets, his heart thumping against his ribs.    The sound of gunshots
echoed around the room, followed by a hiss. Cid shut his eyes tight and waited.
It had all been a waste, a complete and utter waste of time and effort. A
final, massive explosion rocked the entire building to the core. Something
smacked into the side of his head and blackness surrounded him.    He awoke scrunched in
a ball behind the cabinet. The acrid smell of smoke assaulted his senses. As he
tried to breathe, his lungs protested the lack of clean air. Cid crawled out
into hazy darkness. What remained of the machine still burned, billowing smoke
and ash into the room. The roar of the fire blocked any other sounds. Bodies charred
nearby in the flames.    Through the smoke he
saw the young woman sprawled out on her back; the Professor was gone. Cid
crawled toward her, dragging himself along and keeping as low to the ground as
he could. As he drew close to the fire, he realized he still clutched the
blueprints—the only copy. He passed one final glance up at the machine, tossed
the blueprint into the flames, and reached out to grab the girl. She seemed to
be the only thing left to save.

story:
The Problem:

  • poverty - the basic human need to eat

The Solution: A book to feed the homeless

  • create a recurring revenue stream (money) for 3 front-line agencies
  • inform/teach people how to cook food for a shelter (cooking for a group of people) by providing them with over 50 recipes that include instructions for how to cook the dish for 30 or more people.

Your help will help us to help others.

With your support we will be able to finish the first draft, and finalize the eBook that can then go on sale to generate revenue for a shelter/soup-kitchen, a food bank and an emergency low barrier youth shelter.


The Story Behind Why a Cookbook?

Every night during the fall and winter in Victoria BC, everyday, ordinary people volunteer to make meals for thirty plus at risk youth . These volunteer chefs make an enormous difference, because for most of the youth who seek shelter and a warm, safe place to sleep for the night, this meal is the only food they will eat for an entire day.

It was in 2003, during time volunteering with the Out of the Rain that I discovered how these homeless young people were fed. I learned that the food being served was provided by volunteers who would plan, cook, and deliver this meal for the group of thirty plus. But there was a problem. There were other people who wanted to help, but who had no idea how to cook a meal for that many people. As someone who was both a foodie and who had worked in kitchens in my youth, I had always assumed it was a simple process to take a recipe for 4 and convert it to a recipe for 30.  I learned this was not always the case.

It was out of this need that this idea was born. Inspired by the work of Jamie Oliver (Fifteen Foundation) and Jon Bon Jovi (JBJ Soul Foundation) and driven by wanting to give back, I came up with the idea for a cookbook for volunteer chefs, those angels in the kitchen who give back. From there, the idea evolved. What if proceeds from the sales of the cookbook could be funnelled to help a few agencies? What if beyond enabling people to help, the book itself could directly support these front line programs?

In Victoria BC alone there are over 80 agencies that deal with poverty. And still people go hungry every day in our beautiful city. What if there was a way to enable people, those who know how to cook, or who want to learn to cook to help? And what if at the same time you could create a recurring revenue stream for three agencies that deal with the issue daily?

So I started to research ideas. Over the next few years I talked to people who worked in soup kitchens and food banks. I talked to people on both sides of the poverty equation: those in need and those giving back. From the then Mayor of Victoria to a local farmer, who had the “crazy idea” to help out a street person. I discovered there were inspirational stories right under our noses… stories that I felt deserved be shared. Stories to remind us all you don’t have to be a millionaire or a celebrity to make a difference.

And so Angels in the Kitchen was born.  A cookbook that’s not just a cookbook, but rather the stories of why people give back and who the people are who take the time to help those in need. A book that is more than a book, that is hopefully an inspiration and resource to others as well as an additional revenue funding source for some of the agencies that assist those on the front-lines.

Angels in the Kitchen - a cookbook for and about those Angels who give back.

People need to eat. 

People buy cookbooks.

What if you could take money that was generated from the sales of an eBook (or print edition) and give it to three front line agencies (an emergency youth shelter, a food bank and a local shelter/soup kitchen) that every day deal with the issue of feeding those without?

What if you took a team of professionals (photographers, writers, editors), and you added a bunch of skilled and talented marketing and business gurus and instead of a project for a corporate client, the client was the three agencies that could benefit from profits made from the sale of a book?

What if you included social workers, front-line case workers, and directors from agencies as well as local government officials as part of the project to help raise awareness about the actual causes and existing gaps that exist?

What if a book could be an agent of social change?

"enable people to help give back by informing them of the real needs while presenting real (albeit small) solutions (the recipes)"

What if a people believed this could be done?

The People

  • 25 volunteer chefs
  • 15 professional chefs
  • 10 agencies
  • 5 leaders

The Recipes

  • Two recipes from each volunteer chef.
  • Two recipes from each professional chef, including one made using ingredients commonly given out by food bank.
  • Two recipes from each agency, with help and advice from them on where the gaps are and how we can help.
  • Two recipes from each leader.

Recipes will come with instructions for servings for:

  • a single person
  • family of four to five
  • group servings to serve up to 30

In The Book

Chapters will include but are not limited to:

  • “It doesn’t have to taste like hell.” Cooking with donated food.
  • “Stone Soup” How to make it go around.
  • “Informed Shopping” How to spend those precious few dollars and get the healthiest bang for you buck.
  • “Burnt Water” The Basics
  • “K.I.S.S.” - common sense and old world concepts for eating & cooking
  • “It’s a Big World out there” An introduction to ethnic cooking
  • “So you don’t like food” - picky eaters, young and old

These recipes will come from people just like you and I. From the professional chefs who own, run and cook at award winning restaurants to your 80 year old aunt who just loves to cook. There will be interviews with these real people who are already working to make a difference today. Interviews and case studies looking at how agencies, government, media and people in a modern country are trying to solve the basic human need for food. The stories of those who give back by being themselves, and in turn are authentic Angels in the Kitchen

The Goal: $14,000.00 CDN

The goal of the campaign is to raise $14,000.00 CND to create an eBook (with a print edition coming later).

The breakdown of funding is as follows:

  • 9% Indiegogo fee
  • 6% give back to the Indiegogo community
  • 25% to finish content creation (interviews, documentation, photography,)
  • 25% first edition draft for publication (editors, proofing, writing, desktop publishing)
  • 17% marketing and promotions
  • 10% perks for supporters


The Perks

  • $1.00 gets your name on the website as a supporter.
  • $5.00 gets your name included in the eBook.
  • $10.00 gets your name in the eBook and a SFP art Thank You card.
  • $20.00 gets your name in the book, and a SFP 5X7 SFP Art Postcard.
  • $50.00 gets your name in the book, a copy of the eBook.
  • $100.00 gets your name in the book, a copy of the eBook, and a SFP 8X10 SFP studio print.
  • $250.00 gets your name in the book, a copy of the eBook, and a SFP 11X14 SFP studio print.
  • $500.00 gets your name in the book, a copy of the eBook, a SFP 11X14 SFP studio print, and an Angels in the Kitchen T-shirt.
  • $1000.00 gets your name in the book, a copy of the eBook, and your choice of an Angels in the Kitchen apron or tote-bag.

Estimated delivery of finished first draft ready for publication is August 1, 2015.

The Team

This project is being lead by me, Scott Fraser. I’ve lived through poverty and homelessness myself as a teen and young adult, and I was lucky enough to make it out. I know all too well what it’s like to go hungry. I believe that if you teach people how good it feels to give back and help others, that they themselves will pass along that important message. But this isn’t about me, or my experience with poverty, it’s about enabling people to help others. 

Since the early 1990's I've been volunteering and helping out because I believed it was important to give back. Professionally during the past 20 plus years, I've worked in marketing and information technologies with skill sets that include photography, writing and online marketing. Over the years I’ve studied social work and related issues at the post secondary level because I needed to understand why the policies and practices that always seem to not be enough were what they were. My professional work as a photographer and photojournalist includes documenting the issues of poverty and those who give back. From a personal perspective, I’ve been there. I first was on the streets as a teenager at the age of fifteen. It was people like these volunteers and agencies that more than once kept me fed. I had been lucky enough to learn how to cook from my grandmother and mother and it is a skill I am grateful to have had passed down to me. As an adult I’ve known what it’s like to try to feed a family on a tight budget. 

But this is not a one person project. The team of professionals who are contributing their own expertise to make this project happen is we believe will take it from a dream to a reality. From writers and editors to agency directors and social workers, marketing and SEO (search engine optimization) experts, the team of people who are making this possible are some of the very best in their respected fields. From the chefs and business owners to the staff at the agencies who work daily to provide food, this project is about people making a difference and I am humbled and pleased to be working with such a great bunch of people.

They suggest when you are setting up your campaign to “Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.”

Any funds received will be applied as laid out in the funding breakdown. The project will continue as the people who believe it will work to get it finished. Personally, I’d rather describe where the funds will go if we exceed our goal. If that happens, the project will push forward with the print edition and more money will go to helping feed those in need. And what if we pass the print edition? Any and all funds above the print edition cost will be split amoung three agencies and 10% going back to the Indiegogo community.

story:
YOU ARE AN AMAZING, KICK-ASS SOUL.

Namaskaram!

You must've all heard about the story of the guy who throws starfishes back into the ocean, and when a person walks up and tells him that throwing one single starfish into the ocean doesnt make much of a difference, because there are millions of starfish on the beach here, the guy replies, “It made a difference to this one!”, and he throws another starfish in. I, for one, believe that this is an example for unconditional love and support, given to one person at a time.

If every single person in the world loved themselves, unconditionally, and are there for themselves, no matter what happens, what would that look like? How would it change their lives?

Majority of people in the world today, are afraid to voice their opinions. Are afraid to stand up for what they believe in. Are afraid to do something unconventional with their lives.

Why?

“The Society”. This is the answer we get.

“You are living in a society, and you have to be like how the rest of them are. Thats the rule.” and “You cant go about doing your own stuff in the society. What will people think?”

Please tell me one thing here. Who is the 'Society'? Aren't we the society? A group of people put together? Then why is the society stopping us from doing what feels best for us? Fear, anger, jealousy, love?


If every person feels into himself/herself, at the very core, they'll find that they are made of love. If and when people learn to express themselves fully in everything they do, with no suppression or oppression of any kind, can you imagine how open the world would be, and how beautiful and loving the world can get? Huge right??

This is my vision for all the people in the world. To provide unconditional love and support for you to live your life in the grandest version that you've ever known, or even, have ever imagined.

My Vision for my country:

I come from India, the colourful land of spirituality and magic, culture and heritage, and, royalty and unity in diversity! But these days, India is losing its colour, its culture, and its heritage with the so-called attempts to 'modernize' and 'develop' India to become one of the developed countries. My Vision for my country, is to make sure from my end, that its culture, spirituality, its various colours, and its rich heritage, are retained, as India makes its way to become a 'Developed' country.


FROM EXIST TO LIVE.

Just about one year ago, I started working on an experiment on myself. I wanted to see what it takes to live my life to my fullest, and live it. I wanted to know what my purpose was, in this life. I wanted to stop just existing, and start Living! It definitely wasn’t easy, but it was worth the pain. I wasn't working alone though. I had the unconditional love and support of a few really amazing souls, including me!

This book is about what I was earlier – a clueless person, a depressed soul, a procrastinator, a couch potato, you name it! I was filled with various inferiority complexes, jealousy, shame and anger towards myself and the society. - And how I have transformed into a soul who is aware of her purpose, someone who's filled to the brim- and overflowing with unconditional love, a healthy eater, and an aspiring runner. I am now working on keeping myself fit.

I believe that if the methods I followed could help me so much, then they can help you too!


HOW YOU CAN HELP:

I need your help to spread this love all over the world. In order to publish my book, editing, the work on cover designs, publishing and promoting my book, all of these require a lot of financial investment. Also, to be able to serve you better as a Life Coach, I've also hired a coach, Jordanna Eyre, to mentor me and support me with my own deep work. In exchange for your contribution, you have my gratitude, and you can also choose from a range of life-changing programs and offers, that will help you in your journey while you discover yourself, and your highest truth. 

I have set a goal of $9500 to cover these costs, but if I receive more than what I asked for, I will publish the hard copy of my book, and will work on making my website a more user friendly one, and also on giving out more freebies on my website.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE:

If you cant contribute, but would like to support my project:

  1. You can share the project link on your social media page, and email it to your friends and family. You can use the Indiegogo share tools (upper left) to do that.
  2. If you know someone who can support, promote, or contribute in anyway towards this campaign, please connect me!

world. To provide unconditional love and support for you to live your life in
the grandest version that you've ever known, or even, have ever imagined.
My Vision for my country:
I come from India, the colourful land of
spirituality and magic, culture and heritage, and, royalty and unity in
diversity! But these days, India is losing its colour, its culture, and its
heritage with the so-called attempts to 'modernize' and 'develop' India to
become one of the developed countries. My Vision for my country, is to make
sure from my end, that its culture, spirituality, its various colours, and its
rich heritage, are retained, as India makes its way to become a 'Developed'
country.
FROM EXIST TO LIVE.
Just about one year ago, I started working
on an experiment on myself. I wanted to see what it takes to live my life to my
fullest, and live it. I wanted to know what my purpose was, in this life. I
wanted to stop just existing, and start Living! It definitely wasn’t easy, but
it was worth the pain. I wasn't working alone though. I had the unconditional
love and support of a few really amazing souls, including me! 
This book is about what I was earlier – a
clueless person, a depressed soul, a procrastinator, a couch potato, you name
it! I was filled with various inferiority complexes, jealousy, shame and anger
towards myself and the society. - And how I have transformed into a soul who is
aware of her purpose, someone who's filled to the brim- and overflowing with
unconditional love, a healthy eater, and an aspiring runner. I am now working
on keeping myself fit. 
I believe that if the methods I followed
could help me so much, then they can help you too!
